story:
Hi, I'm Rex and a U.S. Navy veteran fulfilling my lifelong dream of owning my own hot rod and custom car shop.  I have 30 yrs of automotive experience which includes custom paint, metal fabrication, brakes, engine work and suspension.

  Above: E-Brake converted into the gear shift

During my time in the Navy, I worked on hydraulic systems, flight control, air frame, metal fabrication, corrosion control and fiberglass.

After leaving my job at a machine shop, prior to joining the Navy, I decided that I didn’t want to work for anyone else again. That is when I started thinking about having my own business, to be my own boss.  After losing my dad, then my best friend and the fear of failing, I sunk into a deep depression.  I turned to the V.A. for help and it was them that told me to "go for your dreams and follow your heart".  In 2014, my vision of owning my own business started to become a reality.  Having my own business will allow me to openly create one-of-a-kind rolling automotive art. 

Above:  1955 Chrysler tail lights on a 1955 Chevy First Series Chevy Pick Up

Above and Below:  Fabricating the dash

I have the location and some equipment.  After being turned down by several banks for a loan, I am seeking $25,000 to purchase the rest of the equipment and materials that will help generate more business and increase sales.  Equipment need is a 2 and 4 post car lift $7000; upgrade towing winch $800; complete the build of our office $2000; upgrade computer $1100; misc fabrication tools and equipment (prices vary)  The remaining funding will go towards keeping the shop running and the lights on. 

 

Above:  1955 First Series Chevy Pick-up

Below:  1955 First Series Chevy Pick-up with the roof chopped and visor added

If you can't help financially, not to worry.  You can still do your part by sharing this page with your friends and family.  Any contribution is welcome and much appreciated.  Thank you!!

story:
Our story  

     We are a group of college students with different majors and interest in life. Our passionate in badminton is what bring us together. Badminton is a fast paced, exciting and beginners friendly sport. Because of those reasons, the number of players in Bay Area in general, and San Jose, in particular, are increasing day by day. Along with that is the need for badminton courts. There are public open gyms and badminton club in the area. But, open gyms are only open during the weekend for a very short period of time. Despite the fact that badminton clubs are getting expensive, they are still packed with people. Most of the time you have to wait very long until a court is open. In additional, there is no local gym in San Jose. We have to travel very far everytime we want to play. Understand the need of our community, we intended to raise money in order to give everyone an alternative option when it comes to badminton with the urge to give back as soon as possible.   

What We Need & What You Get  

     Straight to the point, our goal is to reach 65,365$ by campaign ending. Here are the details:   

  1. Initial down payment to start our leasing term at the property: 50,408$  
  2. Fulfilling order of court mats ship from China: 7,862$ (15,112.53 square feet)  
  3. Fulfilling order of net poles also ship from China: 2090$ (13 pairs)  
  4. Estimated cost of shipping from port to our gym: approximate 2000$   
  5. Estimated cost of smaller equipment and supplies (such as nets, birdy, court tape, office supplies, etc): 3000$  

     Our gym will have 13 courts in total. Will have seats along the side so you sit, relax or wait until it's your turn to play. We will also have designated resting area and room for you to store your personal belonging. Students can now enjoy a mind free day of badminton as we arrange chairs and table for you to do your homework. We will try to has wifi also, but it will not be a guarantee at the opening. Now, let's talk about what we all curious about, entrance fee and membership.  

     Our entrance fee has no time limit. There are 3 categories:   

  1. High school students and under: 5$ (with a valid school ID)  
  2. College students: 6$ (with a valid college ID)  
  3. Adults: 8$   

     Membership is also divided into 3 similar categories with no limit access:  

  1. High school student and under: 35$/month (with a valid school ID)  
  2. College students: 45$/month (with a valid college ID)  
  3. Adults: 55$/month   

     That's not all. When signing up for membership as a group of 2, you will each get a 5$ off your first month. Group of 4 will get 10$ off. Group of 8 or more will get 15$ off. Noted: this is only applied on your first month of membership with us.  

     Along with that we too are invited coaches from all level to come and borrow our courts for training purposes. Price is negotiable. We promise to keep it low and reasonable. Coaches are our hope to expand our fast growing badminton community.  

     Due to our size, we are going to operate a little different than our the clubs. We will open every day of the week, from 9 am to 12 pm. Renting court for training or competition purposes will be from 9 am to 6 pm. After 6 pm all court will available for challenge. Winners stay. When you lose you can sign up at the bottom and wait until your turn. Only sign up one court at a time, so other have a chance to play. We divided the number of courts into 3 levels. There are beginners, intermediate and advance. There will be 4 courts for each level. The final court is free for all. That means everyone can sign up. Same rules applied for all level.  

Our Challenge & Ways That You Can help  

     Since we are a startup. It is as little as no one knows about us. Although we are making an effort to gain notoriety, but without your help, we won't be able to make it. Share us on social media. Spread information about our campaign among your friends. We are in an early stage of a business so any suggest, feedback or investment is priceless to us. Your feedbacks and funding are the fuel which helps to jump-start our campaign. Perks are no brainer. Be sure to check them out. No help is too small.   

Our Promise  

     We see there is a need, and we try to fulfill it. Our business will not focus on profit, but to maintain our daily operation. We will stay true to our root. All feedbacks are valued. Give us your support, so we can both be reliable and affordable badminton gym that you can come every day.  

Contact Us  

Email: expexsport@gmail.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Expex-Badminton-Club-1...

story:
Summary

We are Cool Cup Smoothies!

I’m the owner/operator born and raised in Indianapolis, IN known as the crossroads of America. I’ve spent my life in some form or fashion in service to others. In retail, customer service, or in the corporate sector for almost 20 years I’ve honed my business skills. As a company we’re committed to increasing opportunities for all people especially those in under served low income areas to have access to healthy food options which has always been a dream of mine.

This is where I need your support!

Through Indiegogo, we hope to raise all of our startup costs to ensure we have a solid foundation and the tools we need to begin a successful operation. We plan on working hard and just as importantly, being smart about how we use our time. Many of our startup costs are tools that will make our work more efficient, including a Blend Tec blenders, refrigeration and freezing equipment, store construction, supplies, and product. We also have costs in order to grow the business with a marketing campaign. Our goal is $50,000 which will help us meet our financial needs. Below is a complete breakdown of where your financial support will go to.

What We Need & What You Get

Note. Not a single dollar of your contributions will go towards wages or any personal financial support. We strongly believe in the product and our business model will provide the necessary revenue to support the staffing costs.

We have some great perks available to thank you for your contribution to our campaign. Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a pair of Cool Cup Smoothies shades just like "SMOOVE" our mascot wears and a social media thank you. Additional perks and chance at creating and naming a new menu item, t-shirts, having a cool cup character created in your likeness, and a collectible blending cup with our logo, and some top shelf type perks as well. Supporting our campaign also gives you bragging rights forever - the chance to say “you were there when they got started.”  And most importantly, your contribution is a chance to feel great about the fact that you are making a real difference in the lives of many people and helping the American dream come true.

In the event that we do not meet our goal we can assure you that the funds will still be used to pursue the business. Well make every effort to secure a retail location or partner with local business to co-op their space. We'll continue to make sure our suppliers and wholesalers provide us with quality products at the best rate. Our equipment will be certified re conditioned with applicable warranties to maximize our dollars. We'll definitely be getting our hands dirty with building and painting ourselves along with the help of volunteers.  None of your contributions will used in vain and every dollar counts. 

So what's the plan?

To give you an idea of how and why we believe this will be a successful business we're sharing some details about our strategy.  

Location: In any business location is of the most importance and we feel we have located a store site to launch Cool Cup.  The store itself has 1400 sq ft of retail space  we're projecting the first year $152,000 is revenue year 1 equaling $108.00 in sales per sq ft.  We're projecting in increase of 20% year over year in revenue as well. 

Part of the equipment budget will go into the overall build of store. Providing resources for things such as (flooring, paint, fixtures, and furniture).  Turning this empty space in a bustling thriving business is absolutely a possibly

Located next to the space is a fitness center with a confirmed 5000 members! Our goal is to turn everyone of those members into lifetime cool cup smoothie customers.  With guerilla  marketing campaign and cross promotions we'll be able to do just that. 

Our location will be located on the eastern part of Indianapolis which is a hot bed for unhealthy eating establishments. The next closest true competitor is over 10 miles away. I don’t believe a person with low income should have to travel miles and miles away to enjoy healthy food. Even grocers such as Whole Foods, Fresh Thyme, or Trader Joe;s are nowhere to be found.  This area is home to over 135,000 people just within a 5 mile radius with shopping centers, movie theaters, and countless businesses that see daily traffic. We see this amount of people as an conversion opportunity.  Overall to goal of expanding clientele beyond our radius we would still be the only true smoothie company in the area located for miles.  

Smoothies are delicious and healthy when properly done. We won’t use any ingredients with preservatives, artificial flavors or sugar. We’re even proud to say were a Vegan friendly establishment!

Who am I?

Glad you asked.

My name is James Jones I was born and raised in Indianapolis, IN. I started working my very first job at the age 15 for a fast food establishment and have been working ever since. I’ve done all types of jobs from bartender, security guard, taxi driver, retail, construction, factory work, and business management in the corporate sector.  Even though the jobs changed my passion for service, quality, and consistency has never changed. I graduated college in 2003 with my bachelor’s degree in business management and then in 2016 with degree in hospitality administration. At this point in my life I want to take all the knowledge I’ve learned and pursue my dream on being a business owner.

I chose the smoothie business for a few reasons. I have a special connection to it. See I didn’t always look like this.

 

I used to weigh 330 lbs at my heaviest.

I didn’t value the benefit of living a healthy lifestyle but a health scare set me on a personal challenge to change my life. I went on a smoothie and juice diet and within 12 months with diet and exercise I lost 85lbs. This was something that changed the way I looked at life and realizing that I had a family and people who depended on me, I needed to make sure I did my part to ensure I’ll be around for them.

Finally I’m a proud African American man and I have a lot pride so for me asking for financial support is difficult. I believe I am I person of integrity, also I love my community, and I love helping others so the decision for this was easy. There are so many barriers  barriers against minority business owners that its easy for some to not even try....We'll I wont let that happen because with your contributions not only are you putting your financial support behind me I believe your putting your faith in me to set out to make a difference in the lives of many. I promise I wont let you down. Me and my family we'll make sure this business is a success. Cool Cup Smoothie may just be a store for now but it’s also a brand that I intend to spend my every waking moment growing. 

 

Additional ways to help ?

If you cant contribute no worries we still love you! if you could just share our story on your social media sites and if you know people who would be interested please reach out to them.  If you have questions please drop us comment we'll be checking this site daily and posting updates. Check out our Facebook page by clicking the link here. Cool Cup Smoothies 

Thanks for taking the time to read our story and God bless.
story_txt:
Summary
We are Cool Cup Smoothies!
I’m the owner/operator born and raised in Indianapolis, IN known as the crossroads of America. I’ve spent my life in some form or fashion in service to others. In retail, customer service, or in the corporate sector for almost 20 years I’ve honed my business skills. As a company we’re committed to increasing opportunities for all people especially those in under served low income areas to have access to healthy food options which has always been a dream of mine.
This is where I need your support!
Through Indiegogo, we hope to raise all of our startup costs to ensure we have a solid foundation and the tools we need to begin a successful operation. We plan on working hard and just as importantly, being smart about how we use our time. Many of our startup costs are tools that will make our work more efficient, including a Blend Tec blenders, refrigeration and freezing equipment, store construction, supplies, and product. We also have costs in order to grow the business with a marketing campaign. Our goal is $50,000 which will help us meet our financial needs. Below is a complete breakdown of where your financial support will go to.

What We Need & What You Get

Note. Not a single dollar of your contributions will go towards wages or any personal financial support. We strongly believe in the product and our business model will provide the necessary revenue to support the staffing costs.
We have some great perks available to thank you for your contribution to our campaign. Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a pair of Cool Cup Smoothies shades just like "SMOOVE" our mascot wears and a social media thank you. Additional perks and chance at creating and naming a new menu item, t-shirts, having a cool cup character created in your likeness, and a collectible blending cup with our logo, and some top shelf type perks as well. Supporting our campaign also gives you bragging rights forever - the chance to say “you were there when they got started.”  And most importantly, your contribution is a chance to feel great about the fact that you are making a real difference in the lives of many people and helping the American dream come true.
In the event that we do not meet our goal we can assure you that the funds will still be used to pursue the business. Well make every effort to secure a retail location or partner with local business to co-op their space. We'll continue to make sure our suppliers and wholesalers provide us with quality products at the best rate. Our equipment will be certified re conditioned with applicable warranties to maximize our dollars. We'll definitely be getting our hands dirty with building and painting ourselves along with the help of volunteers.  None of your contributions will used in vain and every dollar counts. 
So what's the plan?
To give you an idea of how and why we believe this will be a successful business we're sharing some details about our strategy.  
Location: In any business location is of the most importance and we feel we have located a store site to launch Cool Cup.  The store itself has 1400 sq ft of retail space  we're projecting the first year $152,000 is revenue year 1 equaling $108.00 in sales per sq ft.  We're projecting in increase of 20% year over year in revenue as well. 

Part of the equipment budget will go into the overall build of store. Providing resources for things such as (flooring, paint, fixtures, and furniture).  Turning this empty space in a bustling thriving business is absolutely a possibly

Located next to the space is a fitness center with a confirmed 5000 members! Our goal is to turn everyone of those members into lifetime cool cup smoothie customers.  With guerilla  marketing campaign and cross promotions we'll be able to do just that. 

Our location will be located on the eastern part of Indianapolis which is a hot bed for unhealthy eating establishments. The next closest true competitor is over 10 miles away. I don’t believe a person with low income should have to travel miles and miles away to enjoy healthy food. Even grocers such as Whole Foods, Fresh Thyme, or Trader Joe;s are nowhere to be found.  This area is home to over 135,000 people just within a 5 mile radius with shopping centers, movie theaters, and countless businesses that see daily traffic. We see this amount of people as an conversion opportunity.  Overall to goal of expanding clientele beyond our radius we would still be the only true smoothie company in the area located for miles.  
Smoothies are delicious and healthy when properly done. We won’t use any ingredients with preservatives, artificial flavors or sugar. We’re even proud to say were a Vegan friendly establishment!
Who am I?

Glad you asked.
My name is James Jones I was born and raised in Indianapolis, IN. I started working my very first job at the age 15 for a fast food establishment and have been working ever since. I’ve done all types of jobs from bartender, security guard, taxi driver, retail, construction, factory work, and business management in the corporate sector.  Even though the jobs changed my passion for service, quality, and consistency has never changed. I graduated college in 2003 with my bachelor’s degree in business management and then in 2016 with degree in hospitality administration. At this point in my life I want to take all the knowledge I’ve learned and pursue my dream on being a business owner.
I chose the smoothie business for a few reasons. I have a special connection to it. See I didn’t always look like this.

 
I used to weigh 330 lbs at my heaviest.

I didn’t value the benefit of living a healthy lifestyle but a health scare set me on a personal challenge to change my life. I went on a smoothie and juice diet and within 12 months with diet and exercise I lost 85lbs. This was something that changed the way I looked at life and realizing that I had a family and people who depended on me, I needed to make sure I did my part to ensure I’ll be around for them.

Finally I’m a proud African American man and I have a lot pride so for me asking for financial support is difficult. I believe I am I person of integrity, also I love my community, and I love helping others so the decision for this was easy. There are so many barriers  barriers against minority business owners that its easy for some to not even try....We'll I wont let that happen because with your contributions not only are you putting your financial support behind me I believe your putting your faith in me to set out to make a difference in the lives of many. I promise I wont let you down. Me and my family we'll make sure this business is a success. Cool Cup Smoothie may just be a store for now but it’s also a brand that I intend to spend my every waking moment growing. 
 

Additional ways to help ?
If you cant contribute no worries we still love you! if you could just share our story on your social media sites and if you know people who would be interested please reach out to them.  If you have questions please drop us comment we'll be checking this site daily and posting updates. Check out our Facebook page by clicking the link here. Cool Cup Smoothies 

Thanks for taking the time to read our story and God bless.

story:
We want to launch our TouchPoint boards by January 2018!

When buying hair online, it can be hard to make a decision based on something you've never seen before. Our TouchPoint boards to will be free for hair stylist partners with a public location. This will double as a location for new customers to feel our hair and it would also allow us to direct customers to hair stylists we trust.

Our hair stylist partners benefit from:

* Direct Client Referrals
* Workshops
* Online marketing & promotion
* Access our private Slack Channel for community discussion
* Content marketing
* Events and sponsorships
* Business coaching and resources 
* Help to grow your online presence!
& more!

Join as a Stylist Partner now!

 

Weave Got It Canada

Who knew there was so much to know about hair extensions! We have learned so much since starting weavegotit.ca . We are in growth mode and we need your help to get to the next level!

Our small team consists of our founders and operators Samantha and her partner Troy, a small virtual team of customer services representatives & a set of bad ass ambassadors like @PatriciaJ from Toronto's CP24 and other beauties like @robynnbourne @feleciiakerryann23 & @tiannaabeni . 

Samantha has been installing hair extensions and styling hair for over 15 years. She is a self-taught web specialist who now helps hair stylists get online and improve their web presence to build bigger businesses.

Her passion for connecting people with the right hair extensions came from her own frustrations when using and maintaining hair. "I hated the fact that every time I got my hair done, I would spend 100s of dollars on the hair then more to get it installed only to have the hair shed all over the place, get tangled and matted only weeks later."

Weave Got It Canada hair extensions are silky smooth and they stay that way for up to 2 years, sometimes longer. With weavegotit.ca, we are utilizing technology to empower people to take control of their hair care experience.

We offer hair bundles/wefts, clip-ins, wigs, custom colouring, custom textures and we are growing our new Stylist Directory to connect more and more people with amazing stylists for their hair journey. 

Where will the funds go?

  • $1500 - Marketing and promotion new stylist locations.
  • $5000 - Inventory - Each stylist receives 50% off an initial order for themselves.
  • $8500 - Creation and delivery TouchPoint boards for stylists.

If we surpass our goal, we'll be able to get boards to even more hair stylists! If we don't reach our goal, we'll still be going ahead as planned, but at a smaller scale :)

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference to a community of people who are hustlers! We are passionate entrepreneurs who want to help others to be successful while we're reaching new levels of success ourselves.

 

Challenges

Unfortunately, hair extensions are known for being one of the industries with the highest amounts of customer fraud on the internet. We have been hit time and time again and we have finally figure out a way to combat that, leveraging relationships.   

We're bridging our online experience with offline by connecting our customers with our hair stylist partners. This ongoing relationship is beneficial for all involved and it gets us closer to connecting people with what they really need.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to contribute! Share with a few friends or recommend a hair stylist partner. We're in this to build a community and grow together.

story:
Hello, my Name is Alex Davis of ichallengelife. Ichallengelife is a personal development company with a social purpose towards youth mentorship in the areas of Recreation Education Entertainment and Sports and Sports (REES).

Our vision
To encourage people around the world to live a winner’s lifestyle.

Our mission
To provide transformational tools to assist individuals in becoming life Challengers. Turning the underdog into the Top Dog

In 2016, my wife and I sponsored the 1st. Annual Relay for me mentorship. We also were blessed to give away 500 pairs of Nike shoes to the kids in the community. We want to do it again in 2018. With your help we can reach our goal.

By you investing, donating or going to our website www.changeforadollar.online and purchasing a change for a dollar, 14 affirmations to changing your life booklet of only $1. you can help change the environment of our youth by showing them love and kindness. Your contribution also directly supports our kings in training mentorship program. Mentoring boys ages 5-18.

The change for a dollar booklets are also great gifts for your family, friends, co-workers, employees, students and anyone who needs encouragement and has Life Challenges.
 

Your contribution will also assist us in funding our other events in the areas of: Recreation, Education, Entertainment, and Sports.



THANK you so much time and contribution.


Remember to Be a life challenger by challenging every situation life brings about.

story:
Our History

Hello, we are two sisters, Dellyr and Johana, when we finished the university, we wanted to be entrepreneurs and to serve the society, we wanted to create something big, that would move the world, that makes people happy in a fun and mindful direction.

We started differents kind of businesses. The first one was to sell yogurths, the second was  a hairdressing saloon, the third was a supermarket, the fourth was to sell clothes, but didn't go successful, we lost money, but we learned a lot.

After all, three years ago, we started to rent an apartment in airbnb, the business was great, but we wanted to create a model business with focus on wellness, so, we decided to start a wellness hotel in Cartagena. We used the canvas model and we did the business plan, next, we got the money (savings and loans), and, after several months, the Hotel was ready to operate (June of 2018) , it has been amazing. Dellyr is the manager's Hotel and Johana helps with networks and marketing.

And so, here we are today, working from our Hotel day after day. We've hired an amazing staff that we consider one family. We're ready to grow and to the next level.

The hotel

Our Hotel has a basic equipment and we hope to have a wellness Hotel with all what is required, so, we want to have a swimmingpool, improve our rooms, have new rooms and above all, we want to have a beautiful, equipped, comfortable and nice spa. It is very important for us because Múcura Hotel & Spa is the expression of the things that we want to do, to make people happy and to contribute with a better world.

Funding goals

$20,000 we celebrate because the most beautiful place in the Hotel will be the Spa, at last, we  will have a swimmingpool  (that is very important for a Hotel in Cartagena) and we would equip the current rooms in the best possible way.

More of $20.000 will be amazing  an update on what all your generosity will mean for the growth of Múcura Hotel & Spa.

Less of $20.000 is an enormous opportunity to organize our Spa and to improve some of our current rooms.

We hope you join our story and collect on some of our awesome rewards!

The impact

To have a place where people could be happy, healthy and quiet is our gift to the world,  specially on these days, when life runs fast and escapes from us.

The business model of Múcura is focused on harmony, sustainability and equilibrium. It is so hard to achieve those goals, but, it is our proposal, we are working every day to our visitors finding peace, love, and care the live in all its expressions. 

Risk and challenges

The good news is our Hotel has excellent reviews and most of the tourists that have visited us one time, want to come back. We need just few things to become the place we want to be. We are optimistic and we hope everything that is dreamt becomes reality, but of course, unexpected delays are a possibility. Nonetheless, we continue believing in our dreams and proposal, all our strengths and energies are into this business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your time and interest in our project, it is very precious to us. You can also contribute sharing our campaing in your networks or through Indiegogo share tools. Put your comments, get the word out and makes a lot noise about our campaing. Thank you for all and blessing to you.

story:
NO GREATER LOVE THAN THAT SHOWED TO THE NEEDY
______________________________________________________
Hi, my name is Frank Anore, a Nigerian Filmmaker. Not too long ago, a few of my friends and volunteers came under the platform of Camera4Development, and embarked on a project called UNITED DONATIONS FOR ORPHANS.
We were overwhelmed with the support from like-minded individuals.
We delivered food and other relief materials across orphanages in Lagos, Nigeria. It was a great success. 

Today, we take up the ambitious challenge to extend that platform of succour to Boko Haram Survivors in Maiduguri, North-eastern Nigeria who are displaced and separated from their families.


Just when we thought abducting over 200 Chibok girls would calm the nerves of the deadly Nigerian terrorist group, the Boko Haram has continued to unleash mayhem on North-eastern Nigeria, killing children, women and anything on sight.

The recent massacre on Baga community left thousands dead and a few more who escaped into bushes separated from their families.

Graciously, survivors hidden in the forests are struggling to make their way to the capital city of Maiduguri, seeking refuge and assistance.

We seek kind and united donations from the generous and supportive Indiegogo family to be able to provide relief aids to these displaced and traumatised Boko Haram victims.

$15,000 will take care of 3 truck load of food items for an estimated 3000 displaced persons.

$6,000 will take care of 20 bales of clothings

$4,000 will take care of Drugs/Supplements

$5,000 will take care of transportation/other logistics within Lagos and Borno State, Nigeria.

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T HIT OUR TARGET?
We will add our personal money to total amount raised and convert it to food items to be given to an orphanage.

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE HIT OUR TARGET?
We will increase the number of items on our list to more replenish the stock of the IDP's Centres for a longer time.

ACCOUNTABILITY
We have done it severally in the past and will do it again. We're a team of disciplined, passionate and transparent care-givers. We'll use both photo and video media to document the process, from where we procure items to loading the vehicles and handing off to the authorities or to beneficiaries directly.


Support us with your donation to make this a reality.
Help spread the word far. Together everyone achieves MORE.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools as well.

...we can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.

story:
**Update**
We are cancelling this campaign as of October 9, 2015 and you can expect a refund of your contribution to Laureate Brewing Company. Thanks everyone for your support!
Kevin


Hi, my name is Kevin Burgess and I am opening Laureate Brewing Company in Iowa City where our self-proclaimed “Brewer Laureate” will produce Distinguished Craft Beer served at our taproom, for carry-out or for consumption at select bars and restaurants in the Iowa City area.

Our brewery aims to be unique in that its goal is to not only produce high quality craft beer but also to create a sense of community through craft beer.

You can expect the highest level of customer service at our brewery taproom.  We will be there to answer all your questions and provide details on the ingredients used for the beer you are consuming or thinking of trying next. 

We will be hosting beer education classes where those interested can learn more about craft beer - like how to best serve craft beer for your private dining engagements or learn about the subtle (or not so subtle) differences in taste and character when the brewer chooses to use different yeasts, grain and hops! We will elevate the discussion about beer.

Laureate Brewing will occupy a 2000 sq. ft. warehouse just off of Gilbert St and Southgate Ave adjacent to the Iowa River bicycle trail just south of downtown. 


What We Need & What You Get

I’m running the IndieGoGo campaign to raise awareness that we are opening this Fall/Winter but also I want to serve our beer right away once we get our brewer's license.

I need help with some start-up costs to get things set: legal fees, merchandise and the purchase of the taproom beer dispensing equipment...all to help speed up the opening date and be able to serve our beer as quickly as possible.

To help guarantee our success, we will have multiple community oriented funding and engagement opportunities to help with startup and to grow the brewery, and those participants or “Founders” will receive rewards from the brewery and also if interested, provide input in the beer we produce and serve. We plan to brew many different types of craft beer from "beginner" to advanced "beer geek" and have at least 10 beers available at the taproom as often as we can.

All our reward items will have the brewery logo, and are made of high quality material. We have reward levels for everyone... There are stickers, bottle opener key chains, can koozies, t-shirts, a hoodie, a trucker hat and a winter ski cap. Also, we have the "Iowa City Founder" level which will entitle you to a Laureate Brewing pint glass and 15 fills at the taproom through 2016. The "Hawkeye Founder" level (amended slightly due to a typo on my part, see notes below) will entitle you to a Laureate Brewing stainless steel growler and growler fills through 2016 (15 fills). A very nice deal.  The brewery will open early on Hawkeye game days! Below are some of the perks available from Laureate Brewing -  more perk pics added soon!


Help us spread the word that a new brewery is coming to Iowa City. And if one of the rewards doesn’t fit, don’t worry, there will be lots of future opportunities to help out once we’re open. For those who are really motivated to help, please contact me directly, we have many opportunities available for those wanting to help build and sustain a locally owned craft brewery in Iowa City. 

I can’t wait and look forward to meeting you down at the brewery.


Notes:
1. Regarding the Founder Level perks (Iowa City and Hawkeye): as a Founder donor you will redeem your merchandise (Pint or Growler) and fills at the taproom when it's convenient for you, it does not have to be a Hawkeye home game nor does it have to be monthly. We want to be flexible so as many can take advantage of this outstanding perk as possible. There will be a limit of 15 fills each donor level. The video and perk descriptions are not quite accurate. Only one fill per visit.
2. Founder level donors (and a guest) will be invited to special events at the taproom.

Email me with questions:
kevin@laureatebrewing.com

through craft beer.
You can expect the highest level of customer service at our brewery taproom.  We will be there to answer all
your questions and provide details on the ingredients used for the beer you are
consuming or thinking of trying next.  
We will be hosting beer education classes where those interested can learn more about craft beer - like how to
best serve craft beer for your private dining engagements or learn about the
subtle (or not so subtle) differences in taste and character when the brewer
chooses to use different yeasts, grain and hops! We will elevate the discussion
about beer.
Laureate Brewing will occupy a 2000 sq. ft. warehouse just
off of Gilbert St and Southgate Ave adjacent to the Iowa River bicycle trail
just south of downtown. 

   What We Need & What You Get

I’m running the IndieGoGo campaign to raise awareness that
we are opening this Fall/Winter but also I want to serve our beer right
away once we get our brewer's license.
I need help with some start-up costs to get things set:
legal fees, merchandise and the purchase of the taproom beer dispensing equipment...all to help speed
up the opening date and be able to serve our beer as quickly as possible.
To help guarantee our success, we will have multiple
community oriented funding and engagement opportunities to help with startup
and to grow the brewery, and those participants or “Founders” will receive
rewards from the brewery and also if interested, provide input in the beer we
produce and serve. We plan to brew many different types of craft beer from "beginner" to advanced "beer geek" and have at least 10 beers available at the
taproom as often as we can.
All our reward items will have the brewery logo, and are
made of high quality material. We have reward levels for everyone... There are
stickers, bottle opener key chains, can koozies, t-shirts, a hoodie, a trucker hat and a winter ski
cap. Also, we have the "Iowa City Founder" level which will entitle you to a Laureate Brewing pint glass and 15 fills at the taproom through 2016. The "Hawkeye Founder" level (amended slightly due to a typo on my part, see notes below) will entitle you to a Laureate Brewing stainless steel growler and growler fills through 2016 (15 fills). A very nice deal.  The brewery will open early on Hawkeye game days! Below are some of the perks available from Laureate Brewing -  more perk pics added soon!
    
Help us spread the word that a new brewery is coming to Iowa
City. And if one of the rewards doesn’t fit, don’t worry, there will be lots of
future opportunities to help out once we’re open. For those who are really
motivated to help, please contact me directly, we have many opportunities
available for those wanting to help build and sustain a locally owned craft
brewery in Iowa City. 
I can’t wait and look forward to meeting you down at the
brewery.
Notes: 1. Regarding the Founder Level perks (Iowa City and Hawkeye): as a Founder donor you will redeem your merchandise (Pint or Growler) and fills at the taproom when it's convenient for you, it does not have to be a Hawkeye home game nor does it have to be monthly. We want to be flexible so as many can take advantage of this outstanding perk as possible. There will be a limit of 15 fills each donor level. The video and perk descriptions are not quite accurate. Only one fill per visit. 2. Founder level donors (and a guest) will be invited to special events at the taproom.Email me with questions:kevin@laureatebrewing.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Daniel Cohen, I'm 22 years old.

I served in the IDF for 3 years in the Nahal Infantry Brigade, I was a commander in the artillery platoon at our company. During my service I got injured in my right forearm next to my elbow, I had STAPH.ARUES, which is a severe skin infection that led to necrosis. It happened to me while I was at Lebanon's border and by the time I got to the hospital I was very close to amputation. I had surgery to take out the STAP.ARUES and now I am suffering from CRPS Type II (a link to read more about CRPS is included at the bottom).
Due to my injury, I lost a lot of abilities I used to have. In my past, I used to engage in many activities such as playing guitar, climbing, swimming and was very physically active in general. Given the fact the I now had one functioning arm, and the other constantly causing pain, I stopped doing a lot of these things.
During this time, I started thinking to myself, why should I keep living with this disability? Why shouldn't I search for a solution? So I have, and I've found out there are no existing solutions for a lot of necessities, so I told myself I will make them.
Now, I have several ideas for products that will give a solution for an upper limb handicap but I don’t have enough money to patent it and to make prototypes. This is where I can use a hand. I made this fundraising project so I can have enough money to make it happen.
 

My project is all about making the disability an ability. Giving others like me with an upper limb injury \ amputee the option to live normal lives with solutions for daily situations.
I am sure these devices will give perfect solutions for one-handed people,
to do a two handed person's mission.
It is very important for me to get this project to work because that way I could go back to doing all the things I used to before my injury, and we could help so many people that are looking for an answer for how to live their lives with one hand.
You will help me and others feel a bit less different. And you will give us the option to do daily things that we can't do on a daily basis without asking for help –
by ourselves.


to learn more about CRPS : https://www.ninds.nih.gov/Disorders/Patient-Caregiver-Education/Fact-Sheets/Complex-Regional-Pain-Syndrome-Fact-Sheet










 


What We Need & What You Get

As a donor, you will get a monthly update about the whole thing, once I have enough money to write patents on my products I will send you scripts, and as soon as I will have a prototype I will make a video for you to see what you helped me create.

The money that will be raised in this project will go to the costs of writing 2 of my ideas as patents (Worldwide patents) and making both into prototypes.
Afterward, if I will have some money left, it will help me produce a few more of the products and I will start selling them. If I won’t reach my goal I will donate the money to "Reuth – medical rehabilitation center" – Reuth is where I go for rehabilitation, this center specializes in CRPS.

The Impact

This project will give people the life quality they lost to their injury or their birth 'defect'. Everyone knows someone with an upper limb disability and if not you probably have seen someone on TV, but I want you guys to try doing your normal daily activities with one hand. Let's say you want to eat, so you need to use a fork and a knife, but you can't do it with one hand, or let's say you want to exercise and you need both of your hands for it. My products will give solutions for this normal day activities. It will open doors we didn’t have before; it will change the lives of all upper limb handicapped people.

I want you to know that I already have scripts and measurements and as soon as I will raise enough money creating the prototype shouldn't take , more than a month.

Risks & Challenges

I already did a patent background check to see there is nothing similar,
I already found a company that will help me write it as a patent and the product is completely ready except for the fact it doesn’t have a prototype today. I made a survey among people with injuries similar to mine, asking about the general idea and if they think they would use this kind of product and they said they definitely would. The only risk I am facing in this process is not raising enough money. I hope I wouldn't have to face that situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help, if it's donating 1 dollar (or more) or even if you just share it on facebook or twitter or any other way you know. It is important that this project will get support. It will be very handy for people like me and its sad that no solutions have been created for such problems before. But that is why I'm here doing this. I hope everyone will find their way of helping me help others. Thank you so much for reading and helping.
 Much appreciation.

For any question message / email me.

Donations would be accepted via PayPal as well: paypal.me/dankocohen

I will update on every donation coming in on the updates section. Thank you.

Logo Credit:

http://www.freepik.com/free-vector/silhouettes-...

story:
Summary

We've realized that though there are fantastic innovators dispersed throughout the University of Minnesota area, many of us have been siloed into our distinct fields of business, design and engineering.

LifeWork is creating a space that brings together these fields to create the ideas, technologies, and businesses of the future. Good things happen when people come together, and that's more important now, than ever before.

Let's innovate together.

What We Need & What You Get

We're running this campaign to secure $15,000 of investment from the Holmes Center of Entrepreneurship. Your reservations help us secure this investment, and bring the LifeWork space to fruition.

The reservation secures your spot in the LifeWork space, paying for your first month of membership. It also gives you access to discounted membership rates:

  • $30/mo membership for students
  • $50/mo membership for professionals 

LifeWork Membership will include access to the items below.

Drop-In Clinics with experts in:

  • CAD Design
  • Web Development
  • App Development
  • Graphic Design
  • Business Development
  • Business Law
  • Patent Law

Amenities including:

  • Desks with Monitors
  • Whiteboards
  • Breakout Room
  • Wi-Fi

A Lounge with the following:

  • Couches
  • Coffee
  • Food Vending
  • Pool Table

Two guest passes, to bring your friends with!

Location

Space will be located within 10 minutes walking from the University of Minnesota East Bank campus. A reservation allows you to vote on the final location!

story:
The Tapas

You want to know why you should contribute to our campaign or else you wouldn't be here now would you? Cool. We got this. Check it out.

Because Pita Jungle rocks! You know it! We know it! Sooo...We're getting the band back together!

And we want to bring you back so we can play all the classic hits for you whenever your generous, gorgeous little heart's desire!

$1.75 million dollars?! Are you kidding me?

This is a crazy idea! A crazy plan, isn't it? It's too grand to actually work, don't you think?

It's okay if you think that! We think so too! That's why we have to try!
 

The Appetizer

  • Why $1.75 Million?

Here's the deal. We have to, and we mean we HAVE TO have $1 million dollars in liquid capital in order to even be considered for the franchise. You're thinking that's a lot of (pita) bread! Yeah, we know!

  • Where's the other $750,000 going?

We're glad you asked. There's a lot going on, so let's hit the highlights.

First off, we're going to give all the employees who were laid off as a result of the closing, an invitation to return to work. Then we're going to give each of them a $2500 "severance stipend" because, losing a job sucks, this campaign is 60 days long, it's a long shot that this will actually work, there are no guarantees that any of us will land another job immediately, and we all have bills to pay. Besides, after getting only a 10 day notice, it's the right thing to do.

It's going to cost around $650,000 for the franchise fees, the start-up costs, and the build-out of the new restaurant. This is from ground zero all the way to opening day.

(We ain't goin' back to the same spot and having to deal with the same landlord that kicked us out because he wanted to practically double the rent! Sorry, not sorry!)

This is a fixed funding campaign. That means that if we don't reach our goal, we get nothing.

Why did we choose that? Good question, glad you asked.

Here's the answer:

Because we have no desire to take a lesser amount of money, because the facts are, this just won't work with anything less than $1.75 million. So we're not here to grab a few bucks and run off. We are seriously committed to making this a viable, wonderful addition to our community. We want the whole thing or nothing at all. We're all in.

Besides, this protects you, our community. If we don't raise the entire amount, you don't lose a single penny of your hard earned cash!

Not convinced yet? Then let us show you the Main Course.

The Entree

We have goals and dreams, just like you do. So we're going to implement some of those into what we think will make a better business, especially as it pertains to restaurants. This is a community, and through our existence as a business, we intend to make the community better as a whole, because you and everyone else knows that we're all in this together. Check this out!

  • A better living wage!
We are going to lead the way and be ahead of the curve of minimum wage by giving our employees something they can actually live on: $10/hour to start - before it's mandated by the state of California. Then we're going to increase that hourly rate, again, making sure that we're ahead of the curve set by the state! People deserve to make a decent wage, and we want to be at the forefront of that movement!

  • Profit sharing for our employees!
A better wage is great, but to us, that's not enough! We're also going to set up the restaurant so that we have a profit-sharing component for our employees.

Why? You really ask the best questions. Here's why:

Have you ever been to a restaurant and had a bad server? Or maybe a moody one? Did it color your experience one way or another? Of course it did!

We've been doing this a long time, and we know that especially in restaurants, our employees are the single most important factor as the face of the business. Our belief is simple.

The more we share in the profits, the more our employees will care. The more the employees care, the better they will take care of you, our loyal customers. The better they take care of you and yours, the more you're going to want to support a place that feels like an extension of your own home. And that, friends, makes everybody happy, healthy and wise. It's just good business for everyone.

  • It's all GREEN!
It's our intention to be the greenest restaurant in Pasadena! Whatever we can do, we'll do it. We are going to explore every possible avenue to be sure that we are doing everything we can to be kind to our community. That means being aware of and extremely careful with water consumption and waste, as we are in a severe drought state. That means leaving the smallest possible carbon footprint.

We want to partner with local farms for as much of our menu as we possibly can. So if you know one, or are one, and you want to have a conversation, then hit us up! But this whole endeavor, for us, is about sustainability.

We have no desire to take, take, take in the way that too many big businesses do. We want to foster, preserve and protect our community in the most sustainable way possible. It has to start somewhere, and it has to start with someone! We want to be the where and we want to be the someones. Is that a word? It doesn't matter, you get the point.

Here's the bottom line: We want to give you the highest quality product, at the best price, while we stay conscientious about our environment and your health. What's good for one of us, can and should be good for all of us!

  • Food donations!
Do you have any idea how much food restaurants waste on a daily basis? We won't keep you in suspense: it's tons! Quite literally when you combine the myriad establishments in existence right now.

We say no more food waste! We will donate anything and everything we can to local charities. Food is too precious to waste, and there are far too many people who go hungry, and that's just not okay when we, as a country, throw so much of it in the garbage.

Who knows? Maybe we'll even start a new movement in Old Town Pasadena and change the whole landscape of how restaurants operate! Wouldn't that be awesome?

  • What do I get?
Okay, okay, easy tiger! We got you!

Our offer couldn't be any more simple. Ready? Here we go:

Every $1 given towards our campaign is worth $2 towards your favorite items on our delectable and beloved menu. So you double your spending power right off the bat!

We know times are tough, especially working that 9 to 5, hustling the kids to and from school, and sometimes, money is just a bit tight. Right? We know! That's why this campaign is being run so that you know we have YOU in mind too!

How it will work:

You give us money. We'll call that "Step 1".

We'll send you a voucher reflecting your contribution. That's "Step 2".

You bring that voucher in when we open the doors, and we'll give you a gift card worth DOUBLE what you gave us to get this thing up and running! "Step 3".

Got it? Cool! Get ya some!

What's the catch?

Only this: There will be a fair and reasonable daily cap per customer, and a separate, yet also fair and reasonable cap per catering order.

Why the cap?

Look, we're trying to be sustainable for the long-term. You and we, would both hate to see us have to close the doors because we were fiscally irresponsible! Seriously, it's not like we're going to let MC Hammer run the joint!

Here's a promise: the per customer cap will be more than enough for you to have lunch or dinner, and honestly, considering our price point, it will probably be enough for you and a date. Cool?

And as for the catering, you're still going to have plenty of food to feed the office at half the price! So your colleagues are still going to fight over who gets the last of the Jalapeno/Cilantro hummus. Breaking up office fights will still be on you though! We can't be getting involved in that nonsense!

In imposing a cap, it's our desire to encourage many donors in the community, and we want many of you to be able to take advantage of this awesome offer and not just leave it to a few. And also because we're sincerely focused on being both a community and a family friendly place, and we want to be here long term.

Speaking of family friendly, how this for something new?

Kids 12 and under eat free on Tuesdays! Yes we can do that! Why the heck not?

We're serious about integrating ourselves into the community in an positive way that gives back to those around us, because without you, we know we wouldn't survive. Like we said before, we know we're all in this together, and we intend to act accordingly!

Speaking of giving back!

Many of you know that we gave a 10% discount to local workers. Well, we're bringing that back too! But in an improved way! Ready for this?

Anyone will be able to sign up for our new loyalty program. Anyone! For every $10 you spend at the restaurant, we'll give you a buck back! That's a 10% reward program for anyone and everyone who wants to eat at our remarkable restaurant!

So get loyal! Get fed! Get some of that hard earned cash back! That's what community is all about!

The Dessert

Look, we know some of you may think this is the coolest (dare we say sweetest?) idea in the world. And not to pat our own backs, but yeah! We think it's pretty damn cool what we're trying to do here too.

What if you don't live in Southern California? What if you'll never make it to Pasadena to try one of our amazing, perhaps life-changing, delicious Pita Sandwiches? What if you'll never be able to take advantage of this incredible offer to double your spending power?

Don't fret, friend! You can get still your warm and fuzzies on if you want to contribute!

Every month, until we pay it in full, we will cheerfully donate whatever dollar amount you contribute, in the form of food, to local charity should you not be able to claim that awesomeness for yourself.

And honestly, we really feel that that would be too bad for you, but you can still help!

You can help us to not only reach our goal, but you'll be helping by giving a meal to someone who really, really, really needs it. And we think that's pretty damn cool too!

That's it! That's our spiel! Welcome to the struggle, ya'll! Give us your money, then come git yer belly full! We'll see you when we open the doors!

Food is too precious to waste, and there are far too many people who go hungry, and that's just not okay when we, as a country, throw so much of it in the garbage.Who knows? We got you!Our offer couldn't be any more simple. Ready? Here we go:Every $1 given towards our campaign is worth $2 towards your favorite items on our delectable and beloved menu. So you double your spending power right off the bat! We know times are tough, especially working that 9 to 5, hustling the kids to and from school, and sometimes, money is just a bit tight. Right? We know! That's why this campaign is being run so that you know we have YOU in mind too!How it will work: You give us money. We'll call that "Step 1".We'll send you a voucher reflecting your contribution. That's "Step 2".You bring that voucher in when we open the doors, and we'll give you a gift card worth DOUBLE what you gave us to get this thing up and running! "Step 3".Got it? Cool! Get ya some!What's the catch? Only this: There will be a fair and reasonable daily cap per customer, and a separate, yet also fair and reasonable cap per catering order. Why the cap? Look, we're trying to be sustainable for the long-term. You and we, would both hate to see us have to close the doors because we were fiscally irresponsible! Seriously, it's not like we're going to let MC Hammer run the joint!Here's a promise: the per customer cap will be more than enough for you to have lunch or dinner, and honestly, considering our price point, it will probably be enough for you and a date. Cool?And as for the catering, you're still going to have plenty of food to feed the office at half the price! So your colleagues are still going to fight over who gets the last of the Jalapeno/Cilantro hummus. Breaking up office fights will still be on you though! We can't be getting involved in that nonsense!In imposing a cap, it's our desire to encourage many donors in the community, and we want many of you to be able to take advantage of this awesome offer and not just leave it to a few. And also because we're sincerely focused on being both a community and a family friendly place, and we want to be here long term.Speaking of family friendly, how this for something new?Kids 12 and under eat free on Tuesdays! Yes we can do that! Why the heck not?We're serious about integrating ourselves into the community in an positive way that gives back to those around us, because without you, we know we wouldn't survive. Like we said before, we know we're all in this together, and we intend to act accordingly! Speaking of giving back!Many of you know that we gave a 10% discount to local workers. Well, we're bringing that back too! But in an improved way! Ready for this?Anyone will be able to sign up for our new loyalty program. Anyone! For every $10 you spend at the restaurant, we'll give you a buck back! That's a 10% reward program for anyone and everyone who wants to eat at our remarkable restaurant!So get loyal! Get fed! Get some of that hard earned cash back! That's what community is all about!
  The Dessert
Look, we know some of you may think this is the coolest (dare we say sweetest?) idea in the world. And not to pat our own backs, but yeah! We think it's pretty damn cool what we're trying to do here too. What if you don't live in Southern California? What if you'll never make it to Pasadena to try one of our amazing, perhaps life-changing, delicious Pita Sandwiches? What if you'll never be able to take advantage of this incredible offer to double your spending power?Don't fret, friend! You can get still your warm and fuzzies on if you want to contribute!Every month, until we pay it in full, we will cheerfully donate whatever dollar amount you contribute, in the form of food, to local charity should you not be able to claim that awesomeness for yourself. And honestly, we really feel that that would be too bad for you, but you can still help! You can help us to not only reach our goal, but you'll be helping by giving a meal to someone who really, really, really needs it. And we think that's pretty damn cool too! That's it! That's our spiel! Welcome to the struggle, ya'll! Give us your money, then come git yer belly full! We'll see you when we open the doors!

story:
Fox Industries is an exciting new Entertainment Sector Company specialising in Workshops for Entertainment Industry Professionals, Corporate Entertainment Production, and small scale Theatre Publicity.

Fox Industries requires Startup Capital!

  • I am Claire Taylor, founder and Director of Fox Industries. I have a fantastic partner on board, Richard Gau, with a vast array of technical, multimedia, photographic, audio visual, music production skills and more up his sleeve!
  • We are currently reaching out to friends, family and supporters of Fox Industries to help us reach our goals before our Official Launch at the end of June!
  • The funds we are aiming to raise will make an immense difference in the successful running and launching of our company, as well as take a bit of the 'bootstrap' burden off trying to get a successful company off the ground.

Who We Are

-Entertainment and Theatre Publicity, Workshops and Events, Corporate Entertainment Production and more!-

Our Purpose:

  • to support, promote and advance the arts in South Africa
  • to upskill professionals in the Performing Arts and Entertainment Industry
  • to elevate standards and professionalism in the industry as a whole
  • to create awareness and increased coverage of the arts with the ultimate aim of expanding audiences
  • to increase and promote public conversation and engagement of the arts across all digital and traditional platforms

What We Need 

  • We are looking to raise about R10 000 to help us with various marketing material (banners and a banner wall), a Facebook marketing allowance, to get our website designed and developed and up and running, to purchase basic office equipment that we've been living without (a good printer), and to have some Graphic Design work done for some upcoming events.
  • If we manage to raise more than our set out goal, this will go to more *wishlist* expenses and would be worked out as a longer term plan. These include subscriptions to Powtoon, a Newclip Media Monitoring Redbook, investment into future events, and a possible launch.
  • We have added a couple of perks for donating too, so please go check them out!
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will be used for the higher priority things, like branding.

The Impact

Any physical and monetary contributions would help Fox Industries get to the next level- out of the rut that often comes with bootstrapping a business.

  • It would allow us to increase the amount of Workshops on offer, increasing revenue.
  • It would help us to increase social engagement around our brand, ultimately gaining more supporters and followers and therefore more clients.
  • It would take an immense amount of stress off me and allow us to fully focus on building a brand and a company we believe in and are incredibly proud of. Onwards and Upwards.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We'd love it if you shared our campaign far and wide! On Facebook, other social media platforms, email, whatever! Share it with whoever might find value in our cause.
  • If you have anything you or your company would like to donate or sponsor in particular (e.g. branded banner wall, or pull up banner, printing services, videography or animation services, promotional gifts etc) we would be happy to place your company's logo on sponsored items as well as marketing material.
  • If you or anyone you know would prefer to sponsor merchandise for an event (e.g. some Wine or refreshments for an event, or even prizes for events) We'd be happy to have your branding on show too.

 If anyone has any questions or queries, please don't hesitate to contact us on info@foxindustriessa.co.za

:-)

story:
ALL WELCOME TO JOIN US AND OUR EVENT

Come and meet Marcus and his crew of fresh bikes - https://www.facebook.com/events/1747609302120276/

Spark Cycles story

Hey I'm Marcus founder of Spark Cycles. I have spent the last 20 years working in the print side of advertising. My work has taken me to many countries, the USA, Singapore and I worked in the Netherlands for many years. It was there I learnt to appreciate the Dutch cycling culture. I also have a passion for vintage cars and motorcycles. As well as this, I am driven to care for the environment and to create more social awareness around human rights.

Spark Cycles is an ethical advertising business.
Travellers or locals get to rent a custom built, super cool electric bike to explore our beautiful world. The bikes will be 'moving' billboards onto which we will sell advertising space. If the riders post a picture on their social media and the advertising branding is visible  - they will then get half their rent back on return of the bike. 

At Spark Cycles we believe 'EVERYBODY WINS' - 
The brands WIN-
• they get outdoor coverage off the road in parks and bike paths in beautiful touristy locations.
• they get their branding on a one-off hand crafted bike, which gets plenty of attention.
• they get social media coverage on a local, national and global scale.
• they are able to leverage a cool brand to associate themselves with.
• they get their brand in front of many eyeballs in a subtle, less obtrusive manner.
• they get ROI in the form of data collected on posts.
• they get awesome content for there own social media.
• they get to interact with potential customers.
The bike renters WIN - 
• they hire the bikes knowing that they are an environmentally friendly mode of transport.
• they get to cruise the streets on some beautifully designed electric bikes.
• they get a mobile phone with data and 1/2 their rent back if they post to social media.
The environment WINS -
• less people on polluting forms of transport.
• the conversation around environmentally sound transportation is delivered in a unique way.
• the batteries on the bikes are charged by 100% renewable energy.
• we will have a focus on brands making a positive change.
• our depot fit-outs will re-use, re-purpose and use recycled materials.
The local community WINS -
• employing locals who know the area well
• a diverse and equal opportunity employer

Good advertising is about good stories, brands get to go on a unique adventure with a unique rider on a unique e-bike that will also have its online story told on its own social media.

Why this campaign?

This campaign is to get the first depot launched with 15 custom bikes in Sydney, Australia. Anywhere in the world that has bike paths and backpackers has the potential for a Spark Cycles depot. Further depots will be locally owned, set up under a franchise model. 

Meet the Bikes

The bikes are all pedal assist electric, a 250watt motor in the front wheel and a powered gearing system in the rear wheel that automatically keeps you in the correct gear. If you can ride a regular bike you can ride one of ours, all you have to do is turn it on and pedal.

If Dennis was human, he would be a bad-ass shaved-head biker, covered in piercings and tattoos who loves death metal music and disco on the quiet. Once you get to know him you soon realise it is all a cover for a big sweetheart. Follow @dennissc06 on Instagram

If Gary was human, he would be a proud gay man who campaigns for marriage equality. He has a mild case of OCD. Gary’s favourite drink is vodka, soda and fresh lime. Follow @garysc05 on Instagram

If Goldie was human, she would be a glamorous hollywood actress, who drives a Prius, loves a kale shake and is passionate about pilates. Follow @goldiesc03 on Instagram

If PeeWee was human, he would be an awkward man in a suit, loafers and bow tie. He likes to make animal noises while he plays with his childhood toys. Follow @peeweesc04 on Instagram

With your help 11 more amazing bespoke bikes will be created to explore Sydney, sharing their adventures with the world via the internet.

Renting a bike

If your new to town and come into our depot to rent a bike, we will have a map of the area and some suggested safe and fun bike routes. We will provide you with a mobile phone with a pre-loaded navigation app, and all popular social media so you can log in and do your posting. Your phone will even lock and unlock your bike. 

Our first Sydney Depot

Once we have reached our target we will open our first depot near Central Station in Sydney Australia. We will start renting out the 4 existing bikes, while we build 11 more amazing characters. The goal is to officially launch with 15 unique rides.

Perks

Be the first company to have your brand on 1 or all 4 bikes with our branding perks. How about coming to meet us and taking one of the bikes for a ride, there is no better way to explore the neighbourhood than on a bike, even better on a stunning custom electric bike. We hope you don't mind attention, get ready for plenty of looks your way. We also have a limited range of organic cotton T-shirts.

World of social media

Whether we like it or not, I believe 'Social media is here to stay' some people seem to be obsessed with their phones. Brands know this, if you want to share your message, one of the most effective ways is through social media.

There now is an endless need for interesting content, people want to be entertained, how do you get their attention?

Riders also love to share their adventures with their family and friends online, Some say, "If you haven't posted a photo online of yourself doing it, you didn't actually do it" We want to make this sharing as fun and as epic as possible.

Our Manifesto

We are all in this together so lets work together to support diversity, equality and the environment. There are so many stories out there that need to be told. Good people wanting to make a positive change.

We believe everybody can benefit . The renters get an electric bike for a great price, a win for brands exposure at the same time looking after the planet. Let's get people outside riding less polluting forms of transport. Burn fat not oil.

We prioritise ethics over making a 'fast buck'. A business with a set of values is the best way forward. We are here for to make a difference.

Spark Cycles wants to work towards a positive, respectful, renewable future, influenced by the romance and design sensibility of the past.

Challenges and risks

Starting Spark Cycles in my home town of Sydney is not without risks. Sydney has plenty of hills and limited cycling infrastructure compared to other cities but this is slowly improving, and the benefits of renting out to backpackers is they are always new to Sydney so we can keep sending them around the same safe routes.

The bikes could be trashed or stolen? Each bike will have a GPS tracker, renters will have to leave a deposit and will be supplied with a helmet and a smart bike lock.

Other ways you can help

We understand not everyone can contribute, please use the indiegogo share tools to help get the message out. Please make contact you are interested in joining the Spark Cycles team.

You can find Spark Cycles 

http://www.sparkcycles.com

https://www.facebook.com/sparkcycles/

https://www.instagram.com/sparkcycles/

https://twitter.com/SparkCycles

https://au.pinterest.com/sparkcycles/

Spark Cycles media

http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-ep...

http://www.campaignbrief.com/2016/07/marcus-thy...

https://whatson.cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au/events/...

story:
I have spent my whole life around animals, horses in particular and during times of stress and anxiety "The Yard" is my happy place where I can forget my worries and immerse myself in the care and wellbeing of the animals. I passionately believe there are countless children and adults who could also benefit enormously from "yard life" and improve their lives by building self belief, confidence and reducing stress and anxiety. As well as horses we also have several alpacas and are hoping to create a furry friends area where visitors can meet guinea pigs, chinchillas, chipmunks, budgies, micropigs, pygmy goats and more!

I will offer this as a free service through referrals from local charities and care providers and will fund the project through my riding school, alpaca breeding and offering fun experiences for families such as pony parties and alpaca experience days.

The Barn

We need to raise £50,000 to build a barn that will house our animals and also provide an area for birthday parties and classes that could also be utilised by local charities for meetings and training. We have already invested several thousand pounds and countless hours in the planning of Happyard and creating the perfect setting for our animals, we need your help to finish our dream and help those who need us!

The barn will be fitted with an area for the furry friends, a fully fitted kitchen and function room and a toilet/shower block.

What you could get....

Happyard is a unique and fun setting where families can spend time with animals and also camp in a beautiful setting. We have created some rather fabulous packages that we think you'll enjoy!

  • Pony Parlour
    Groom and pamper the horses and have a mini ride
  • Alpaca Experience
    Meet, greet and walk with an Alpaca, perfect for families or upgrade and add Prosecco and nibbles!
  • Own a Pony Day 
    Catch, brush and tack up for a morning lesson with fun games and prizes and after lunch you can decorate your pony as a unicorn!
  • Camping
    Enjoy your tent or caravan in the beautiful countryside (basic amenities available)
  • Farmer for a Day
    Come and help to care for all the animals
  • Riding lessons and horse care
    Available in block bookings
  • Alaca or Pony Parties
    A fun day for up to 10 children
  • Adoptions
    Fab packages for those who'd like to adopt an animal
  • Name a Baby!
    Name a cria (baby alpaca) and visit as may times as you like
  • Alpaca Guests
    Invite our gorgeous alpacas to your party or even wedding!
  • Bride Valley Alpacas Gardeners Gold
    Alpaca manure - it naturally contains the perfect balance of nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium and micro-nutrients.
     

Risks & Challenges

If we don't make the full amount we will still honour each experience or party purchased but a marquee will be used in place of the barn. We will continue to fundraise until we reach the full amount.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help us with our mission, please do get in touch, we would love help with:

  • Building services and materials
  • Any animal equipment
  • Marketing and advertising
  • Bathroom facilities
  • Kitchen facilities etc
  • Paint

Finally... please share our project on social media and wherever you can think of! 

Thank you so much

story:
Summary

 

  •  Background history of founder

Joshua Woods is the founder and  creative director of The Olfactive, a scent project that began 3 years ago. As a way to explore the fragrance industry, he has spent many years in the fragrance sales, distribution and marketing.

  • Why the campaign is important.

The campaign aims to help get the basics of the marketplace running. Also, to fund a few collaborations with international brands. We believe its very important to help introduce and to display the works of these artists with the world.

  • What contributors will help achieve.

Contributors will be helping to create a  fragrance market on a international scale. Contributors also are helping to support these brands by helping to expand their market. $25,000 total needed for the upgrade to the market and all funds collected will be used in the following ways.

  • Supplies
  • A creation of a small collection of fragrances

Perks

  • Perks range between a custom scent, and a fragrance from our collection.
  • If we don't reach our goal, the remaining funds will be used to complete the market and marketing.

Risks & Challenges

  • One risk is that orders, distribution and shipping don't operate as planned.
  • One challenge is to connect the brands from different time zones, languages and consumers from all over the world to function as planned.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can not contribute right now, but you can definitely be of great help, by getting the word out there and sharing the link to our campaign.

  •  Get the word out and make some noise by simply posting or sharing the link to our campaign.
story_txt:
Summary
 
 Background history of founder

Joshua Woods is the founder and  creative director of The Olfactive, a scent project that began 3 years ago. As a way to explore the fragrance industry, he has spent many years in the fragrance sales, distribution and marketing.

Why the campaign is important.

The campaign aims to help get the basics of the marketplace running. Also, to fund a few collaborations with international brands. We believe its very important to help introduce and to display the works of these artists with the world.
What contributors will help achieve.
Contributors will be helping to create a  fragrance market on a international scale. Contributors also are helping to support these brands by helping to expand their market. $25,000 total needed for the upgrade to the market and all funds collected will be used in the following ways.


Supplies
A creation of a small collection of fragrances

Perks

Perks range between a custom scent, and a fragrance from our collection.
If we don't reach our goal, the remaining funds will be used to complete the market and marketing.


Risks & Challenges

One risk is that orders, distribution and shipping don't operate as planned.
One challenge is to connect the brands from different time zones, languages and consumers from all over the world to function as planned.


Other Ways You Can Help
