story:
Story

We are reviving a beloved local (once thriving) establishment, and we think this is a perfect application for the IndieGoGo platform.

  • Our Coffee Shop and Venue are under new ownership and we are leaving the grungy stigma that we inherited in the dust. Literally! There was lots of dust!
    • We are reaching out to all members of our community to say we are changing and improving rapidly.
    • We want to attract not only college kids, but families, locals, elderly and tourists alike. 
    • We want to highlight the New Paltz arts scene and provide a professional stage to show off our ever so talented mix of people.
  • This campaign is very important to us to achieve our goal of becoming the professional mainstage New Paltz is so thirsty for.
  • When we acquired the establishment previously known as The Cafeteria, many regular customers expressed to us that they feel as if the old "Caf" was part of their home...
    • We have no intention of pushing out the old regulars. We know what you liked about the old place and we are making adjustments accordingly. 
    • By using a crowdfunding model for a portion of our funding strategy, we hope to instill a continued sense of ownership from contributors. 

Goal & Perks

  • We are hoping to raise $25,000 to morph into the New Paltz' hottest entertainment venue... What will we do if we reach our financial goal?
    • Rebuild our Stage
    • Upgrade our Sound System to allow for more tracks and better sound quality
    • Multi-Track Recording System
    • Lighting upgrade for efficiency and performance
    • Vintage style marquee to promote local acts more professionally
    • Addition of a user-friendly section on our website to display all acts and happenings
    • A back end system that makes scheduling and attending events super streamlined
  • Our perks are designed for locals but will certainly satisfy anybody with a connection to our beautiful community...
    • Featured Perk items
      • Sunday Jazz Brunch Tickets
      • "Live at CafAmelia" mix tape
      • The "Supporter's Bobblehead Shelf"
      • Get painted into our "Timeless New Paltz" mural
        • Or choose a local person of importance 
      • You can be a featured guest on our soon to launch Podcast
      • Custom Dinner Party for 18
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will be sure to upgrade the essentials of our venue at the very least: Sound Board, Mics, Stands and Lights

The Impact

  • New Paltz needs a professional, centrally located arts and music hub
  • Our location has been at times, a thriving business with great entertainment... Let's bring it back!
  • Be part of our rebirth, and we will evolve together
  • New Paltz is evolving into one of the greatest towns in The Hudson Valley, known for its arts focused college. New Paltz has not had a professional entertainment venue on Main St. for some time. Let's fix that! Let's grow this community together!

 

Challenges

Creating a premier entertainment venue takes a lot of money, time and dedication. Our team at CafAmelia is the perfect mix of talents to not only achieve our ambitious goals but to exceed the expectations of our customer. 

 

Can't donate but want to help?

  • Donate your old furniture
    • We are looking for sturdy but vintage chairs, tables, barstools, and decorations.
  • Help this campaign get out to the masses
    • Please use IndieGoGo share tools and help us spread the word
    • Tell people how much you care about our local venue and why you want to see it succeed
    • Use @cafamelia when tagging us on all social media platforms
    • Write us a positive review on FB or Google 
  • Send us your suggestions, comments, and feedback.
    • We read every piece of feedback we get and make adjustments quickly based on our customers wants and needs. This is because we are here for the community
    • Email to info@cafamelia.com

We read every piece of feedback we get and make adjustments quickly based on our customers wants and needs. This is because we are here for the community

story:
Plitvice Permaculture Retreat is a project of sustainable tourism based on the natural environment with accommodation of guests in comfortable wooden houses and tents.

I started the project after 15 years working in international corporations and having a stressful life in the Croatian capital. Three years ago, I found a property, abandoned for over 20 years, near one of the most beautiful national parks in the world (Plitvice Lakes), sold all my property, and set about building a Robinson camp on permaculture grounds. During this time, I was able to clear a large part of the property from the bushes, renovate the house, build three wooden guest houses and a sanitary facilities. I was learning about nature every day and trying to implement permaculture ideas.

By participating in this campaign, you have the opportunity to get to know one of the most beautiful parts of Croatia beyond the usual tourist routes, to surround yourself with unspoiled nature, learn about permaculture, to eat organic food and spend your evenings with a fire under the starry vault.

The project will start working in the May, regardless of the outcome of the campaign, but with your help the development will go much faster. If we do not raise the complete funds-goal and the payers will receive their reward anyway.

The first goal is to raise enough money to buy two home tents for accommodation. Tents have already been ordered and 10,000 EUR need to be collected to buy and equip them. The second objective is to purchase the additional 4 hectares of land required to create a complete estate with all the amenities it needs, for which an additional EUR 10,000 is needed. The third objective is to build a summer kitchen that will facilitate the preparation of food and allow you to socialize, which requires a sum of EUR 6,000. The fourth objective is two accommodation units on a tree in the form of a tent or a wooden house for which EUR 10,000 is required.

Since this is a lifelong project, the ideas are numerous and I cannot fit everything into this campaign, but with the achievement of some of the goals, the retreat will be able to self-finance and develop from its own income from tourism and organic food production. In the future  we will have a zoo with domestic animals, natural swimming lake, 3-5 tree houses, food forest, educational forest walks, production of food, juices, brandies and other products from garden and forest plants.

Plitvice Lakes are located in an area of great interest to tourists from all over the world and provide accommodation to millions of guests in hotels, apartments, rooms and other wifi boxes separated from the beautiful nature that surrounds them. By building Plitvice Permaculture Retreat I wanted to enable tourists from all over the world to experience a different experience, to connect with nature in a new way without sacrificing comfort, to experience the untouched nature and peace that is impossible to find in the modern world, and to learn something about sustainable living . By supporting this project you are making this experience possible and helping to realize showcases that will show other tourism professionals that sustainable tourism in harmony with nature is possible and the way we should be going.

There is no risk if you participate in the campaign. The retreat is operational, three lodges have been built and already have guests (my AIRBNB profile), and two tents will be installed no later than early June. Each contributor will receive their reward and experience described, and probably more.

So if you plan to visit Croatia and Plitvice Lakes in the next two years, do not hesitate, support this project and get yourself an unforgettable experience or simply visit us, listen to our stories, spend time on the property, become volunteer and our friend and share our campaign with your friends . Everyone is welcome.

story:
I have been 3d printing for just over 2 years, first with a second hand Ultimaker original, now with a formlabs form1+. Originally I bought it to help me produce models for a University course, but I quickly realised that I could make a little money doing prints for other people as well, I have been test trading for just over a year now, learning what works and what doesn't and I am now at the point where I want to move to the next level.

formwurx 3D print café, studio and learning zone is about creating a space where professionals, hobbyists and absolute beginners can purchase prints at various price points, have an item designed/scanned and printed, learn about the technology and process' involved or simply have a chat with like minded individuals over a good cup of coffee.

3d printing is bringing about a democratization of the design and manufacturing process whereby anyone with a bit of knowledge of the 3d design process can become a designer and have their creations prototyped (or even put into short and medium sized production runs) at a far lower cost than was previously possible. 3d printing & scanning technology is becoming cheaper, more accurate, and more accessible to the general public and formwurx want’s to be the first business to bring it to the High Street in Newcastle.

The following case studies show some real world applications of 3d printing & scanning and how it could benefit you or your business.

Case Study 1: Producing Components that are no longer in production

Case Study 2: High Resolution Wax printing for Jewellery casting 

Case Study 3: Full Colour Architectural Models

Case Study 4: Manufacturing Injection Moulds and Sample Parts

Case Study 5: Custom Prosthetic Design and Production

Case Study 6: Medical Printing for Education, Surgical Planning and Patient Communication

For more case studies, go here.

The case studies above give a glimpse of how 3d printing & scanning can be applied to everyday requirements, for many, however, 3d printing is still a mystery; people want to engage with it, on a professional and/or personal level but don’t know where to start, formwurx wants to change that.

With a successful campaign, formwurx intends to open a high street operation in Newcastle upon Tyne (a city rich in technological firsts and creativity, both historically and present day) whereby we intend to provide a wide variety of services to both the individual and the business community, as well as reaching out to local educational organizations.


Should the campaign reach tier 4, our intention is to provide the following:

  • an accessible print and scan bureau service aimed at all budgets; from the hobbyist, to the SME
  • a retail outlet to purchase 3d printing supplies and consumables for your own 3d printer at home (or even a 3d printer if you have yet to make the plunge), such as filament and resin.
  • a small café where beginners and hardened makers alike can meet and discuss ideas over a coffee and a bun (maybe even a retro 80’s arcade cabinet, what’s not to like?)
  • a friendly and knowledgeable team who can advise and assist you in all things 3d printing
  • regular open events (times to be arranged) where you can come along and learn about 3d printing, see how a 3d model is designed in a computer and then printed
  • build your own printer classes – we won’t just sell you a printer, we want to be your companion on your first foray into 3d printing so come along with your newly purchased kit and get some top quality advice and assistance in assembling it


To get the idea off the ground formwurx needs to raise a minimum of £50,000, ideally we need to raise closer to £200,000 in order to fit out the studio/café space, purchase the various printers, scanners and other relevant hardware and software. To make things a little clearer, the campaign will have different Tiers depending on the amount of funding we can raise, all rewards are based on reaching Tier 1, if we go higher, the rewards increase too!

This is how the space could look:

Artists view of the space.

Tier 1

Total funds raised £50,000

This will enable us to purchase the following hardware (or similar items):

  • Fuel 3D Scanify hand held scanner – provides a mid-range colour scanning facility
  • 1 x Kudo 3D Titan 1 – produces high quality resin models
  • 1 x Solidator – produces high quality resin models but with a larger volume than the Kudo3D
  • 1 x 3DSystems Projet 1200 – produces small but high quality models in a variety of materials including wax
  • 1 x 3DSystems Cubejet (due for release this summer) – full colour 3d models
  • 2 x Ultimaker 2 extended – high quality desktop printers using PLA and ABS plastics
  • 1 x Robo3D Rmega OR Extreme Builder 1000 – for VERY large models, again using PLA and ABS plastics.

If the campaign reaches Tier 1, formwurx will be able to offer a variety of printing and scanning services, but it is unlikely to be a highstreet site, more likely a business unit located out of town.

Tier 2

Total funds raised £100,000

This will enable us to purchase the following hardware (or similar items):

  • an Artec Eva & Spyder hand held scanners – produces high quality colour scans, including extremely small engineered items.
  • 1 x 3DSystems 3500HD – high resolution printer suitable for a variety of roles (prototypes, engineering, medical, etc…) due to a large material library
  • 1 x 3DSystems ProJet 260C (colour printer) – high quality colour models
  • 2 x Ultimaker 2 extended – high quality desktop printers using PLA and ABS plastics
  • 1 x Robo3D Rmega OR Extreme Builder 1000 – for VERY large models, again using PLA and ABS plastics.

At Tier 2 the café/learning zone should be part of the business, but not necessarily in the town centre.

All donations will receive an extra 5% to the discount fund (so if you donated £100 your discount fund will increase by 20% instead of 15%), or for donations below £50, 10% added to your purchase discount.

Tier 3

Total funds raised £150,000

This will enable us to purchase the following hardware (or similar items):

  • an Artec Eva & Spyder hand held scanners – produces high quality colour scans, including extremely small engineered items.
  • 1 x 3DSystems 3500HD – high resolution printer suitable for a variety of roles (prototypes, engineering, medical, etc…) due to a large material library
  • 1 x 3DSystems ProJet 660PRO or Mcor IRIS – produces high quality colour models that are larger and with a higher colour gamut than the 260C
  • 2 x Ultimaker 2 extended – high quality desktop printers using PLA and ABS plastics
  • 1 x Robo3D Rmega OR Extreme Builder 1000 – for VERY large models, again using PLA and ABS plastics.

At Tier 3 we should have a good sized premises that will provide easy access from the town centre.

All donations will receive an extra 10% to the discount fund (so if you donated £100 your discount fund will increase by 25% instead of 15%), or for donations below £50, 15% added to your purchase discount.


Tier 4

Total funds raised £200,000

This will enable us to purchase the following hardware (or similar items):

  • an Artec Eva & Spyder hand held scanner to produce high quality colour scans, including extremely small engineered items.
  • a Shapify.me booth – a compact and portable booth that can perform full body scans in 12 seconds
  • 1 x 3DSystems 3500HD – – high resolution printer suitable for a variety of roles (prototypes, engineering, medical, etc…) due to a large material library OR
  • 1 x Stratasys Objet 260 Connex 2 – with triple jet technology allows multiple materials to be printed in the same object at the same time.
  • 1 x 3DSystems ProJet 660PRO or Mcor IRIS (colour printers)
  • 2 x Ultimaker 2 extended
  • 1 x Robo3D Rmega OR Extrem Builder 1000

All donations will receive an extra 15% to the discount fund (so if you donated £100 your discount fund will increase by 30% instead of 15%), or for donations below £50, 20% added to your purchase discount.

story:
The back story…

Our home has been a center for music and art play, gatherings for the Oscars and for election nights. We celebrated the Mayan end of civilization with an Armageddon party. We put out art supplies and musical instruments and things just happen. People leave our home saying, “Can’t we just do this every day?” or “Can we just hang out here forever?”

We decided, in this autumn of our lives, to answer all those people: “Yes.”  We’re taking all that madness, art and music and we’re putting it in a social club for grownups.

Judy is an artist.  I’m a musician.  Amateurs.  We love to play—usually with friends. Professionally we’ve done okay. Restaurants, stores, radio shows, real estate, newspaper publishing, ministry, teaching, counseling…like most people we’ve done a lot of things to make a living and pay the bills while dallying in art and music.  But it’s been our play and our friends that’s kept us sane.

We’ve done our homework.  We’ve calculated the costs and run the business plan.  It’s what we want to do with our lives.  Create a third space: not home, not work or school, but a comfortable, laid-back place where members can be, watch or listen to creative people.

Portland will be the home of Artlandish, the first creative social club dedicated not to skills, not to teaching or instruction, not to organizing but to play.  Yes, just play. This campaign isn’t just to raise some of the capital to seed the business, but to invite early memberships at fabulous discounts. We hope you’ll support this outlandish Portland experiment!

How it started

Over the years a fun little art and music party blossomed into an important full-blown event. We put out all our art supplies and musical instruments and invited people to just play.  Easels, paints, brushes and canvases, clay, stone and sculpting tools, pastels, pads and pencils were scattered on tables and at chairs around our home and decks.  Guitars, mandolins, keyboards, harmonicas, drums and other percussion instruments leaned against chairs and railings, begging to be picked up and played.

We got to be excellent scavengers of art supplies and musical instruments. Garage sales, thrift stores, cast offs from artists and musicians…we became rescuers and recyclers of Portland’s cast off creative toys.

Artlandish will have all of that and more available to members all the time.  We’ll also have a small store inside the club to offer new or special art and music supplies. There will be places to store your projects and supplies.

We’ll have some sewing machines, fabrics and notions for experimenting with design and fashion.  Writers will find laptops and typewriters available as well as cool spots to relax and create.

For musicians and singers, there will be a large screen to display chords and lyrics, along with instruments hanging around waiting for you to try them.

Our funding on this campaign is to secure the space and prepare it for members including furnishings, paint, storage and design. We’ll also seed the little store and fill in items we haven’t yet scavenged from the city. We’re aiming for a beer and wine license. We’ll need to have some food and noshies, too, along with coffee and tea.

So, then, I need to be an artist or musician…

No. This is a play space.  It’s not an artist community. It’s a playground for grownups.  We won’t have private break-out spaces.  Almost everything is in one big, giant, rustic space. You can simply come in every day and watch people do art and play music.  Sometimes what you see and hear will be incredible. Sometimes it might not.

If, in hanging out and watching and listening, you want to pick up a brush and canvas or some clay and see what happens, you will have made Artlandish a smashing success!

We hope you’ll bring your friends in to do some group stuff.  Music, art, performance…?

Besides the daily space and supplies, Artlandish will have a variety of events. A very special Valentine’s Day evening, debate and election gatherings, some workshops and seminars on subjects members are interested. Fashion shows.  Art shows and sales.  Concerts.  Writer’s readings.  We’d love to host the Portland Poetry Slam and things like that.

And what if I am an artist or musician?

Excellent!  Besides providing you with a space to play with your skills and talent, we also offer a Master’s program. Pros who choose to be Master’s (after some vetting…) can put on a Master’s badge in the club.  If you’re wearing that badge, you’re making yourself available to other members. They can ask you for critique, for advice, for help and encouragement. Masters can take their badges off if, or whenever, they want to become “just” members.

There will be some special perks for our Masters. But we hope that just sharing your muse with curious, brave people gets your blood running hot.

“And what if I just come in every day and use up all the supplies for my art?”  Well, you could do that.  Most canvases will be used and re-gessoed. Old brushes.  Half-filled tubes of paint.  Stuff like that.  We’re actually thinking you might bring some of your own used up supplies into the club to share!

There will be a recording studio and radio station. The recording studio will be rented by the hour at a pretty ridiculous rate to members only.  The radio station will train and accept regular radio hosts to do their own shows in ½ hour increments.  No experience necessary.  Relax.  It’s a micro broadcast. But real.

Challenges and Opportunities

People might not join. It’s a weird, slightly ridiculous concept. Can we take our years of experience in hosting creative events at our home and our support for Portland’s art community and turn it into a club?  Yes. We can.

As Portland’s population density soars, condo and apartment towers grow like forests. Ensconced in smaller spaces, bordered on two or three sides within inches of neighbors, the opportunity to have and play instruments or the room to dedicate to any kind of art is mostly a dream.

But, as a member of Artlandish, you have access to a perfect creative space with everything you need already sitting there for you to play.  One of our challenges is to design a process where members can keep their works-in-progress at the club, with their tools.  We’ve done it. Canvas and container racks will hold your stuff.

Perhaps our major challenge is to create a flexible space that can be changed in minutes to accommodate a concert, a poetry slam, a workshop, a dance, a debate…who knows what can happen?  We’re only going to set up a couple dedicated spaces: reception, storage, recording and radio studio. Probably sewing.

Everything else will be movable so that we can pick things up and re-assemble the giant space to fit whatever we need.

Why no kids? First, Portland is a city RIFE with businesses and places for children. (There’s even more for dogs!) While there will always be a desire for more, it’s not something Portland is crying out for.

We want to create a space that doesn’t need close supervision. A space that may not be exactly quiet, but is conducive to conversation and creativity. And we certainly don’t want to inhibit the art or music of our members by requiring it to be rated G.  And, did we mention, we’ll have beer and wine?

Why invest in Artlandish?

We work hard. Life, even in Portlandia, moves quickly. There’s a million things to do. Somewhere in the din of our Itty Bitty Shitty Committee, all the voices telling us what we need to do, how to do and be what everyone needs, how much money and time we don’t have, hurry up, get better, improve…somewhere in there should be a voice that says, “Come on in.  Breathe.  Play.  Everything will still be out there when you leave.”

William Stafford use to say two things to the poets and writers he mentored.
“Strive to be adequate.”  And, “When you’re stuck, lower your standards.” There is our inspiration and mission statement!

We have lots of spiffs for investors at any level.  Just supporting Artlandish with a smaller contribution gives hope to the real possibility of creating something new and powerful. It doesn’t just support the arts.  It supports play, freedom, laughter and experimentation.

At campaign membership levels you secure one of a very limited number, at fabulous founding member pricing.  When fully sold, memberships will revert to what we think will be about $600 a year.  Still a decent deal. As a founding member, though, you can get in for as little as $100 for a 6-month membership--available only during this campaign!

Invest in yourself.  Invest in play and creativity.  Invest in meeting new people, hearing new ideas, experiencing new challenges.  Invest in the space to chill in comfort and without hurry.

Be Artlandish.

What happens if the campaign doesn’t make its goal?

Well, we tried, didn’t we? Starting a new business, especially one that has no model to copy or emulate, requires some fearlessness (and perhaps a little foolishness).  We hope you’ll get us over our goal.

And if we exceed our goal?  Ah, security!  More and better furnishings. A better launch party.  More music and art supplies—both new and used.  And our grateful hearts.

What can you do?

Become a member.

Pass this campaign and project to your friends, neighbors and colleagues. Spread the word!

Look around you. Stray or un-used art supplies or musical instruments of any kind? Let us know…we’d love to give them new life and into Artlandish!

We’re looking for a piano.

Have some ideas you didn’t see here or on www.Artlandish.club?  Let us know!

Let’s bring play to PDX for the grownups!

story:
If you live in a rural area, you know it yourself.  The share of the population living the rural life is shrinking as large cities grow.  That reduces opportunities for education and employment, forcing the brightest young adults to leave town in order to make a living. 

Or maybe you're one of those people who left - but would prefer to live in the countryside if you could just figure out how to make a living there.

They are places that have bucked the trend.  These communities use broadband and information technology to eliminate distance as a barrier to growth and make digital networks take the place of the physical proximity that urban areas provide.  They are no longer in "the middle of nowhere." 

The people who live there are part of a dynamic economy and progressive community.  Innovative local businesses find global markets for their products and services.  Education thrives and graduates have the chance to build a life in the place they love.  Workers and employers pursue cutting-edge innovation while enjoying a quality of life their urban peers can only envy.   

These small towns and rural communities have lessons to share with each other and the rest of the world.  We need your help to get those lessons to the places that need them the most. 

We are the Intelligent Community Forum, a 15-year-old social enterprise that helps cities and regions use broadband and information technology to create prosperity, meet social challenges and strengthen their culture.  Two years ago, we launched a project (www.ruralimperative.com) focusing specifically on the problems and potential of rural regions.  The New Connected Countryside is our next step.

With your help, the New Connected Countryside will provide an online platform where community leaders, residents, institutions and businesses from around the world can connect, exchange advice, share resources and build a global network of peers.  Each year, they will come together for a virtual global conference featuring mayors, county executives, nonprofit leaders, technologists, educators, investors and all the other players in the new rural economy. 

Year round, they will share their discoveries, their successes, failures and lessons learned with each other.  Drawn by their passion for progress, they will forge bonds that help them to retain their talented youth, to grow businesses that provide good incomes, and to give local culture a global sounding board.    


Why We Need Your Help

A virtual collaboration platform is a low-cost way to bring innovators together – but it’s not free.  Our costs will include a high-quality Web platform providing registration, presentations, document libraries, online meet-ups and more, plus the human hours needed to curate the content, build participation and organize and market the annual conference. Your contribution makes it possible for The New Connected Community to get off the ground and complete its first year.  Future years will be funded by participants and organizations as well as donors like you.


A dozen leading rural communities have already committed to participate, from Mitchell, South Dakota and Quitman, Mississippi to Parkland County, Alberta and Whanganui, New Zealand.   The leaders of those communities are defining bold visions, taking risks and learning from experience how to translate connectivity into opportunity. 

Hundreds more communities are waiting for the opportunity.  Help us meet our fundraising goal, and you can be part of that network – and give people in rural communities around the world a chance for a better future. 

What Happens Next

When we reach our fundraising goal, we will:
  • Develop and launch the New Connected Countryside platform.
  • Learn from our subscribers what topics are most important to them.
  • Engage Discussion Leaders on those topics: email us if you would like to be considered as a Discussion Leader.
  • Invite contributions from recognized leaders in rural development.
  • Post videos, presentations and best practices drawn from the community of participants.
  • Schedule and produce the first virtual Rural Summit.
With your support, roll-out in stages can begin in April 2016.  But we can't do it without you.  Donate today at whatever level is right for you.

What We Have Done Before This?

  • Honored 134 cities and regions, large and small, around the world as Intelligent Communities,, selected through a rigorous process of analysis.
  • Published books and reports including Brain Gain: How Innovative Cities Create Job Growth in an Age of Disruption, Broadband Economies and Community as Canvas: Culture as a Development Tool.
  • Partnered with Minnesota's Blandin Foundation on the ground-breaking Rural Intelligent Communities program, for which we wrote the final report.  The program was cited in case studies published by the US National Telecommunications & Information Administration.
  • Created the Rural Imperative project as a focus for rethinking rural development in the broadband economy, and founded the Intelligent Community Institute at the Mississippi State Extension Service to research rural issues.


Press
These print and online publications have covered the work of the Intelligent Community Forum in recent years:


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but still would like to help: 

  • Share the news about The New Connected Community with your friends and colleagues who might be interested in contributing.  
  • Follow the Intelligent Community Forum LinkedIn Group, Facebook Page and on Twitter @newcommunities.

Thanks!

Thank you for your support!

This campaign has now ended; we hope you enjoyed the adventure as much as we did!

story:
Short Summary

Launching and operating an airline costs a lot of money. From the aircraft to the crews, it all adds up. The good news is that we have found investors who are willing to support Lakeshore Express' return to service by matching our funding goal, which will help us return with the most reliable model possible. So here's an opportunity to help us relaunch Lakeshore Express by Memorial Day Weekend 2015.


What We Need & What You Get



Our funding goal of $500,000 will help relaunch service and offset all costs associated with operating flights between Metro Detroit and Chicago, and Chicago and northern Michigan (Pellston). Summer schedules are listed below (Summer being Memorial Day Weekend thru Labor Day Weekend). 

Depending on your contribution amount, you'll receive one of the various "perks" listed to the right (if you are viewing on your mobile device click on the "Contribute Now" button above to view), ranging from the best one-way flight money can buy to a private charter for you and up to 29 of your closest friends and family! 

To be clear. We are NOT simply asking for money. Said "perks" are for tickets that you will be able to use once we restart operations (you are welcome to make a separate or added monetary contribution, should you just want to back our mission: To change the way people fly).


The Lakeshore Express Difference

We'd compare our service to another airline but there is no comparison. Outside of owning your own plane, there's simply not a better way to fly. Why? Because we offer a VIP flight experience for less than commercial airline prices. Think about that. Private terminals, free parking, free baggage handling, free cocktails and snacks. Arrive 20 minutes before your flight, avoiding the chaos and congestion of typical security lines. It really is that easy!


And compared to traditional forms of transportation, including car, train and bus? Well, it all comes down to a matter of time and convenience. We turn a six, seven, eight hour drive into a one hour flight. We give you the freedom of taking a weekend vacation without spending a full day of it commuting. We help you catch an important business meeting and get you back home that evening. We eliminate the stresses of traveling and put time back on your side.    

In conclusion, your contribution is making a difference because you're helping to change an entire industry and creating a new standard for the consumer air traveler experience.


Flights Between Chicago and Pellston

No sense in spending your vacation stuck in traffic. Get out of the jam and fly Lakeshore Express. Our convenient, one-hour flights take off after work (arriving before the weekend's first sunset) and return before you're do in on Monday morning. So you never have to take a day off (if you don't want to). Those headed to Chicago can enjoy a long weekend in the city while flying above the "crowds".


Flights Between Metro Detroit and Chicago

Whether for business or leisure, it's time to say NO MORE to I-94. Maximize your time visiting family and friends in Chicago or Detroit, or take advantage of our new flight schedule (7 day service), making business trips efficient and stress free.


Risk Free Commitment

If we don't make our goal by the proposed 30 day deadline your money is returned in full, without any further obligation to our campaign.

Free Transfers / Give The Gift of Lakeshore!

We understand plans change. That's why all tickets on Lakeshore Express are transferable to another person or available flight at no charge. Whether switching flights or giving a VIP gift to a family member or friend, you're backed by the Lakeshore Express Convenience Guarantee! 

GoGo Bonuses

1) All backers will enjoy a 72 Hour advanced booking window to secure flights before they are made available to the general public. The first ones onboard get to choose where they sit!

2) All backers will be added to our Early Bird Email Club, and will receive any special promotions up to 24 hours in advance of our general distribution list. If it's an offer you can't refuse, you'll be the first to know!

Campaign Q&A

We'd like to answer the most popular questions we've received thus far, hopefully clearing up any confusion and giving you the confidence to back Lakeshore Express:

Q: What happens if you reach your goal?

A: Simple, we fly. Guaranteed.

Q: What happens if you don't reach your goal?

A: Simple, we don't. 

Q: If you don't reach your goal what happens to our money?

A: Those that contributed get their money back. You owe us nothing. Period.

Q: If you reach your goal when do you plan to restart service?

A: Memorial Day Weekend

Q: Will you be flying all summer between Chicago and Pellston?

A: Yes, we will fly all summer! Service will be seasonal moving forward (Memorial Day Weekend through Labor Day Weekend). We will add flights after Labor Day based on demand, i.e. for Fall Color Season. We will also operate flights during the major holidays.

Q: What about flights between Metro Detroit and Chicago?

A: Service will be year-round and offer DAILY flights. Perfect for business and leisure travel.

Q: Are you just asking for money?

A: NO WAY! Our campaign is basically a pre-sale for tickets. All ticket options or "perks" are listed on the campaign page. You will be able to use your tickets once service starts, so you are getting something of value in return. Including a much better way to fly in the future!

Q: Are there any ticket limitations?

A: Tickets must be used within the first 3 months of service. We will add flights to accommodate demand, if necessary. You will also be privy to a 72 hour advanced booking window, giving you the opportunity to book your flights ahead of the general public. In short, you will be able to use your tickets!

Q: What if my plans change or I can't use my tickets personally?

A: All tickets are transferable to another person or available flight at no charge! 

Q: How many people do you need to back your campaign? $500,000 seems high, no?

A: Actually, it's not. We hope our funding goal isn't deterring you from making a contribution because, truth is, we only need 800 supporters, based on the average contribution thus far. That's 800 people in all of Chicago, Detroit and/or northern Michigan. 

Nearly 4,000 people have visited our campaign page to date. That's a lot of interest. We guarantee that if everyone who has thought about supporting us actually does, we will easily reach our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a monetary contribution to our campaign, no worries! You can still be a champion of our service by spreading the word and encouraging others in your network to make a contribution towards our goal and continuing on our flight path of changing the way people fly.  So use the Indiegogo share tools and help Lakeshore Express GoGo Wheels Up!
story_txt:
Short SummaryLaunching and operating an airline costs a lot of money. From the aircraft to the crews, it all adds up. The good news is that we have found investors who are willing to support Lakeshore Express' return to service by matching our funding goal, which will help us return with the most reliable model possible. So here's an opportunity to help us relaunch Lakeshore Express by Memorial Day Weekend 2015.
What We Need & What You GetOur funding goal of $500,000 will help relaunch service and offset all costs associated with operating flights between Metro Detroit and Chicago, and Chicago and northern Michigan (Pellston). Summer schedules are listed below (Summer being Memorial Day Weekend thru Labor Day Weekend). Depending on your contribution amount, you'll receive one of the various "perks" listed to the right (if you are viewing on your mobile device click on the "Contribute Now" button above to view), ranging from the best one-way flight money can buy to a private charter for you and up to 29 of your closest friends and family! To be clear. We are NOT simply asking for money. Said "perks" are for tickets that you will be able to use once we restart operations (you are welcome to make a separate or added monetary contribution, should you just want to back our mission: To change the way people fly).The Lakeshore Express DifferenceWe'd compare our service to another airline but there is no comparison. Outside of owning your own plane, there's simply not a better way to fly. Why? Because we offer a VIP flight experience for less than commercial airline prices. Think about that. Private terminals, free parking, free baggage handling, free cocktails and snacks. Arrive 20 minutes before your flight, avoiding the chaos and congestion of typical security lines. It really is that easy!
And compared to traditional forms of transportation, including car, train and bus? Well, it all comes down to a matter of time and convenience. We turn a six, seven, eight hour drive into a one hour flight. We give you the freedom of taking a weekend vacation without spending a full day of it commuting. We help you catch an important business meeting and get you back home that evening. We eliminate the stresses of traveling and put time back on your side.    In conclusion, your contribution is making a difference because you're helping to change an entire industry and creating a new standard for the consumer air traveler experience.
Flights Between Chicago and Pellston
No sense in spending your vacation stuck in traffic. Get out of the jam and fly Lakeshore Express. Our convenient, one-hour flights take off after work (arriving before the weekend's first sunset) and return before you're do in on Monday morning. So you never have to take a day off (if you don't want to). Those headed to Chicago can enjoy a long weekend in the city while flying above the "crowds".Flights Between Metro Detroit and ChicagoWhether for business or leisure, it's time to say NO MORE to I-94. Maximize your time visiting family and friends in Chicago or Detroit, or take advantage of our new flight schedule (7 day service), making business trips efficient and stress free.

If we don't make our goal by the proposed 30 day deadline your money is returned in full, without any further obligation to our campaign.Free Transfers / Give The Gift of Lakeshore!We understand plans change. story:
We´re Sabs and Mike, nice to meet you!

For English translation please klick now----->

Vielleicht denkt sich jetzt der ein oder andere; Dirndl Bar, Texas? Was soll jetzt das? Und warum soll ich da nun mit machen?

Wir, Sabs und Mike, waren viele Jahre in der Gastronomie tätig. Ob im Service, in der Küche, in der Verwaltung, als DJ oder auch als Manager. Auch unser Umfeld hier in Deutschland ist der Ansicht, dass die Gastronomie aufgrund unserer Art, unseres Humors und unserer breit gefächerten Qualifikationen genau das Richtige ist. Zudem betreiben wir seit über 9 Jahren eine Marketing Agentur. Teil unseres Angebots ist auch die Organisation von Messen, Events oder Veranstaltungen. 

Sabine und Michael, das sind wir!

Die Dirndl Bar in San Antonio Texas!
  • ist nicht nur eine weitere Bar
  • wird von wirklichen Bayern geführt und wird den bayerischen Flair transportieren
  • wird monatlich spezielle Events haben und natürlich ein ausgeklügeltes Marketing- und Vertriebskonzept
  • Garniert und serviert wird das Ganze mit/von feschen Dirndl Mädels
  • wird es nach 8 Jahren 5 mal in Texas geben!

Wir gehen das Ganze nicht blauäugig an. Wir arbeiten seit 2012 an dem Konzept. Sprachen mit vielen Personen aus der Alkoholindustrie, aus dem Marketing, mit Amerikanern, mit Texanern, mit Arbeiter oder Akademiker. Das Konzept wurde immer weiter verbessert und mit neuen Ideen angereichert. Als wir dann 2014 völlig überraschend und im ersten Anlauf in der Green Card Lottery gewannen, machte das unser Glück perfekt.

Aber reichen 56.200€? Der Gedanke könnte aufkommen. Und wir greifen gerne vorweg; "Nein, es reicht nicht." Aber wir fanden bereits einige Personen, die genauso begeistert von dem Projekt sind. Diese Personen und unser Eigenkapital bilden 100.000€. Des weiteren konnten wir vor Ort Firmen begeistern, so dass eine Theke, Zapfanlage und Gläser bereits gesichert sind. Uns fehlen noch 56.200€

Im April 2015 geht´s los. Amerika wir kommen. Der Gedanke, dass uns auf der Zielgerade die Luft aus geht, ist nicht wirklich berauschend. Dafür brauchen wir EUCH! Mit EUCH können wir unser Projekt doch noch verwirklichen, nachdem wir schon sehr weit gekommen sind. 


Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

  • Wie bereits beschrieben benötigen wir noch 56.200€. Davon wird unsere Dirndl Bar realisiert. Also Waren gekauft, die Bar eingerichtet, das Eröffnungsevent realisiert und die Dirndl Mädels rekrutiert. Aber das Wichtigste: Durch Dich wird unsere Bar wahr!
  • Wir haben tolle limitierte Dankeschöns vorbereitet und ab 15€ kannst Du dabei sein, zum Beispiel auf unsere online Wall of Fame. Für 40€ bekommst Du ein limitiertes Dirndl Bar Founder T-Shirt. Mit unseren Trinkhörnern oder verschiedenen Bierkrüge bist DU die Schau auf jeder Party. Mit unseren Schürzen und Brotzeitbrettln bist DU der Star in der Küche. Du kannst uns auch real, in Farbe und zum Anfassen erleben; Zum Beispiel auf unserer Abschiedsparty in Bayern oder bei unserem Eröffnungsevent mit speziellem Motto in Texas. Immer mit dabei; das Fernsehen und die lokale Presse. Social Media (Youtube, Facebook, Twitter, Blog usw.) versteht sich von selbst.
  • Hier gehts zu unserer Wall of Fame
  • Unser Dankeschön bildlich:


  • Sollten wir unser Finanzierungsziel hier nicht erreichen, so ist das sehr traurig für uns, aber für DICH kein Beinbruch.


  • Das hier gesammelte Geld wird zuerst auf ein Treuhandkonto von indiegogo einbezahlt und erst ausbezahlt, wenn der Fundingbetrag erreicht wurde. Sollte das nicht der Fall sein, bekommst Du dein Geld zurück. Und solltest Du hier anonym unterstützen wollen, so ist das hier auf der Plattform kein Problem.

Die Folgen

Hm, hier steht, wir sollen uns über die Folgen äußern....Klar würde die Erde sich auch ohne Dirndl Bars weiter drehen, aber wir sind da schon ganz klar der Meinung, dass die Welt da was verpassen würde :-)


Risiken & Nebenwirkungen....
Wir haben schon so manche Hürde gemeistert. Waren schon 2 mal am Ziel und mussten doch wieder von vorne beginnen. Mussten uns ein dickes Fell zulegen, wenn der Business Plan mal wieder nicht genehm war. Mussten oft neben unseren Jobs Nachtschichten einlegen, um unserem Ziel näher zu kommen und sind jetzt der Ansicht, dass Schlaf überbewertet wird.Und so schnell wirft uns nichts aus der Bahn. Wir durften hoffen, wir durften uns freuen, wir mussten aber auch oftmals schreien oder auch weinen, aber nichts hält uns von unserem Ziel der Dirndl Bar ab.

Right here right now

So und hier, genau JETZT startet unsere Geschichte! Geschichten müssen erzählt werden! Bitte unterstützt uns, und tragt auch die Geschichte weiter, damit wir unsere Drindl Bar realisieren können! Nutzt Twitter, Facebook, E-Mail und was Euch sonst noch so einfällt. Du kannst das hier bequem über indiegogo teilen, aber natürlich auch gerne Deine eigenen Tools benützen
Es beginnt bei DIR! Danke für Deine Unterstützung!

www.http://blog.dirndl-bar.de/
Unsere Dirndl Bar-Link->

story:
Short Summary

Drinkle is a web application that helps small businesses to manage their work and collaborate with their team. Drinkle is already released and live. We are looking for funds so that we can manage and market it. Checkout Drinkle.com

About Founder

My name is Sriram alias Kapil, I am a professional web developer and also founder and proprietor of the web designing & development company Tomatofry, I have been running Tomatofry from the last 4 years

The Idea

We were using multiple tools for managing my work, we were not fully satisfied with any of them, because none of the tool had everything we needed, they were not customizable enough, so we had an idea of creating a tool with requirements and ideas we had. And then here it is Drinkle.com.

Here are few things you would love about Drinkle.

The Design

For us, we could only use a good looking software, if we had to choose from a bad looking software with all features and good looking software with less features, then we would choose good looking software. Because that is how we could love working, or else it would be boring.

The Customizablity

Every company has their own method of managing, let it be their incoming leads, or their projects or tasks. Companies are different in sizes, in their structures, and in their administration, so they do need the flexibility of changing the features, to the deepest level. So in Drinkle, we made sure everything is customizable.

Updates


Who doesnt like updates, untill they dont bring in more bugs, at Drinkle since we had launched it 8 months ago, The code has grown 3 times in size, we ourselves feel excited to introduce new features in the application and code them with love and passion.

Progress Till Date

We couldn't market Drinkle very well enough, because of the limited budget we have. We managed to run it with the profit from Tomatofry. Till date we have upto 500 signups and more than 25 companies have used this for more than 10 days long and around 10 companies are still using it. Its not been great stats for me either, but thats what you get when you dont put money into marketing.

Why Do We Need Funds

We need funds so that I can market our application to the next level. All the companies who tried Drinkle had very much positive review and response on Drinkle, I want to share it with more companies so that more people can find it and fall in love with it.

We strongly believe that with the funds I have raised in this campaign, I would be able to have enough customers to give me enough profit that we can rotate and keep it running(Like the escape velocity for the satellite to give it enough push so that it keeps orbiting endlessly around the world, its someone like that).

So thats about Drinkle, if you have further questions please let them in comments section. Also dont forget to try our application, its available for free.

story:
Friends, I want to present you a sellpax program – an ideal systems for finding clients and contractors. After specifying demands and offers, the system will conduct an independent search under your given criterions, seek customers/contractors and inform you on results. No need to waste your time now.

 +4 instruments for conducting an on-line business.

More specifically:

•  Self-adapting site/shop powered by web-card technologies
•  Advertising campaigns to attract customers from the Internet
•  E-mail marketing for sales expansion
•  CRM structuring and automation system

Platform was tested on Ukrainian market and operated under INFOBIZ brand. During the testing period, beta-version was used by 2279 enterprises. The project is currently upgraded in order to globalize it. After that is will be launched throughout all the countries and transferred from http://infobiz.in.ua to http://sellpax.com. Main goal of this project – to promote the development of small and medium business through all the countries. New upgrades are aimed to create a useful service of highest quality commonly available for entrepreneurs in term of pricing politics. Annual access cost is planned to be reduced to a minimum of 25$ per year.

I have a team of experienced specialists with more than 7 years of working experience. But in order to maintain their work I need new funds, so I invite you to support this project. 

Project commercialization: Platform and its instruments access is provided on a on a fee paid basis at the amount of 25$ per year. Flexible adjustments are conditioned individually for each country.

Client base: b2b segment employing Internet services and IT solutions for business promotion. Five year plan including more than 320000 entrpreneurs. sellpax project in social networks - https://vk.com/sellpax and https://www.facebook.com/sellpax

Implementation term – 2 months. An amount of $33600 is necessary for launching and implementing the sellpax project.

- Office rent $2300
- Remuneration for 5 employed software specialists for software components implementation $21200
- Google advertizing for increasing the client base in other countries $5500
- Server service fees $2000 (Intel XeonE3-1270)
- Contingent liabilities $1000
- % indiegogo $1600

Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a 1-3 years free license.

Please share this project with your fellow-entrepreneurs. Your aid will promote this project and make the sellpax widely known.


Bonuses (PERKS) for those who support the project:

($15) - 1 year platform access license.

Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a free 1 year license.

($40) 3 years platform access license.

Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a free 3 years license.

($80) 1 year license and manager support on a turnkey basis

Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a free 1 year license and manager support on a turnkey basis, namely: 

  • Expert setting and filling adaptative internet-shop content on a platform basis, (up to 80 cards)
  • Setting SMS order notification
  • Adjusting optimum demand and offer trends in order to increase maximum potential clients and offers quantity on a platform basis.
  • Business research performance for choosing keywords and attraction of target audience from Google/Yandex search engines, launching advertizing campaigns upon presence of advertizing budget.
  • Analysis and correction in order to optimize advertizing campaigns.
  • Creation and development of 1-2 models for mailing.
  • Promotion of up to 5 commodity items into outer catalogues TOP-list.
  • Consulting and training on all aspects of platform instruments.

($220) 3 years license and manager support on a turnkey basis

Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a free 3 years license and manager support on a turnkey basis, namely: 

  • Expert setting and filling adaptative internet-shop content on a platform basis, (up to 80 cards)
  • Setting SMS order notification
  • Adjusting optimum demand and offer trends in order to increase maximum potential clients and offers quantity on a platform basis.
  • Business research performance for choosing keywords and attraction of target audience from Google/Yandex search engines, launching advertizing campaigns upon presence of advertizing budget.
  • Analysis and correction in order to optimize advertizing campaigns.
  • Creation and development of 1-2 models for mailing.
  • Promotion of up to 5 commodity items into outer catalogues TOP-list.
  • Consulting and training on all aspects of platform instruments.

Friends, I want to present you a sellpax program – an
ideal systems for finding clients and contractors. After specifying demands and
offers, the system will conduct an independent search under your given
criterions, seek customers/contractors and inform you on results. No need to
waste your time now.
 +4 instruments
for conducting an on-line business.
More specifically:
•  Self-adapting
site/shop powered by web-card technologies
•  Advertising campaigns to
attract customers from the Internet
•  E-mail marketing for sales
expansion
•  CRM structuring and automation
system
Platform was tested on Ukrainian market and operated
under INFOBIZ brand. During the testing period, beta-version was used by 2279
enterprises. The project is currently upgraded in order to globalize it. After
that is will be launched throughout all the countries and transferred from
http://infobiz.in.ua to http://sellpax.com. Main goal of this project – to
promote the development of small and medium business through all the countries.
New upgrades are aimed to create a useful service of highest quality commonly
available for entrepreneurs in term of pricing politics. Annual access cost is
planned to be reduced to a minimum of 25$ per year.
I have a team of experienced specialists with more
than 7 years of working experience. But in order to maintain their work I need
new funds, so I invite you to support this project.  
Project commercialization: Platform and its
instruments access is provided on a on a fee paid basis at the amount of 25$
per year. Flexible adjustments are conditioned individually for each country.
Client base: b2b segment employing Internet services
and IT solutions for business promotion. Five year plan including more than
320000 entrpreneurs. sellpax project in social networks -
https://vk.com/sellpax and https://www.facebook.com/sellpax
Implementation term – 2 months. An amount of $33600 is
necessary for launching and implementing the sellpax project. 
- Office rent $2300
- Remuneration for 5 employed software specialists for software components
implementation $21200
- Google advertizing for increasing the client base in other countries $5500
- Server service fees $2000 (Intel XeonE3-1270)
- Contingent liabilities $1000
- % indiegogo $1600
Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a
1-3 years free license.
Please share this project with your
fellow-entrepreneurs. Your aid will promote this project and make the sellpax
widely known.Bonuses (PERKS) for those who support the project:($15) - 1 year platform access license.
Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a
free 1 year license.

($40) 3 years platform access
license.
Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a free 3 years license.

($80) 1 year license and
manager support on a turnkey basis
Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a
free 1 year license and manager support on a turnkey basis, namely: 

Expert setting and
     filling adaptative internet-shop content on a platform basis, (up to 80
     cards) 
Setting SMS order notification
Adjusting optimum demand
     and offer trends in order to increase maximum potential clients and offers
     quantity on a platform basis.
Business research performance for choosing
     keywords and attraction of target audience from Google/Yandex search engines,
     launching advertizing campaigns upon presence of advertizing budget.
Analysis and correction in order to
     optimize advertizing campaigns.
Creation and development of 1-2 models for
     mailing.
Promotion of up to 5 commodity items into
     outer catalogues TOP-list.
Consulting and training on all aspects of
     platform instruments.


($220) 3 years license
and manager support on a turnkey basis
Entrepreneurs supporting the project will be granted a
free 3 years license and manager support on a turnkey basis, namely: 

Expert setting and
     filling adaptative internet-shop content on a platform basis, (up to 80
     cards) 
Setting SMS order notification
Adjusting optimum demand
     and offer trends in order to increase maximum potential clients and offers
     quantity on a platform basis.
Business research performance for choosing

     mailing.

     platform instruments.

story:
Patrick Hampton: The Power of a Name

  • Project Name: Patrick Hampton: The Power of a Name
  • Genre: Documentary/ Social Experiment (Short Film)
  • Rating: PG
  • Budget: $15,000+
  • Producers: Patrick J. Hampton
  • Writer/ IP Holder: Patrick J. Hampton & Patrick D. Hampton
  • Shooting: Spring 2016
  • Distribution: Indie, Viral
  • Status: Development




Project Highlights:

  • Breaking Social Barriers
  • North American History and the Repercussions of Slavery
  • Current Media/ Press Interest
  • The Exploitation Social Media and the Viral Market
  • Revolutionary and Modest
  • Exposing Calgary, AB and Cleveland, TN in a positive light. 

Synopsis (short version): 

“Two men with very diverse backgrounds share one thing, a name.” 

Location Details: 

Calgary, LA, and Chattanooga,  have been scouted. We will be paying rate for the job because of the size and specialty of the crews. Time is of essence with this project.

Calgary, AB is becoming a center point in the worlds eye. Alberta offers many grants and incentives the support the filming of any film project.

Chattanooga, TN is within 100 miles of Atlanta, Georgia which is one of the biggest film centers in North America. 

When?

Because of the potential copycat projects we are looking to shoot ASAP. February is “Black Month History” in both Canada and USA. March 17th is St. Patrick Day’s and would be another ideal time to film. Releasing date could have an impact on the presidential race.

Why?

Generalizations is a common tool used in hate speech. We hope to break down barriers of labeling. Showing that every individual has the power to change the world, by two very honorable examples some would call a hero.

Story & Synopsis (long version):

Patrick Hampton: The Power of a Name, the name Patrick was derived from latin meaning “nobleman”. This documentary is the meeting of two minds with two very diverse backgrounds and opposite political views who honor their namesake. 

These last few years Patrick J. and Patrick D. have been battling for the #1 spot on search google. Over a bragging Facebook post, Patrick D. Hampton rubbing in with over 8,000 Facebook likes he had finally took the number one stop. During the thread on of Patrick D.’s friend comment on how Patrick J. should make a movie about him. Needless to say under mutual agreement the men decided to meet and film the experience.

We will follow Patrick D. (Patrick) and Patrick J. (Paddy) into their daily lives. Showing that even though they come from different philosophies, they are spiritual leaders in their respected communities. Having the same name we will travel back through the Hampton roots and how they came to America, as we research origins of a name with the potentially resent genetic ancestors.

A general meet-up will be arranged either in Chattanooga, Los Angeles, or online between Patrick’s of political hot-topic question ranging from absence, medical marijuana, family values, and culture apparitions. We will film the initial round table discussion of minds.

Paddy will travel to Tennessee to spend time with Patrick during daily his life. They we go through Patrick’s social work and community activities, volunteering while gathering good exposure of the facility. We will also show what an example of a father he is and leader to the community. Potentially, bringing Paddy along to a Ted Cruz event making him humbly work for it.

Patrick will get a taste of the Entertainment world. Based of what is agreed and the timing of filming. Paddy is ready to offer Patrick a role in his new project, “The Rise of Kings” being filmed in Calgary, AB. If filming requires timing, Paddy can setup activities in Nashville and/or Atlanta that would push the storyline forward for the documentary. Paddy’s is also a shaman apprentice of Bill Bertschy who a Sun Dance and Ghost Dance Chief who has offered to put on a sweat lodge for the sake of this film.

Since, the Patrick’s are going over politically sensitive topics that are being asked in politics today. On St. Paddy’s Day (March 17th), Tim Moen the Head of the Libertarian Party is competing in a Charity Boxing Match. Paddy will be in attendance to support his friend and great excuse for the Patrick’s to meet.

The Cast: 


Patrick Hampton


Paddy “pH” Hampton - Writer/ Executive Producer/ Artist - Heart Moore Entertainment

Self-coined as the “cardinal sinner of screenwriting”, Paddy “pH” Hampton has had multiple first drafts accepted into festivals around the circuit. He hosts the Calgary Screenwriter's room, creating Calgary content and in pre-production for his film, "The Rise of Kings". Paddy has been approached by the Libertarian Party of Canada to run with them during the next election and is a shaman apprentice of Heyoka Bill Bertschy who recently won, “Citizen of the Year” in Fort McMurray, AB. Paddy is known for his work ethic, strong multi-layered storylines, and Tarantino-like approach to his career. In his free time pH raps at open mics and performs around YYC, hr is a founding member of Vaudvill in North Hollywood. With a slate of work ready to go, he’s defining himself as a major player in the craft and business of film and entertainment.


Patrick D. Hampton - Director of Goodwill YouthAdvantage Mentoring Program

Channel 9 Interview with Patrick D. Hampton

Within the Chattanooga community and abroad, Patrick D. Hampton serves as a voice of strength for this generation.  An architect for social change, as well as an innate ability to both influence and inspire, Patrick is one of today's most gifted leaders in both the spiritual and social arenas.  Mr. Hampton's roles as a youth director, advocate, and strategist have spanned from serving as an abstinence educator in the Hamilton County Public Schools to being the Director of Goodwill YouthAdvantage Mentoring Program. His commitment to fostering broad-based communication about issues related to youth culture on a local, national and international level have led to hundreds of speaking requests, as he travels the world addressing both teens and parents.  As a voice for social change, Hampton is passionate about his work.

Structure:

Patrick Hampton: The Power of a Name will run under its own LLC (Patrick Hampton, LLC) so as to cost account the project. The working title of the movie herein is: “Patrick Hampton”. Our team is working on Government grants that will allow an additions $15G to our Print & Advertising budget covering filming cost in needed.

Marketability and Industry Performance: 

In under 24 hours after a pitch on Patrick D. Hampton’s Facebook page. His fan base gave over 350 likes about this concept. High potential becoming a “cult classic”.

The Company:

Patrick Hampton, LLC (“The Company”) is a newly-formed independent film production company managed by an executive team with over 10+ years of management/ production experience and  10+ years of digital production experience.



The company forms an LLC specific to each movie’s IP as the locations and budgets are finalized. Patrick is a resident of Alberta, establishing a localized legal entity to greatly improve the receipt of the tax incentives that we use either as either finishing funds of for P&A (Prints and Advertising). We only produce digitally mastered movies. We only produce digitally mastered movies so there is no “Printing” needed. Our work-flow is entirely digital. FX, color correcting, sound, using a shoot, and masterful story-line helping to master the digital work-flow.

The Concept:

The series “Patrick Hampton: Power of a Name”, is a twist on a popular and highly marketable entertainment reality genre like "Undercover Boss" or "Wife: Swap". Showing the power of social media and individuality of this project is meant to inspire people to be the best they can be and fight for their dreams.

Relevancy:

This project was designed to attack pop-culture stigmas using real life heroes and examples, attracting an audience, and keep them wanting more all while regulating the content releases systematically. Watching this project grow and develop will make people want more. Changing lives and giving hope.

All Digital Productions and Distribution: 

All assets will be produced and distributed digitally. With billions of eyes online social media. We have designed a viral marketing campaign to attract and entertain our fans. Maximizing our exposure and peoples impulse to support our movement or buy our product. 

Digital Production:

On set, we shoot with the camera that is best suited for the project. All footage from camera phones to 4k to using technology to enhance the experience with the audience. 

Premieres and Release:

Filmmaking is an event from development to the screening. We plan on returning our thanks to the cast and crew by providing release screenings and parties filming some of this events for Patrick Hampton: Power of a Name. Maximizing our gratitude and community contact.

Distribution Strategy:

With a strong PR campaign, inviting press, and media to public releases. We will release the film to the the festival circuit. With the market demand we will be pushing for a national theatrical release. A fund with be set aside to facilitate more interactions like the one we are creating. There have already been requests by media for interviews based of the Facebook post. 

Social Media:

Our social media presents will grow during the film of this project. This concept was born because of it and will be a focal point to the film.

Film Timetable:

As soon as funds are placed in an operating account, we will hire key crew, and lock in a shooting schedule. Our goal is to begin on or before March 17th, 2016. (St. Patrick’s Day)

Franchise Opportunity:

Multiplying the branding of Patrick Hampton by two. We can also hire Football player Patrick Hampton from Penn State to talk to kids maximizing the brand with inspirational heroes. Merchandise and creating a film movement will help create a fund to recreate this process. This film can be compared as Patrick Hampton's, "Full-tilt Boogie".

Risk Mitigation Plan for Patrick Hampton: The Power of a Name 

PHASE I

The first phase in our plan is to sell the rights to a distributor to raise capital funds as well as a proper crowd funding campaign (Indiegogo).

PHASE II

This will be tied into product placement opportunities, tax incentives and licensing, all furthering the payback to the investors. It is our plan to use the product placement and grants to promote the series. Strong political ties.

PHASE III

The third phase of our plan is recovering the financing is distribution. Youtube offer’s an amazing platform to monetize and promote the project. We will create a fund to sponsor more events like this and a mentorship foundation to connect students with mentors.

Conclusion:

The market appeal makes Patrick Hampton: The Power of a Name, an automatic winner from a pop-culture and economic stand point. Both Patrick’s have built respectable brands creating real heroes as mentors of the younger generation. This collaboration will promote both of their independent careers creating a movement with the potential of world-wide ramifications. There is a high potential that “Power of a Name” will be a cult-classic and used for educational purposes.

Basic Budget: 

 

Contact Us: PowerofaName@gmail.com
