story:
Help a Small Business Grow, and Help a Community


(Thum's Son, Thum, Kris & cousin Fun)

What happens when three brothers, separated by 6,000 miles, come together over a shared love of music and rhythm? 

We are brothers, musicians, artists, family and our heritage spans two continents. Kris and I grew up in Wales, in an area of outstanding natural beauty. A land of folk tales, castles and poetry (and Tom Jones!).

 And our cousin Thum grew up in Thailand, an ancient sub-tropical kingdom with its own rich history of music, great warriors and spirituality. 

Last summer Kris visited our cousin Thum in Thailand for the first time since they had played together as children. Although they didn't share a language; with art, music and blood between them they found that, though they had been separated by 6000 miles, they had grown into young men with similar passions, ideas, hopes and dreams. 

Donate now!


Thum makes Binghi Drums and plays music whenever he can find the time, while working full time on a farm to support his  young family. As a parting gift he made Kris and I a Binghi Drum to take back to Wales so we could carry on jamming half the world away. 

When Kris got home and we used the Binghi to jam - lightening struck! 

With Thum's artistic skill and our business knowledge we could bring these beautiful, musical pieces of art to the world! Kris and I were amazed at how easily we incorporated the Binghi into our music, how accessible it would be to everyone, not just skilled musicians. 

... and Thaibinghi was born. 


Please, support our dream. 

We want to bring these Thai-style, handmade, Nyabinghi drums to the world! 

We're currently in the very early stages of planning and building the business into an online entity, to distribute these beautiful handmade Binghi Drums all around the globe wherever there are jams and good vibes. 

We can see ThaiBinghi's in:
  • schools
  • with religious groups
  • professional and amateur musicians
  • used in meditation/therapy
  • as show pieces in every home!

But it won't stop there!

We want to create a community in Thailand, where Thum can train more Artisan Drum Makers, where they can earn a good living from being artists and musicians, from doing what they love! 


But we need your help.

£2,500 will pay for a few Thaibinghi drums to be made and to mature the business. Your help will enable us to:
  • Pay Thum a fair wage so that he can concentrate on developing his craft
  • Test Market the Binghi's
  • Explore more Thaibinghi designs
  • Develop the web platform for our online business
  • Lay the foundations and grow the dream
We are currently receiving invaluable business mentorship from The Princes Trust, your donations will enable us to take the first few steps in growing into a small, ethical and sustainable business. 

Working with Thum and local suppliers means there is no middleman to pay. The biggest challenge in this stage is streamlining and perfecting the production process, supporting Thum so that he can concentrate on developing our line of handmade drums and building the business so that we're ready to bring Thaibinghi to the world. 


Our hopes for the future of Thaibinghi


Workshop 

One day we hope to have a workshop and design studio in Thailand, where we can build a community of skilled artisan drum makers, pay fair wages and make art into a good living for local Thai people. 


At the moment material costs are high because Thum has to walk miles to get the materials... One day we’d like to buy Thum a vehicle because at the moment he can only get materials for one Binghi, per walk…! 



Sustainability

Part of our ethos is sustainability, doing great things in the right way. We would seek to utilise the most sustainable routes in our production, building of the workshop and in business.


Part of the vision is to one day have a Thaibinghi ethical clothing range… you could help us realise this dream! ...and get some cool threads!


Community

We want to build a community where art and creativity is celebrated and where our artisan drum makers can make a living from their art. In this way we hope to support the local people and the local environment by putting back into the Thai economy, paying fair wages and locally sourcing all our materials from sustainable origins. 


The ThaiBinghi community we’d like to create would celebrate art and creativity as a valuable trade. We’d seek to grow this community, providing opportunities for more than Thum and his son, we want to train local people who share in this passion for music and creativity. 


Quality

Quality handmade musical instruments with soul, that don’t cost the earth. 

Our Binghi Drums are not only instruments but beautiful pieces of art. They are made from:

  • Sustainable and locally sourced Momosa Wood
  • Quality hand-worked metal
  • Free range goat hide

     


Get drumming into the mainstream

Drumming is unique and accessible by anyone. 


Rhythm is an ancient therapy and a way to connect with the moment and the people around us. We feel that everyone can benefit from this practice, drumming is already going through a revival and we want to add to this momentum by creating, not only practical and quality Binghis, but beautiful drums that don't cost the earth. 


(Jim feeling the rhythm!)

 

Rewards

At the moment Thaibinghi is in the infant stages, so no Binghis as rewards yet...!

But... We want to make sure you get something back for your generosity! So we have some rewards that we think you'll like!
Binghi Helper - A social media shout out
Binghi Friend - You get a video thank you from Thum, from Thailand!
Binghi Champion - For a higher donation you get a video thanks from Thum and a Binghi tutorial video from Kris!
Binghi Superstar - **Only a limited number of these** Get yourself immortalised in song! We will write you into a Ska/Reggae thank you song and you will be internet famous
Binghi Deity - **Only a limited number of these** For an outstanding donation you get an original ThaiBinghi painting by CEO Jim sent straight to your door in the post! 

If you donate and help us take these first steps, the next campaign will have some awesome rewards that will definitely get you in the rhythm!
And... keep an eye on the project. We'll be keeping you up to date with videos and messages throughout. Get social on your favourite social media platforms and share the Thaibinghi dream - be a part of the ripple effect. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any extra money to donate?  Don't worry, there are other ways you can help:

  • Love facebook? Post this campaign on your facebook page, and share it with your email contacts
  • Like our other social media to stay up to date with the Thaibinghi dream!
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thaibinghi/ 
  • Iconosuqare: http://iconosquare.com/thaibinghi 
  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thaibinghi/ 
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/ThaiBinghi?lang=en-gb
  • Visit our website: www.thaibinghi.weebly.com (a work in progress)

Remember to share the ThaiBinghi dream, many, many times! 


Thank you!
story_txt:
Help a Small Business Grow, and Help a Community(Thum's Son, Thum, Kris & cousin Fun)
What happens when three brothers, separated by 6,000 miles, come together over a shared love of music and rhythm? 

We are brothers, musicians, artists, family and our heritage spans two continents. Kris and I grew up in Wales, in an area of outstanding natural beauty. A land of folk tales, castles and poetry (and Tom Jones!).

 And our cousin Thum grew up in Thailand, an ancient sub-tropical kingdom with its own rich history of music, great warriors and spirituality. 

Last summer Kris visited our cousin Thum in Thailand for the first time since they had played together as children. Although they didn't share a language; with art, music and blood between them they found that, though they had been separated by 6000 miles, they had grown into young men with similar passions, ideas, hopes and dreams. 


Donate now!


Thum makes Binghi Drums and plays music whenever he can find the time, while working full time on a farm to support his  young family. As a parting gift he made Kris and I a Binghi Drum to take back to Wales so we could carry on jamming half the world away. 


When Kris got home and we used the Binghi to jam - lightening struck! 

With Thum's artistic skill and our business knowledge we could bring these beautiful, musical pieces of art to the world! Kris and I were amazed at how easily we incorporated the Binghi into our music, how accessible it would be to everyone, not just skilled musicians. 

... and Thaibinghi was born. 





Please, support our dream. 
We want to bring these Thai-style, handmade, Nyabinghi drums to the world! 

We're currently in the very early stages of planning and building the business into an online entity, to distribute these beautiful handmade Binghi Drums all around the globe wherever there are jams and good vibes. 

We can see ThaiBinghi's in:

schools
with religious groups

professional and amateur musicians

used in meditation/therapy
as show pieces in every home!


But it won't stop there!

We want to create a community in Thailand, where Thum can train more Artisan Drum Makers, where they can earn a good living from being artists and musicians, from doing what they love! 



But we need your help.

£2,500 will pay for a few Thaibinghi drums to be made and to mature the business. Your help will enable us to:


Pay Thum a fair wage so that he can concentrate on developing his craft
Test Market the Binghi's
Explore more Thaibinghi designs
Develop the web platform for our online business
Lay the foundations and grow the dream
We are currently receiving invaluable business mentorship from The Princes Trust, your donations will enable us to take the first few steps in growing into a small, ethical and sustainable business. 

Working with Thum and local suppliers means there is no middleman to pay. The biggest challenge in this stage is streamlining and perfecting the production process, supporting Thum so that he can concentrate on developing our line of handmade drums and building the business so that we're ready to bring Thaibinghi to the world. 






Our hopes for the future of Thaibinghi


Workshop 

One day we hope to have a workshop and design studio in Thailand, where we can build a community of skilled artisan drum makers, pay fair wages and make art into a good living for local Thai people. 

At the moment material costs are high because Thum has to walk miles to get the materials... One day we’d like to buy Thum a vehicle because at the moment he can only get materials for one Binghi, per walk…! 





Sustainability

Part of our ethos is sustainability, doing great things in the right way. We would seek to utilise the most sustainable routes in our production, building of the workshop and in business.

Part of the vision is to one day have a Thaibinghi ethical clothing range… you could help us realise this dream! ...and get some cool threads!

Community

We want to build a community where art and creativity is celebrated and where our artisan drum makers can make a living from their art. In this way we hope to support the local people and the local environment by putting back into the Thai economy, paying fair wages and locally sourcing all our materials from sustainable origins. 

The ThaiBinghi community we’d like to create would celebrate art and creativity as a valuable trade. We’d seek to grow this community,  providing opportunities for  more than Thum and his son, we want to train local people who share in this passion for music and creativity. 

Quality

Quality handmade musical instruments with soul, that don’t cost the earth. 
Our Binghi Drums are not only instruments but beautiful pieces of art. They are made from:


Sustainable and locally sourced Momosa Wood
Quality hand-worked metal
Free range goat hide


     




Get drumming into the mainstream

Drumming is unique and accessible by anyone. 

Rhythm is an ancient therapy and a way to connect with the moment and the people around us. We feel that everyone can benefit from this practice, drumming is already going through a revival and we want to add to this momentum by creating, not only practical and quality Binghis, but beautiful drums that don't cost the earth. 


(Jim feeling the rhythm!)

 
Rewards
At the moment Thaibinghi is in the infant stages, so no Binghis as rewards yet...!But... We want to make sure you get something back for your generosity! So we have some rewards that we think you'll like!

Binghi Helper - A social media shout out

Binghi Friend - You get a video thank you from Thum, from Thailand!

Binghi Champion - For a higher donation you get a video thanks from Thum and a Binghi tutorial video from Kris!

Binghi Superstar - **Only a limited number of these** Get yourself immortalised in song! We will write you into a Ska/Reggae thank you song and you will be internet famous

Binghi Deity - **Only a limited number of these** For an outstanding donation you get an original ThaiBinghi painting by CEO Jim sent straight to your door in the post! 

If you donate and help us take these first steps, the next campaign will have some awesome rewards that will definitely get you in the rhythm!
And... keep an eye on the project. We'll be keeping you up to date with videos and messages throughout. Get social on your favourite social media platforms and share the Thaibinghi dream - be a part of the ripple effect. 




Other Ways You Can Help
Don't have any extra money to donate?  Don't worry, there are other ways you can help:


Love facebook? Post this campaign on your facebook page, and share it with your email contacts
Like our other social media to stay up to date with the Thaibinghi dream!
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thaibinghi/ 
Iconosuqare: http://iconosquare.com/thaibinghi 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thaibinghi/ 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ThaiBinghi?lang=en-gb

Visit our website: www.thaibinghi.weebly.com (a work in progress)

Remember to share the ThaiBinghi dream, many, many times! 

Thank you!

story:
Who Are We!

We are a group of people who have banded to start a business Together, most of us live in the United Kingdom, one of us live in Germany, and one of us lives in U.S.A.

We intend to start as working from home (where we live), and our business would be to Host online services like web hosting, cloud storage, Virtual servers and desktops, but also Game servers, and voice communication servers.

Where would we Begin:

We would begin by Registering for licenses not just company licenses and a license to operate, we would start by getting software licenses for admin panels and website hosting panels ( real paid for software) Then, we will apply this to  a series of dedicated servers.  Our Website would be the selling page where people can order a online service, most of our admin time would be focused on support and order processing, our aim would be to provide our online services in the most reliable way possible

We are thankful:

Our first bite of the profit would be so much to celebrate because your contributions would never be forgotten, our way to thank our top contributors would be to name our first owned server after our top contributors to remind us all who made it happen, and we Promise to make sure your name is always there to remind us

What happens if our business is that successful:

we are looking to one day get our own premises in the UK where we can be based as our head office called Hedgehog House, but one day we could look at hosting a small data center. Could You be the one to make it Happen?

Could You be the one to make it Happen?

story:
Welcome to Latte Stoned Wellness Center!

Wellness is the condition of being in optimum health. It is a holistic blend of physical, mental, and spiritual well-being--the result of consciously choosing to live a quality life. The path of natural health and wellness is a life-long journey that requires personal responsibility and commitment.

Right now is your opportunity to be a part of this unique project. In doing so, you are helping us to offer the local and global community a place for ultimate relaxation; therapy services treated with love that brings people together to be nourished and heal together.

Our vision is also unique because we want to be more than a spa providing services. We want to create a collaborative wellness center that both trains new students in their field and also employs these professionals on a free-lance basis. 

By acting now you have the opportunity to donate, receive services and products at a substantial discount and help us to manifest Latte Stoned Wellness Center.

Help Us: we are not only looking to raise funds but also to spread the word about Latte Stoned Wellness Center!

Please help spread our message by:

  • Sharing this campaign with friends
  • Jump on social media and ‘like’ and share our page
  • Sign up for our mailing list to stay in the loop!

Every thought counts and we appreciate each and every one of you for your support!

And for those who support us through their love, sharing with friends and through social media outlets, we thank you, thank you, THANK YOU! 

Therapy mixed with love, high quality and simple acts of gratitude can support community togetherness and to live happier and more fulfilling lives.

Please take the step now to purchase our goods and services at a discount and you will be helping to BRING THIS PROJECT TO LIFE!

 Become a part of bringing alternative therapy and healthy living to Guam.

With love and gratitude,

Latte Stoned Wellness Center

story:
A desktop rotational casting machine built on an sturdy aluminum frame that allows you to make multiple duplicates of a plastic hollow part quickly and cost effectively.

With the power to produce small production runs of your parts from the comfort of your own personal workspace, the REVOcaster is a 3D making tool that expands the creative horizon for makers.



"One of the most intriguing forthcoming machines in the 3D printing community."
-3ders.org

"Need to print out a lot of items quickly? You might want to check out the Revo. "
-Fabbaloo
                 

          

                              


The REVOcaster uses molds filled with liquid resins to make its parts, and the rotating nature of the machine pushes all the liquid to the edges of the mold to make the cast hollow. As the machine spins, the resin solidifies, and after 10-15 minutes your part is ready.

You can print molds on your 3D Printer (negatives of your 3D designs) in either ABS or PLA (We tested all of our molds in both materials and have had GREAT results with both, most of our test molds including the robot head are made out of PLA).

Keep in mind that you don't need a 3D Printer at all to utilize the REVOcaster. There are many ways to make / purchase molds, and if you don't have a 3D printer you definitely still get the full potential of using the REVOcaster (In fact, for some parts it is necessary to use a silicone mold due to the flexibility of silicone vs the stiffness of 3D printed molds).

          

                       

          



The material we've tested the REVOcaster for is a quick setting 2 part epoxy resin. But with the right molds, you can use clear resins, chocolate, waxes, rubbers, amber resins, and a variety of other creative solutions waiting to be discovered.

A really interesting thing with the epoxy resins is you can use dyes and powders to change the coloring of the finishes, or give the final product a metallic / bronze look. We've had some REALLY exciting results using dyes (and even food coloring) to create swirling patterns on our casts, and used bronze powder to give a very impressive looking bronze figurine. These techniques are a very inexpensive solution to really change the finish of your products and differentiate your parts from other manufactured parts.



The REVOcaster is still in it's prototype phase. The key mechanics are finalized, but certain parts are still being further tested and research is still being done to make our prototype version even better for the final design that backers will recieve.

The mold mount is one of the last pieces of the puzzle, and our latest mold mount design will be released in an early backer update once we get a chance to fully test it. Making the process of mounting your mold to the REVOcaster seamless and easy to understand is our number one design priority at this stage.

As we further develop the prototype design, we will be updating backers and accepting feedback along the way. This will allow backers to really be a part of the development process for the REVOcaster.

               

  





The REVOcaster is a tool designed to inspire creative thinking. A new tool for makers to really expand what they can make with their imagination and ingenuity. A machine that adds to the wonder and joy of creating new, exciting things for the world to see, explore, and hold in their hands.

Makers, tinkerers, and artists are going to LOVE using the REVOcaster and experimenting with the new product ideas that it opens the doors to. We are thrilled to see how this exciting new tool is utilized in the many different ways the maker community will use it for.

 With the help of this Indiegogo campaign, we can expand creative thinking and give back to the world something exciting and remarkable. We love using our prototype, but we REALLY want to put the REVOcaster in the hands of the world and see what kind of exciting things we can make together.

                       



Thanks for checking out our project, we look forward to answering any questions and further showcasing the REVOcaster for you. We will keep updating photos and videos to showcase the machine more as the campaign goes on. Thanks a million, we are excited to be a part of the Indiegogo world, and look forward to seeing what the world makes with the REVOcaster!

We definitely understand that not everyone is a maker, and might not purchase a REVOcaster for themselves. We have opened a $1 or more perk for those who want to donate a little to show their support, but might not want to spend the full amount on a machine for themselves. Every dollar counts, and by choosing this perk, you become a valuable member to our community, and none of this would be possible without contributors like you!

Of course, we want you to contribute if you can, but if you can't back the project financially, that's OK, there are OTHER ways to help us achieve success too. If you've read our campaign and LOVE the idea, you can still really make a difference for us by sharing this page! Let the world know about how cool you think the REVOcaster is, and share with your maker friends and family who would find benefits in getting a REVOcaster for themselves.


Please note:

International shipping costs are too difficult to estimate ahead of time. All international shipments will be calculated on an individual basis, and a seperate invoice for shipping costs will be sent to backers after the campaign funds.

This is the easiest solution to avoid shipping headaches on both sides. 



What seperates the REVOcaster from other rotational casting machines?

The REVOcaster is the first rotational casting machine made from sturdy but lightweight aluminum, rather than flimsy laser cut parts.

It also comes pre-assembled, so you can spend less time assembling another machine, and more time making really cool stuff! 

It's powered by a motor, where as many other solutions are hand cranked. This makes it as easy as pushing a button to use.

Can you REALLY make chocolate casts with the REVOcaster?

Yes, you certainly can! We are excited to showcase a chocolate cast VERY soon, because we think this is a great way to use the REVOcaster and make very cool, original desserts. 

See a quick demo of the chocolate molds in action: Making a Hollow Chocolate Death Star

What resins do you test the REVOcaster with?

Our favorite resin to use so far is Alumilite quick setting epoxy resin. This resin gives a nice finish in the end, which is sandable/carvable.

You can also add dyes or powders to change the colors of the resin, including swirl patterns or bronze like finishes. It also cures in 5-10 minutes, meaning your parts are finishes very quickly and you can experiment with the different colors and finishes rapidly.

story:
Who We Are:

This story is about a small and very compassionate group of dynamic leaders, from very diverse backgrounds, bound by their commitment to the project and vision of Shanti Toya, and their common thread interests in:

·  yoga, meditation, & healing through the mind-body-spirit connection

·  human rights and equality

·  the sharing and preservation of traditional customs and wisdom

·  environmental conservation, permaculture, & sustainable building

·  eco-conscious and mindful travel and awareness

· empowering communities to reduce the exploitation of our environment,   including its people, cultures, resources, and animals; not only globally, but specifically on the small and densely populated island of Bali, Indonesia.   


Shanti Toya 

We are a newly built yoga and wellness retreat center set in a rural farming village just outside of Ubud; the heart of Bali.  Bali is regarded as the “Island of The Gods”, rich with spiritual traditions that draw in seekers from far and wide as well as being world-renowned by surfers seeking their best wave.  As Bali’s tourism industry has exponentially grown over the last decades, so has the urgent need for environmental awareness and education and the implementation of sustainable practices. 


What makes our team at Shanti Toya special is our collective desire to make the world a better place. 

Our Vision

To create an open-minded and tranquil healing retreat space for all cultures and belief systems.  Shanti Toya is a place where people can come together and heal their bodies, minds, and spirits.  They can find connection through sharing their experiences and wisdom with one another, while immersing themselves into the local Balinese culture.  It is our hope that guests will be forever touched by the deep sense of joy and fulfillment that often comes while living in simplicity and harmony with others and the natural environment, and realize the need for a more sustainable existence.  

Shanti Toya will also serve as a platform for outreach programs in environmental education and community engagement whereby awareness and sustainable practices are increased; first starting small and eventually expanding our sphere of influence and outreach as we grow and become self-sustaining. 


The Land

Shanti Toya ashram is a magical place, with a special energy felt by all who step foot on the land.  It’s set among the hillside in a jungle ravine, and abundant with water and wildlife.  The small rural village of Penarungan borders the property, as well as beautiful rice paddies and farmland, offering a truly authentic taste of Bali.   Even with such a peaceful and remote location, Shanti Toya is still located only 20 minutes SW from the internationally-known hub of Ubud, commonly referred to as the mecca of yoga by the international yoga community.  This is one of the many reasons that make Shanti Toya a perfect destination for healing and sharing. Since first finding the land in 2014, and through much hard work and dedication, a beautifully tranquil sanctuary and retreat center is nearing completion!


Lets Make A Difference!

In addition to the negative impacts of tourism on Bali due to the lack of infrastructure and foresight on how to manage such a shift, there is also a lack of awareness on how to rectify these issues; like the water crisis and the mis-management of plastics and trash. The possible solutions that we would like to start with require a strong community foundation and source of income to implement and sustain the programs.  

With your support we will be able to make life changing impacts in our community in the following ways: 

  • Implementing water catchment tanks and filtration systems in the smaller villages without city water, also reducing the amount of water taken from an already depleted resource.
  • Fair trade work for local families to include but not limited to: yoga props, construction, gardening, and cooking.
  • Permaculture practices utilized and taught to local community members
  • Building an Infrastructure within Shanti Toya that can be a leading example to volunteers, guests, and local community
  • Housing and food for our volunteers (safe, friendly, open environment)
  • Spa facilities as a source of revenue to become self-sustaining
  • Identify, implement, and teach practices that improve waste management; reducing single-use plastics and water consumption
  • Community outreach programs such as; trash clean up, recycle bin delivery, language classes, donation based yoga classes, etc.

*The potential for positive change in the way we travel in Bali is limitless. The goal here is not to stop traveling, but to travel consciously.  We can be a great example through spreading awareness and being sensitive to not only the Balinese culture but also the beautiful environment. Being integrated with the culture we can build a bridge to better understanding and respecting each other and our ways of living. 

How Your Contribution Will Help!

Our project is near completion, we just need your help to take us to the finish line!!
** If you are unable to contribute financially we can still use your help!  Please use IndieGogo's sharing tools to spread our campaign through social media outlets, and with your friends and family.  We need grass-roots assistance to be able to make a positive change in so many lives and on our planet!

Thank you in advance for all of your help, and for investing the time to look into our project!
Please reach out with any questions, and stay posted for frequent updates!

BIO's


Annie Snellen

Having been splintered most of her adult life, with one foot deeply planted in the business world and the other endlessly engaged in spiritual, environmental and human rights interests, Annie finally decided to walk through fears of leaving a familiar daily existence that wasn’t in line with her personal truth or meaningful. She is now committed to a heartfelt and intentional existence after relocating to Bali and joining the project of Shanti Toya Ashram.  After meeting Pradnya and Satya she realized that they all had found a complementary partnership in one another. Annie has since dedicated her life fully into her passions of yoga, sustainability, cultural emersion and a project that could benefit from her desire for positive social and environmental change.  Annie recently joined the Shanti Toya team and will be heading up daily operations of the wellness center as well as co-creating the community outreach programs.  Annie has over a decade in the business world; specifically finance, real estate law and sales, and community management.  She also has an educational background in psychology and yoga, nearly twenty years of personal studies into eastern philosophy, and experience traveling abroad to live and work on community permaculture farms.  Annie is the perfect addition to the launch of Shanti Toya and the team is beyond excited for her enthusiasm and motivation. 


Pradnya Wati

Pradnya began her journey at the age of 6, when she began her life long study of classic Balinese dance. Her passion for dance then expanded to Modern Javanese & Balinese, as well as Contemporary Western & Latin dance. This eventually led Pradnya into Yoga, immersing herself into trainings throughout Bali, Malaysia, and India. She has taught in Bali, Malaysia, Thailand, Singapore, Cambodia, and Italy, and is a Yoga Alliance 500++ hours certified Yoga Teacher with Yoga Arts. Pradnya has 100++ certification with Sivananda Ashram, Rishikesh India and 30 hours Yin Yoga instructor certification by Denise Payne (One Song Yoga). She is also learning the art of spiritual healing from her eldest brother and some universal gurus, while holding numerous Spa Therapist, Yoga Therapist, Aromatherapy, and Dancing certifications.  And, after nearly two years of building her dream in her home country, she and her team officially opened the doors to Shanti Toya Ashram, in November of 2015.


Satya F. Burger

After having spent ten years running a Center for Wellness, Yoga, and Retreats on the Northern Coast of Bali, Satya’s life took a change of direction leading him to Ubud, and closer to an international school for his son.  Having been a developer of Seminar Centers throughout his life in Italy, Germany, and Bali, he decided to get involved as an advisor for a “small center” for Yoga in the Ubud area of Bali that his partner, Pradnya, was founding Shanti Toya.  Satya’s area of expertise and passion is in meditation, movement, and music.
story_txt:
Who We Are:


This story is about
a small and very compassionate group of dynamic leaders, from very diverse
backgrounds, bound by their commitment to the project and vision of Shanti Toya, and their common thread interests in: 
·  yoga, meditation, & healing through the mind-body-spirit connection
· 
human rights and equality
·  the sharing and preservation of traditional customs and wisdom
· 
environmental conservation, permaculture,
& sustainable building
· 
eco-conscious and mindful travel and
awareness
· empowering communities to reduce
the exploitation of our environment,   including its people, cultures, resources,
and animals; not only globally, but specifically on the small and densely
populated island of Bali, Indonesia.   





Shanti Toya 

We are a newly built yoga and wellness retreat center set in a rural farming village just outside of Ubud; the heart of Bali.  Bali is regarded as the “Island of The Gods”, rich with spiritual traditions that draw in seekers from far and wide as well as being world-renowned by surfers seeking their best wave.  As Bali’s tourism industry has exponentially grown over the last decades, so has the urgent need for environmental awareness and education and the implementation of sustainable practices. 

What makes our team at Shanti Toya special is our collective desire to make the world a better place. 

Our Vision
To create an open-minded and tranquil healing retreat space for all cultures and belief systems.  Shanti Toya is a place where people can come together and heal their bodies, minds, and spirits.  They can find connection through sharing their experiences and wisdom with one another, while immersing themselves into the local Balinese culture.  It is our hope that guests will be forever touched by the deep sense of joy and fulfillment that often comes while living in simplicity and harmony with others and the natural environment, and realize the need for a more sustainable existence.  


Shanti Toya will also serve as a platform for outreach programs in environmental education and community engagement whereby awareness and sustainable practices are increased; first starting small and eventually expanding our sphere of influence and outreach as we grow and become self-sustaining. 





The Land
Shanti Toya ashram is a magical place, with a special energy felt by all who step foot on the land.  It’s set among the hillside in a jungle ravine, and abundant with water and wildlife.  The small rural village of Penarungan borders the property, as well as beautiful rice paddies and farmland, offering a truly authentic taste of Bali.   Even with such a peaceful and remote location, Shanti Toya is still located only 20 minutes SW from the internationally-known hub of Ubud, commonly referred to as the mecca of yoga by the international yoga community.  This is one of the many reasons that make Shanti Toya a perfect destination for healing and sharing. Since first finding the land in 2014, and through much hard work and dedication, a beautifully tranquil sanctuary and retreat center is nearing completion!




Lets Make A Difference!



In addition to the negative impacts
of tourism on Bali due to the lack of infrastructure and foresight on how to manage such a shift, there is also a lack of
awareness on how to rectify these issues; like the water crisis and the mis-management of
plastics and trash. The possible solutions that we would like to start with
require a strong community foundation and source of income to implement and sustain
the programs.  
With your support we will
be able to make life changing impacts in our community in the following ways: 


Implementing
water catchment tanks and filtration systems in the smaller villages without city water, also reducing
the amount of water taken from an already depleted resource.

Fair
trade work for local families to include but not limited to: yoga props, construction,
gardening, and cooking.


Permaculture
practices utilized and taught to local community members


Building
an Infrastructure within Shanti Toya that can be a leading example to
volunteers, guests, and local community


Housing
and food for our volunteers (safe, friendly, open environment)


Spa
facilities as a source of revenue to become self-sustaining


Identify,
implement, and teach practices that improve waste management; reducing single-use plastics and water consumption


Community
outreach programs such as; trash clean up, recycle bin delivery, language
classes, donation based yoga classes, etc.

*The potential for positive change in the way we
travel in Bali is limitless. The goal here is not to stop traveling, but to travel
consciously.  We can be a great example through
spreading awareness and being sensitive to not only the Balinese culture but
also the beautiful environment. Being integrated with the culture we can build
a bridge to better understanding and respecting each other and our ways of
living. 
How Your Contribution Will Help!


Our project is near completion, we just need your help to take us to the finish line!!

** If you are unable to contribute financially we can still use your help!  Please use IndieGogo's sharing tools to spread our campaign through social media outlets, and with your friends and family.  We need grass-roots assistance to be able to make a positive change in so many lives and on our planet!



Thank you in advance for all of your help, and for investing the time to look into our project!

Please reach out with any questions, and stay posted for frequent updates!
BIO's


Annie SnellenHaving been splintered most of her adult life, with one foot deeply planted in the business world and the other endlessly engaged in spiritual, environmental and human rights interests, Annie finally decided to walk through fears of leaving a familiar daily existence that wasn’t in line with her personal truth or meaningful. She is now committed to a heartfelt and intentional existence after relocating to Bali and joining the project of Shanti Toya Ashram.  After meeting Pradnya and Satya she realized that they all had found a complementary partnership in one another. Annie has since dedicated her life fully into her passions of yoga, sustainability, cultural emersion and a project that could benefit from her desire for positive social and environmental change.  Annie recently joined the Shanti Toya team and will be heading up daily operations of the wellness center as well as co-creating the community outreach programs.  Annie has over a decade in the business world; specifically finance, real estate law and sales, and community management.  She also has an educational background in psychology and yoga, nearly twenty years of personal studies into eastern philosophy, and experience traveling abroad to live and work on community permaculture farms.  Annie is the perfect addition to the launch of Shanti Toya and the team is beyond excited for her enthusiasm and motivation. 



Pradnya Wati
Pradnya began her journey at the age of 6, when she began her life long study of classic Balinese dance. Her passion for dance then expanded to Modern Javanese & Balinese, as well as Contemporary Western & Latin dance. This eventually led Pradnya into Yoga, immersing herself into trainings throughout Bali, Malaysia, and India. She has taught in Bali, Malaysia, Thailand, Singapore, Cambodia, and Italy, and is a Yoga Alliance 500++ hours certified Yoga Teacher with Yoga Arts. Pradnya has 100++ certification with Sivananda Ashram, Rishikesh India and 30 hours Yin Yoga instructor certification by Denise Payne (One Song Yoga). She is also learning the art of spiritual healing from her eldest brother and some universal gurus, while holding numerous Spa Therapist, Yoga Therapist, Aromatherapy, and Dancing certifications.  And, after nearly two years of building her dream in her home country, she and her team officially opened the doors to Shanti Toya Ashram, in November of 2015.



Satya F. Burger


After having spent ten years running a Center for
Wellness, Yoga, and Retreats on the Northern Coast of Bali, Satya’s life took a
change of direction leading him to Ubud, and closer to an international school
for his son.  Having been a developer of Seminar Centers throughout his
life in Italy, Germany, and Bali, he decided to get involved as an advisor for
a “small center” for Yoga in the Ubud area of Bali that his
partner, Pradnya, was founding Shanti Toya.  Satya’s area of expertise and
passion is in meditation, movement, and music.

story:
Why is this project important

This is no news: Police brutality is getting out of hand!!!  It has been 25 years since the Rodney King beatings occurred yet not much has changed. The murdering and harassment of innocent lives by the very people who are supposed to "Serve and Protect" is repugnant!

There is still no accountability, no fair prosecution,  no justice for most victims and their families. Thousands of officers get away with murder and to add insult to injury THEY receive pensions and benefits as well paid "vacations" for their so called service to black people in the US! All this at the expense of the victim, his/her family, the taxpayers' dollars and public safety.

We black people,  have been victim of the police's terroristic behaviour for centuries now. We demand a minimum of respect and the basic human rights  we are entitled to  and for which we also do pay with our tax dollars. This time, we will not protest,  we will not march and we will not stay indifferent to the attacks! WE WILL TAKE ACTION...WITH OUR DOLLARS!!!

We are going to put our resources together, take control of this $750 000 000/year industry and use that money to put it back in our neighborhoods,

The "peace" talks have already been done and it's now time for action! As Jessie Williams said:

"WE'RE GOING TO HAVE EQUAL RIGHTS AND JUSTICE IN OUR OWN COUNTRY OR WI'LL RE-STRUCTURE THEIR FUNCTIONS IN OURS."

ENOUGH IS ENOUGH! 

How is AfrikanaMart going to be part of the solution

Simple: we will regain control of the beauty industry that has been controlled by the Asians and Arabs who never address the issues black people face. 

We've all heard of the old saying: "Money talks"and so let's put our money where our mouths are.

In a country founded in racism, those in power hate us because we are black however are able to victimize us because we are poor and unorganized.  The root of the problems we face in our communities can be summed up into one: economic starvation. 

Let's face it: the system of white supremacy is set up to starve us economically thus affecting our influence in politics, social status, media exposure and portrayal, academia, laws and labor.

That is also the reasons why our communities are destroyed,  the unemployment rate is so high, black businesses fail, our youth lack guidance, our neighborhoods are gentrified, our school miseducate our children, there is so much violence on our streets, the police violate us without consequences, the obesity rate is so high, our families survive on junk food rather than spend more money on healthier options, food stamps recipients as well as individuals on welfare are on the rise, etc. The list goes on and on.

LET'S BUILD A STRONG ECONOMIC BASE, LET'S TAKE CHARGE OF OUR ECONOMIC FREEDOM!

Simply imagine

Imagine what we could do if more money circulated and stayed in our economy. Imagine what would happen if our streets, parks and malls were safer. Imagine the impact better schools and environment will do for our youth. Imagine what would happen if we eliminated poverty in our communities.  Imagine how empowered we would be if our banks had more capitals. Imagine what would happen if we promoted more and more successful  black owned businesses. Imagine the impact we would have on ourselves if we were able to deal with our internal issues (divisions, colorism, gender war, self hate, unaddressed mental illnesses, black violence,  etc)! Wouldn't our communities  be better and livable?

Who we are and what we do​

We are a start up company in the hair care and beauty industry. As an online store retailer we will be selling hair extensions,  weaves, hair care products,  fashion/clothing,  art and a lot more.

We pledge to:

  • donate at least 20% of our net income to organizations and charities in black communities  across the US and internationally 
  • Build better schools
  • Create programs to empower black children 
  • Commit to resolve  issues we face as a people
  • Donate grants to students so they can go to college
  • Donate grants to small business so they can start up and /or prosper
  • Create more jobs in black communities.

As previously mentioned: black women as well as black men spend $750 Millions annually on hair extensions,  hair care , beauty and hygienic products. Let that sink in for a moment. Honestly,  we would the d-u-m-b-e-s-t  to have ever walked on the face on the earth if we cannot use this resource for our liberation...

Our solution: take that capital and use it to rebuild ourselves. Forget the elections,  we're all we got! 

$300 000 will help us with the basic startup costs such as rental costs and utilities, employees wages, a minimum of merchandise selection, etc. The more money we raise the more product variety as well as better service we will be able to offer.

Our goal and dream is to control at least 5% of this industry  (the equivalence of $37.5 Millions of annual income). We believe it's possible and it's necessary!

Black America, let's debunk the myth that we are an incapable people!

Let's rebuild stronger communities!

Let's stop the gentrification of our cities!

Let's kill racism, its systems and institutions!

Let's conquer our adversities and build a better future! 

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE SHARE WITH AS MANY AS POSSIBLE AND DONATE GENEROUSLY!

We thank you for your patience, time and efforts.

God bless, 

The AfrikanaMart Team.

story:
Hello... I have been a small business owner for many years. I owned an in home daycare for several years but unfortunately, I had to close that business due to COVID 19. I also have an online business that carries handmade items such as; essential oil bracelets, earrings, autograph stuffed animals, dog bandanas, hair bows, cloth napkins, and many other items. I have been successful selling online but I also have been to many vendor shows and find the experience exciting and fun. Vendor shows also seem to be the most successful and profitable way to sell my items. The Customers being able to see and touch merchandise in person makes the difference.  My goal is to take my business on the road. I would love to be able to buy a small trailer to haul my ever expanding inventory to more vendor shows, craft fairs, and flea markets. 
 

         
 


These photos are just a few items in my inventory

 

                  I am hoping to raise 6000.00. All funds will go directly for the cost of the trailer and the necessary additions to it. Most important is insulation and adjustments made for heating and cooling.  It will be used  not only for storing inventory but as a selling point in case of compromised weather.  As of right now I'm limited to selling locally because I have no way of transporting all my inventory. A trailer would be a great help.

                 I will be offering one of a kind items from my inventory to those who choose to donate. Items will be picked randomly.  These items may be different designs or colors than what it shown in pictures as they are all different. I have had many compliments on all my products and am sure you'll like them too!

                 If my goal is not met during this time I will still put any funds raised towards the purchase of a trailer.

                 

Other Ways You Can Help

             Thank you for taking the time to view my campaign. Please feel free to share it with your friends and family.

story:
Who are we?

    We are Ryan and Erin Corder of Mt. Pleasant, South Carolina. We are newlyweds, entrepreneurs, avid beach-goers and party people! With work experience ranging from non-profits and foster care case work to startups and the tech industry - we are ecstatic to have this opportunity to bring this community gathering point to the city that we love! 

    Where are we now?

    At this point, the boat has already been designed, tested and distributed to other parts of the country. We have secured exclusive rights to bring TARZAN Boat to the Charleston area, but we need your help!

    To raise the funds needed to acquire a TARZAN Boat and bring it here to the Lowcountry - we are offering ticket bundles, day passes, and private party rentals options to our backers at a discount from standard prices. Because we anticipate backers using their pre-paid access early on - we have also included the costs of staffing and maintaining TARZAN Boat for the first couple of months.

    How can you help

    It's as easy as one, two, three:

    1. Purchase one of our pass or private party perks!  
      • A few weeks before the boat arrives you will receive a code to claim your perk on our website.
      • In the event that we aren't able to raise the full amount IndieGoGo will automatically issue you a refund 5-7 days after the campaign has ended
    2. Like and Follow our Facebook page and invite your friends to do the same
    3. Repeat :)

    TARZAN Boat will be available for private rental. With a 40 person capacity; family reunions, birthdays, wedding parties - all will be possible for a fraction of the cost of a traditional boat rental (of comparable size).

    Our current thoughts on schedule:

    • Friday - Sunday: 12:00 - 6:00 Open Swim!
    • Friday - Sunday: 10:00 - 12:00 & 6:00 - 8:00 Available for party rentals
    • Monday - Thursday: Available for party rentals all day

story:
Two Friends Come Together

Justin Husson is a filmmaker from Toronto and Jasmine Duke is a stay at home mom from London, Ontario. Each year we throw a massive Halloween Party, and in 2019 we plan to take it to the next level and make our own haunted trail!

We are looking for some help in our funding to make the haunt as amazing as possible. There are some things we could use some help achieving such as costumes, props, makeup and security.  

We are also having a harvest festival! 

The entrance to our haunt will also feature a kid friendly harvest festival, full of vendors and games that will help generate more income for future haunts. This are will include: 

A pumpkin carving station

several Halloween themes games

Terror Trail items for sale

and more! 

Your Impact

Your contribution will be stored away and used for the early set ups, costumes, props and insurance. Make sure our haunt can run! and your perks will reflect these early contributions. 

The Road Ahead

We have a lot of work ahead of us! We have a location on Ipperwash Beach in mind and it is perfect for our needs! The early set ups now include getting event insurance, notifying local authorities and hiring actors and volunteers to help run the event! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money to contribute that is ok! We need volunteers! We have several different kinds of volunteers from scare actors, to game runners and hosts. Feel free to sign up at https://signup.com/client/invitation2/secure/24...

story:
Short Summary

Philomath Crafts and Supplies is a small Winnipeg based business that has been providing retail and wholesale distribution of craft supplies through the Etsy Marketplace ecommerce platform since September 2017. We are currently looking at expansion to a physical commercial location.

Our goal is to create a Retail and Wholesale distribution center that is large enough to offer the supplies and tools necessary for any type of craft. Our store will be locally owned and operated, and designed from the ground up with the Manitoba Handmade Community in mind. We want to make it easy, affordable, and profitable for you to produce your crafts and share your art with the world.

 

The Impact

Manitoba is home to a diverse community of artists and crafters offering an amazing assortment of handmade products for sale at local craft sales and fairs, farmer's markets, and similar events year round. Sadly, Winnipeg is home to very few craft supply stores, with the retail market for craft supplies being dominated by Michaels Arts and Crafts.

In Manitoba, finding the supplies and tools necessary to make and sell crafts often involves online ordering, driving to several different small specialty supply stores, or paying huge mark ups, making it difficult to create and sell crafts at a living wage or reasonable profit.

By helping to fund our campaign, you are making a huge positive impact on the local economy. Once Philomath Crafts is able to open our Craft Supplies distribution center, we will be able to directly help the local economy by creating new jobs, paying taxes, and offering a space for the sale of locally produced tools and supplies. In addition, by providing easy and affordable access to crafting tools and supplies, we will be encouraging the growth of the local handmade market, making it easier and more profitable for Manitoban Artists to create and sell. 

 

Fast Facts

  • In 2016 a Statistics Canada Genera Social study reported that 5.2 million Canadians over the age of 15 practice crafts
  • During the 2008 global economic recession, the cultural and craft sector saw less employment reduction across Canada than other industry sectors. 
  • The United Nations Development Programme stated that the cultural sector is the fastest growing sector for job creation, income earning, and export opportunities and recommended that any country focusing on strengthening their economy should invest in their cultural and handmade goods. 
  • According to the Canadian Crafts Federation, the percentage of persons self employed in the crafts sector is 26%, which is more than twice that in the overall economy (12%), and from 1993 to 2003 small business accounted for 80% of net job creation.
  • In 2016, the sale of handmade goods had an economic impact of 2.5% on the Manitoban economy ($1.6B of the Manitoban GDP)
  • In 2018 Retail Craft Supplies Industry sales revenues was an estimated $675M across Canada, with an estimated $18.9M spent by small business crafters and artists.
  • A 2016 federal study claimed that some of the greatest challenges artists face are low profit margins, lack of time, and limited resources.

 

What We Need 

To fund expansion to a physical location in Winnipeg, Philomath Crafts and Supplies will be applying for government grants and business loans in the year 2020. As part of the requirement for these applications, we need to have raised a minimum of 30% capital prior to application of financing. We are currently raising funds ourselves through ecommerce sales and seeking private investors and/or business loans, but we need your help to reach our capital goal. 

When we reach our $30 000 fundraising goal, funds will go towards the business as follows (estimates rounded to the nearest $100):

  1. $1 500 estimated platform fees to Indiegogo for crowdfunding campaign
  2. $500 estimated payment processing fees for crowdfunding campaign
  3. $2 000 legal fees for expansion
  4. $1 000 point of sale and barcode hardware and inventory control costs
  5. $2 500 retail display shelving 
  6. $1 500 payroll / human resources system costs
  7. $1 000 marketing / advertising costs for location launch
  8. $20 000 purchase of inventory

If the initial fundraising goal is not reached, funds will be distributed in order as listed above until full amount raised is invested.

If we exceed our initial crowdfunding goal, excess funds will go towards the business as follows:

  • Prepayment towards lease and renovation of a commercial space
  • Employee wages once location has been opened
  • Purchase of additional inventory to expand available product lines

 

What You Get

When you contribute to our campaign you can feel good about supporting the local economy and Community Economic Development, but that's not all! Our crowdfunding campaign also includes a variety of perks to personally thank you for your contributions. Your support is greatly appreciated and we want you to know it. 

  •  Every $1.00 contribution receives a personal thank you from Philomath Crafts and Supplies on your choice of social media platform (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.) or via email. You let us know how to thank you and we will shout out our appreciation across the internet.
  • Every $5.00 contribution receives previous perk as described above and a single use coupon code for 10% off one order or purchase. Coupon code can be redeemed online immediately after receipt, in store once the location has been opened, or at any time after. Discount applies to product cost subtotal (does not apply to shipping charges or taxes) of entire order or purchase with no product limitations or order minimum or maximum. 
  • Every $10.00 contribution receives previous perks as described above and a single use coupon code for 25% off one order or purchase. Coupon code can be redeemed online immediately after receipt, in store once the location has been opened, or at any time after. Discount applies to product cost subtotal (does not apply to shipping charges or taxes) of entire order or purchase with no product limitations or order minimum or maximum.
  • Every $25.00 contribution receives a personal thank you via social media, as well as an invitation to our "Early Bird" shopping events. Three events will be held (one daytime, one evening, one weekend) the week before our grand opening and only contributors of $25.00 or more will be able to attend. Your contribution also includes a $5.00 credit, which can be used to purchase any item in store. Credit does not need to be redeemed during the early bird event and will not expire. 
  • Every $100 contribution receives a personal thank you via social media, as will as an invitation to our Small Business Seminar. Presentations will be made by industry professionals on important topics such as effective pricing strategies, marketing and advertising, small business taxation, and strategic partnerships. More information for the seminar will become available near the end of 2019. Your contribution also includes an invitation to our "Early Bird" events and a $5.00 credit redeemable in store. 
  • Further perks will be offered as the campaign progresses.

 

Risks & Challenges

Any business expansion faces a number of risks and challenges and Philomath Crafts and Supplies is not immune to this fact. But by being aware and prepared, we can reduce the risks and overcome any challenges we will face.

  1.  Financing is always and issue: Our campaign goal is only 30% of the start up funds we'll need to open our retail and wholesale distribution center. While there are several government grants and business loans available to help us raise the other 70%, they are not guaranteed sources. To increase our chances of securing the additional funds, we are putting together a stellar business plan and researching all possible avenues. We have obtained business training and coaching through SEED Winnipeg in 2019 to ensure that we are prepared to rise above this challenge.
  2.  Market demand is incredibly high: Once Philomath Crafts is able to open our retail and wholesale distribution center there is a good chance that we will not have the immediate capacity to deal with local demand. Based on our current numbers for investment we estimate that we will be able to fulfill approximately 2% of the market for craft supplies purchased by small business crafters and artists. This means that for the first few months our product line will not be as expansive and we would like it to be and we run the risk of running out of high demand products. We are going to mitigate this risk by closely monitoring sales and current inventory, ensuring that most if not all of our products are sourced from suppliers with short lead times, and being prepared to reorder inventory and expand our product line immediately and significantly if necessary.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is able to contribute financially, but that's okay. You can still help in lots of ways:

  1.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign online so you can help us to connect with others that are interested in helping.
  2. Talk about Philomath Crafts and Supplies with your friends, family, and coworkers. Remember, we're planning to open our retail and wholesale distribution center in 2020 so the local community will want to keep updated on how close we are to reaching our goal.
  3. Provide us feedback and suggestions for how we can make Philomath Crafts and Supplies the best place to purchase crafting tools and supplies in Manitoba. What area of Winnipeg should we be located in? What types of products should we carry? What special perks and services can we offer to keep our customers happy? We need to know!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Philomath Crafts and Supplies is a small Winnipeg based business that has been providing retail and wholesale distribution of craft supplies through the Etsy Marketplace ecommerce platform since September 2017. We are currently looking at expansion to a physical commercial location.
Our goal is to create a Retail and Wholesale distribution center that is large enough to offer the supplies and tools necessary for any type of craft. Our store will be locally owned and operated, and designed from the ground up with the Manitoba Handmade Community in mind. We want to make it easy, affordable, and profitable for you to produce your crafts and share your art with the world.
 
The Impact
Manitoba is home to a diverse community of artists and crafters offering an amazing assortment of handmade products for sale at local craft sales and fairs, farmer's markets, and similar events year round. Sadly, Winnipeg is home to very few craft supply stores, with the retail market for craft supplies being dominated by Michaels Arts and Crafts.
In Manitoba, finding the supplies and tools necessary to make and sell crafts often involves online ordering, driving to several different small specialty supply stores, or paying huge mark ups, making it difficult to create and sell crafts at a living wage or reasonable profit.
By helping to fund our campaign, you are making a huge positive impact on the local economy. Once Philomath Crafts is able to open our Craft Supplies distribution center, we will be able to directly help the local economy by creating new jobs, paying taxes, and offering a space for the sale of locally produced tools and supplies. In addition, by providing easy and affordable access to crafting tools and supplies, we will be encouraging the growth of the local handmade market, making it easier and more profitable for Manitoban Artists to create and sell.
