Mesmo com 70% de desconto, o custo do envio é ainda 3 vezes maior do que o preço do próprio produto.Chegamos, assim, a um ponto em que temos duas opções:ou passamos o custo do envio ao cliente;ou financiamos o envio nós mesmos.Decidimos financiar o envio nós mesmos.Foi precisamente essa decisão que nos trouxe aqui, hoje. Precisamos da sua ajuda para financiar esse envio.A todos os amantes de Cabo verde espalhados pelo mundo pedimos que se juntem a nós e ajudem com o que puderem. O que estaremos a fazer é ganhar tempo para chegarmos a uma solução definitiva e auto-sustentável. A solução virá, mas apenas se continuarmos firmes e fortes.Tem sido uma caminhada emocionante e já ultrapassámos muitos obstáculos. Esse será mais um que iremos ultrapassar, com a sua ajuda.O que oferecemos em troca?A oportunidade de poder adquirir produtos made in Cabo Verde online e de os ter entregues à porta da sua casa. E principalmente a oportunidade de impactar, de forma palpável, a vida de milhares de cabo-verdianos.Desde já o nosso muito obrigado!
 
English
Cape Verde is a small archipelago, on the West African Coast, of stunning beauty. But what makes Cape Verde special is its people and its Morabeza, the way people welcome those visiting the country. This oasis in the middle of the Atlantic has attracted, in the last 10 years, great investments (large resorts), implementing the all-inclusive model.Although these large investments are an asset to Cape Verde, it is questioned whether the model has any impact on the lives of the Cape Verdean producers and the communities where the investments were made.We knew that something should be done. We came up with this idea, a Cape Verdean Sustainable Tourism project. Therefore, a few years ago, we started the Sustainable Tourism project in Cape Verde on social networks, first on Facebook and later, on Instagram.Our strategy is to take Cape Verde to the world. We want to promote a different type of tourism, focused on direct contact with Cape Verdean population and culture. With this objective, we have worked, free of charge, as an online tour operator, giving assistance to thousands of tourists who want to spend their holidays in Cape Verde. We have been using GetitSocial's resources to fund this initiative.We want more for Cape Verde. We want more for Cape Verdeans.To achieve our goals, we have decided to tackle one of the greatest local economic development problems: It is a small market.We have created an online platform where Cape Verdean producers and artisans can sell their product to millions of Cape Verdeans around the world and to people that love Cape Verde. Imagine anyone, anywhere in the world, being able to buy products made in Cape Verde directly from the producer's hands."Do you want an old grog?" Buy directly from the Ferreira family in Santo Antão; Do you want a broken corn for the cachupa (corn soup)? Buy directly from Dona Joana in São Domingos. We have named our platform Rabidanti.com. it is an e-commerce site to sell made in Cape Verde products to the world.However, we have met a challenge that many would think is impossible to overcome. The cost of shipping products through the Cape Verdean Post. The shipping can be up to four times the price of the product itself. There is no assured time framework for the product to get to its destination.We could not put this burden on the consumers. Our hope was on the only private parcel delivery in the country, the international DHL. DHL would solve our shipping security problem and would ensure that the product would reach the customer's door, anywhere in the world, in the maximum two weeks’ time. Otherwise, the money would be refunded. That sounded like a great idea. However, DHL is expensive as well. Even more expensive than the Cape Verdean Post. The only advantage is the scheduled time to package delivery.After a lot of negotiation, we reached an agreement with the company, that made us a 70% discount on the shipping price in exchange of our Internet marketing services. A win-win situation. Nonetheless, we still have a problem. DHL offers excellent services and gives us all the guarantees that the product would arrive safely and on time. Unfortunately, even with the 70% off, the cost of shipping is still three times the price of the product itself. This situation only left us with two options: either we would ask the clients to pay for the parcel shipment or we would pay for the shipment ourselves. We have decided for the second option. Our decision brought as here today. We need your help to finance the shipment. You, all the people that love Cape Verde, around the world, join us and help as you can. We are asking for help o fund the shipping for two years. Two years is the estimate time to find a permanent sustainable solution. It has so far been exciting and we have overcome many challenges. This is just one more challenge to be overcome. We are sure it is going to be possible with your help.What can we offer you?Well, the opportunity the buy made in Cape Verde products online and get them delivered at your door. And specially the opportunity to be part of the family Movement for Sustainable Tourism in Cape Verde and have a positive impact on thousands of Cape Verdeans lives 
Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Huneycomb.com was conceived by, Constantine Siounis in 2010 when he felt he had had enough with “online giants like Ebay and Amazon” running out the “small guy." As a result, Siounis filed for a US patent that would provide the existing 131,000 US boutique online retailers a way to convert their brick and mortar “liability” into a game changing asset online through what Huneycomb.com has coined the “Digital Store View” in order to capture a larger share of the nearly $300 billion Ecommerce market.  Consequently, Huneycomb.com’s dynamic and fully integrated Ecommerce platform using 360 degree photography and superior inventory and payment systems permit storeowners to self propagate their own Huneycomb.com Digital Store View.  Furthermore, the venue is photographed and stitched together allowing for shoppers from their desktops and mobile phones to have the appearance of walking inside the retail store and into the “next level” of the Ecommerce experience while purchasing items and chatting with friends.  This process has been successfully patented, filed, and awarded US 8606642 B2.

What We Need & What You Get

Huneycomb.com is currently raising just under 100,000 dollars in order to properly finance the continued development of Huneycomb.com’s platform and also in order to set aside monies to be used to reach 1,000 users/storeowners.  Constantine and Demetri have filed and been awarded a patent, incorporated, created momentum through video pitches, demos, wireframes, and a business plan with financials as a means of showing proof of skin in the game, commitment, and a fierce appetite for the startup process.

The Impact

The impact of your investment into Huneycomb.com, its team, and its vision is not only about the “fancy promotional material” you are going to get but about supporting a startup that will help transform an industry by providing boutique retailers and buyers and sellers online a way to showcase their brick and mortar venues in a dynamic way!

Risks & Challenges

Although we recognize that the “Digital Store View” is protected through our US patent; we are not content as competitors could contest the patent in court, find ways around it, and/or fight Huneycomb.com and our retail partners with pricing wars. Further, we recognize that consumers may very well desire a transition from “digital store views” to “virtual stores” as technology and companies like Facebook’s Oculus develop further over the next several decades. In addition, we personally find virtual spaces to be too “game-like and odd” but technology could develop in a way that supports this movement. Huneycomb.com’s visionary management, design, and engineering team are set on being on the cutting edge of Ecommerce.People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word, reach out to other potential partners, investors, and customers by sharing our Indiegogo pitch with others.  Please also reach out to us via Facebook, the web, and YouTube with reviews and comments.

story:
Cascadia North Permaculture Society, or Cascadia North Cooperatives, is a place where people come together to meet at events, online, in gardens, in other communities, boardrooms, and at workshops to meet our own and help fill others needs, and where we care about conserving and preserving the Biosphere. The Earth is challenged right now, and by helping the earth, we are also helping ourselves.


We seek  good ways to recycle and repurpose the abundance of goods that are continually becoming obsolete in our homes, daily. We teach permaculture and facilitate art.

Urban farming is an amazing venture that allows us to grow our own food, care for the earth and her people, and also give back in many ways - by making soil and adding to the richness of the earth, share extra food with community members, or by providing livelihood where some of the food is sold to meet the needs of the organization and provide healthy wholesome food for local community.

Temporary housing, or tiny houses are also needed at this time, in many places on earth. Natural building, or building out of abundant or smart materials, such as hempcrete, which is antifungal, anti-bacterial, lightweight and abundant, or cob, strawbale, undergound: earth building.

One of the first steps toward planetary balance is in achieving financial wellbeing as a planet, along with ecological homeostasis, which includes us getting our food system in order as that huge amount of consumption has a huge impact on our planets, and our wellbeing. Permaculture looks at all the systems that have gone before and amalgamates them for this purpose.

Community Currency and The New Economy are here to bring balance to people and communities through sharing, shared values and right livelihood. Whether it's urban or rural farming, at local stores, or through people, we can give gifts and share easily by accepting community currency. We are offered a way to give when we might not have any other funds, and can connect with others in a caring, conscious way, honouring others with art and gratitude.

Social Permaculture really could be at the forefront of our thoughts. People need a lot of empathy these days as there are more and more people on the planet and so generally we are bumping up against each other more and more. And, they say, 17 hugs a day, for perfect health. Is there an old person i could visit?

How can I serve my community? What is working and what is not. In Permaculture we say The Problem is the Solution. If money is the problem, then what is the solution? What is money but an agreement of value between people. The solution is caring in place of wanting, where community currency is built on shared values and principles, such as honesty, trust, responsibility... Here is a great article by Charles Eisenstein, (and many more!) about the New Economy,

http://charleseisenstein.net/of-horseshoe-crabs...

story:
Short Summary

  • MongolianBooking.com is online travel agent that helps tourist, expats in Mongolia to find hotel rooms, resort, apartment room and office rent. 
  • We wanted to help tourists and expats to explore new possibilities without paying extra cost and wasting time on other sites to feel true nomadic experience. Additionally we are eager to help local nomads to share their spaces to tourist at the same time earn living from it.
  • We truly believe that in such way, tourists and expats can experience what it is to be nomadic way of living


What We Need & What You Get

The $9,000 of your contribution will support ongoing development, marketing and Charity.

  • 20% is to help 2 achieving students from nomadic family to pay their tuition.   
  • 20% goes to perks
  • 30% will be spent on further development
  • 30% will be spent on marketing such as marketing campaign and team development

The Impact

For tourists & expats

  • Better and easier way to finding places to stay in Mongolia without spending extra cash on travel agent etc.
  • Find hidden possibilities and different experience as staying with nomadic family which you can not find at any other travel agents

For local families, hotel owners, nomadic families etc 

  • Help them to explore better way to find customers 
  • Creating alternative source of income by sharing extra space

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate every type of contribution from anyone in world. Come visit us at Mongolia and Share. Please share us on your social networks. That means huge contribution to us. Thank you.

Additionally we are eager to help local nomads to share their spaces to tourist at the same time earn living from it. story: • Virtual shops: You are a skilled craft worker who creates decorative arts, sculptures, clothing, or even jewellery by hand. The problem is, work of art customers are hard to find. But what if you had an online shop with an impressive 3D look, available twenty four hours a day and accessible from anywhere and at any time thanks to mobile devices. Create your virtual shop without spending money and increase your sales with a new market that you couldn`t cover before – multimillion market of the mobile platform users.

story:
And one bar to rule them all

Greetings, programs! I'm James Kenna. Along with my hospitality team, I hope to open NYC's first dedicated geek tavern.  With the explosion of comic books, video games, anime, and various other forms of geekdom, I realized what a glaring hole we have in the Manhattan hospitality market. We will offer amazing food and drink in an atmosphere that everyone's inner nerd can enjoy. Waypoint is going to be a staple in the community–with classic sci-fi fantasy movie nights, book signings, Rock Band karaoke, nerdy burlesque, trivia, gaming tournaments, geek singles events, and so much more.  We have already spent nearly a year developing the business plan and artistic team behind this project, heavily investing personal time and money. With all systems go, this endeavor is ready to launch. We're ready to get our game on. Are you with us, NYC?

The gorram deal

In NYC there's a pub or sports bar on every block, but finding a place to geek out can be quite the challenge.  Opening near the L-train in the East Village district of Manhattan, Waypoint will be only a hop, skip, and a jump away from our friendly neighborhood geeks. Waypoint will be a tavern that opens its heart to comic book lovers, tabletop gamers, classic sci-fi fans, and every other fellow nerd. We're going top off this amazing experience with a dynamic duo of food from our celebrity chef "The Blade", and drinks from an amazing mixologist "The Muddler"

With great donations come great responsibility

Opening a tavern in New York City is not cheap. With an anticipated total cost of $600,000, we need another $300,000 to hit our goal.  This campaign will allow us to finish raising the rest, while moving forward with our groundbreaking, so that we're ready to open in August of 2016.  We are asking for a considerable amount of money, but we know that the unique experience we're offering will be worth every penny. In turn, we at Waypoint believe that hospitality goes beyond the doors of the establishment and plan to pay your kindness forward; we have planned quarterly events to fund some of our favorite charities, including Charity: Water,  Chive Charities, Milk+Bookies, and the Robin Hood Foundation.

Try not. Do or do not. There is no try.

Opening a Tavern in NYC comes with many challenges, but most failures come from lack of experience and vision. Fortunately, these are two things  that Waypoint has in spades.  We have over 30 years of combined hospitality management experience and have collaborated with multiple consultants to create this exemplary concept.  Therefore, regardless of meeting our goal, we will still pursue opening our venue by August 2016. 

Guys, before I go, I just want to tell you: you were fantastic. Absolutely fantastic. And you know what? So was I.

Do you know what makes you S.P.E.C.I.A.L.?  Largesse! I may be remembering that wrong, but with a little luck, we can still make this happen. Even if you can't afford to help out, please support Waypoint by getting the word out!  Tell your friends about the shining new icon coming to the geek community (that also serves up delicious bites).  In our growing nerd market, we need a place to congregate and mingle – help Waypoint become that place.   Viva la geek revolution!

FB: facebook.com/waypointnyc
IG:  instagram.com/waypointnyc
TW: twitter.com/waypointnyc

"Invention, my dear friends, is 93% perspiration, 6% electricity, 4% evaporation, and 2% butterscotch ripple.” – Willy Wonka

You shall not pass!

(up a chance to see the smorgasbord of nerdgasm below)


Let's talk about some of the cool art, fixtures, ideas, and designs that we have put together so far.

Our menu will be a readable short comic written by James Kenna, and illustrated by Zach Rapatz.  Below are some examples of cover art and comic sketches.  The comic is open-ended and will be continued with every new menu.


Our menu was developed in collaboration with celebrity chef Chris Nirschel.  It has been divided into two great categories, the light side and the dark side.  The menu is classic American bar food, with an Asian twist.  Have a close encounter with a sampling of our fantastic menu below.

Our innovative menu of cocktails, crafted by expert Mixologist William Aporih, will rotate seasonally for an always incredible Waypoint experience. Each unique libation will be christened using our fun naming pattern, as an homage to some of our favorite memories in fandom.

Below is the first line of shirts and merchandise available for purchase.  We hope to work with our artists and designers to create an entire custom line of shirts. 
For wonder ladies...

...and super gentleman

Our uniform corsets will be made from a customized, vintage comic book fabric, designed by the mighty Louis Mairone. 


Our patrons will sit at Murphy tables, designed by Miki Bauer's Invincible Concepts, that turn from good old-fashioned bar tables into cool, framed works of art.

Affordable specials and creative events running daily will make every Waypoint experience a new explosion of geekcitement.  You can engage in a new adventure every day at Waypoint!

We have an endless number of other incredible concepts from our designers and artists waiting to wow our fellow geeks. From our Stormtrooper delivery uniforms, vintage comic-collage bar top, and BFM Ghostbusters doors, to blackboard-paint word bubbles, steampunk bathrooms, and so much more. Everyone's a little bit nerdy, so help us build the place where you can let your geek flag fly.

End of line

story:
GentsGear


Short Summary

Firstly, i want to tell you a little something about myself... 

My name is Sam, i am 19 and i have been an entrepreneur from a very young age. I started back in school by buying sweets from a Wholesale Company, then going Home and making sweet bags to then take in to School the next Day and sell to my friends. I would have people flocking around me as i walked through the gates which was a great feeling as i could see that i had made people happy by giving them something to make their day a little bit better as well as a bit of money in my Pocket so it was a WIN WIN situation and that's what i liked... 

I then moved on to buying and selling on eBay from Wristbands to Clothes and onto other Crazes as time went on. Recently, i started to learn Web Design and have built a few for myself, family and friends and have learnt an awful lot. Since i can remember, I have wanted to have my own website and i have always been a bit of a Gadget Geek as well as having expensive taste meaning i have always wanted the latest Tech.  I have been teaching myself Website Design for nearly 2 years and have learnt an awful lot and wanted to build a Shop as practise (which i did). So i thought, "Why not put all the passions together and create a Gents Accessories Website?" so thats what i have done and my Website is called GENTSGEAR!

Customer Service has always been a priority to me and that is one of the reasons i feel that my Website is like no other, along with other reasons such as:

Simple Website to navigate
High Quality Products
Support Indiegogo Inventors by backing and selling their products
Affordable Prices
Make worldwide products more accessible in the UK
Impecible customer service

So what i need from you is a contribution as small or large as you wish to help fund the Stock so it is ready to deliver when the Shop opens. The Website is ready and waiting. The only issue is the monies to order all of the Stock so that it is ready for you. 

Once the Campaign ends, the stock will be ordered and the Website will be updated with the new products all in time for November so you could save your voucher for Christmas Shopping if you wanted to.

Check out the Website now to see what's available. 

*Please note that you cannot order until the campaign has ended*

www.gentsgear.com


Tell Me More

| THE WEBSITE |

The Website is built to be navigated very easily and responsive so that you can use it on your mobile or tablet devices. The homepage has a featured products bar at the top followed by a list of our Product Categories.  If you have an item in mind that you would like to find then this can be found using the search bar at the top of the page. The results can be filtered by price using the sliding scale at the top of the page making it easier to control your spending and faster to find what you want.


The site is always being updated with new products and changes being made so please be sure to check back regularly to see the latest updates.

| THE PRODUCTS |

GentsGear has currently found a range of products that vary from hand made, British, American, Leather, from INDIEGOGO Campaigns or even for Man's Best Friend. There is a good range to choose from and our Categories are as follows:


Gadgets- Tracking Devices, Mugs, Phone Accessories...

Pet- Collars, Toys...

Health- Hair, Beard, Tash, Facial Products...

Leather- Belts, Wallets, Shoes...

Apparel- Shoes, Ties, Watches, Wrist Straps...

DrinkingGear- Shot Glasses, Beer Glasses...


You can view the current products on the website now.

We will continue to expand our product range as the business grows but we aim to start with a inventory of around 45 different items with different variations such as colour, size and style when the campaign ends. If we don't reach our target then we will still go forward but we will just buy as many products as we can with the money raised.

Feedback is always welcomed, the customers are the one's who determine if this business is a success. If there is something you would like to see that fits in with our brand then let us know and we will do our best to source it. Not only Feedback on products, we would love to hear about the design and layout of the site and if there is anything you would like to change. We want to involve you in this process as much as possible! 

Please be aware that some of the products currently displayed on the site may change slightly.



| POSTAGE & PACKAGING |

GentsGear is currently only available to be shipped in the UK, we hope to expand in the future but this depends on how well the campaign goes.

Postage and Packaging is FREE of charge if you spend over £50 in the store otherwise it will cost £5.99. Remember, if you decide that you want to add more to get the FREE shipping then you can pay the additional money via PayPal or Stripe.

This means if you buy the "Gimme", "I Love It" or "Golden Ticket" Perks then you will get free shipping included.



What We Need & What You Get

| LETS TALK MONEY |

So we are aiming to reach £15,000! This is mostly for stock and will get us approximately 30 products for you to choose from on the Website.


Don't worry though! If we don't reach our target, you will still be able to choose from a range of Amazing Products, there just wont be 30 of them :(

On the other hand, if we SMASH our target there will be even more great Products to Choose from and Unthinkable Stretch Goals will be unlocked for everyone!

I have chosen fixed funding. This means if we don't meet the target then everyone will get their money back!


| BREAKDOWN |

If we meet our £15,000 target, then this is where the money will go:

     



| WHAT'S IN IT FOR ME? |

Okay, so this is the good bit... This is what you get for your Contribution! 

If you want to spend a little more when it comes cashing in your voucher then not to worry, you can pay for part of your basket with your Voucher and the remaining balance with an alternative payment method.

REMEMBER: Free shipping on all orders over £50.


| STRETCH GOALS |

Okay, so what are Stretch Goals? For those of you who are unsure, Stretch Goals are what we unlock if you reach more than our £15,000 goal. Even if you invest before a Stretch Goal is reached, you will still get the benefit if unlocked. See details below...

£15,000- This is our Target. If this is reached then the store will be launched and the campaign is successful. 

£20,000- If we can reach this Goal, then we will give everyone another 5% on top of what they have bought. 

£30,000- If we reach this very high Goal, we will give everyone a 10% Voucher off to be used on their second purchase or to give to a friend, its completely up to you.

With each stretch Goal Reached, there will also be a wider variation of items on sale in the GentsGear Store.


Timeframe

| WHEN CAN I SPEND MY VOUCHER? |

The vouchers will be emailed out in October when the Campaign ends and the GentsGear Website will be live in November so you can treat yourself or someone else in time for Christmas.

The Voucher will have a unique code that once entered in your Shopping Basket, will deduct the chosen amount off your Shopping Cart. Your Voucher must be spent all at once and an additional payment can be made if your Basket is higher than the Voucher Value.

| EVENTS & DATES |


| CHALLENGES |

Problem

If we were to reach our £15,000 target then that would be approximately 300 contributions. This means when the shop goes live most of you will spend your voucher quite soon after and we will be bombarded with nearly 300 Orders. 

Solution 

Friend's and Family have already volunteered to help pick, package, label and post the orders so you can recieve them instantly.



| OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP |

If you don't have the money at the minute or just don't want to invest for any reason then that is fine, however, we would like to ask that you share our Campaign with your Friends, Family, Work Buddies, Cats, Dogs, Hamsters, absolutely everyone you can because it costs you nothing and helps us out a great deal! It could also help someone out that you know because they may be looking for a gift for someone or wanting to treat themselves and you can help them get a one off Bargain.

You can do this by Sharing the Campaign through the Social Media Buttons, Email or Word of Mouth. It would be truly appreciated.

Don't forget to like us on Facebook, Follow us on Twitter and Follow us on Instagram yourselves so you can here about any future products, offers and see how we are doing with the Campaign.

Or you don't have to do anything, it's up to you. We cant make you do anything, but anyway thanks for having a look through my Campaign and an even bigger thank you if you invested in or shared!!
story_txt:
GentsGear






Short Summary
Firstly, i want to tell you a little something about myself... 
My name is Sam, i am 19 and i have been an entrepreneur from a very young age. I started back in school by buying sweets from a Wholesale Company, then going Home and making sweet bags to then take in to School the next Day and sell to my friends. I would have people flocking around me as i walked through the gates which was a great feeling as i could see that i had made people happy by giving them something to make their day a little bit better as well as a bit of money in my Pocket so it was a WIN WIN situation and that's what i liked... 
I then moved on to buying and selling on eBay from Wristbands to Clothes and onto other Crazes as time went on. Recently, i started to learn Web Design and have built a few for myself, family and friends and have learnt an awful lot. Since i can remember, I have wanted to have my own website and i have always been a bit of a Gadget Geek as well as having expensive taste meaning i have always wanted the latest Tech.  I have been teaching myself Website Design for nearly 2 years and have learnt an awful lot and wanted to build a Shop as practise (which i did). story:
Businesses get the profit... We get the risk

In exchange for an app or service, we have to trust a business or government to protect and treat our personal data responsibly. It's the deal.

But they collect more data and correlate it with yet more data, then profit from it in ways we never knew. Our private information is the ore for new revenues. We’re raw material. And for it, we get almost nothing.

That invasive profile is supposed to be safe and secure so we’re at least not putting ourselves in danger. But it's not; and we are. Every day another data breach proves that behind closed doors our most valuable secrets are ripe to be exposed. Then it's our problem.

Risk without reward or control?

It’s Unreasonable. Irresponsible. Unfair.

Digital Liberty changes that. We need transparency. Except the digital world is not transparent today. So we have to decide how to protect our own data and how much it's worth. We need to hold onto it and let it be used how we choose.

Slick and convenient user experience masks failing security and data protection. That threatens our safety. And the effects will last a lifetime.

We're putting control back into our hands. We're promoting practices and tools that will make the web work for all, not just businesses. We speak for digital individuals' interests.


Take the Lead

I created Digital Liberty and need your help. Subscribe! If you believe and have the skills and interest to make an impact; join us.

IF YOU BELIEVE, join! The worst thing you can do is know what to do and still do nothing. Don’t let what’s coming just happen. Somebody has to do something: that somebody is us. It’s you.

Digital Liberty is a counterbalance for a fair, reasonable, and responsible web.

Digital Liberty makes the web work for all


Founders get more than a good feeling

We need your help to make Digital Liberty a force. As a Founder, you’ll support action and help give a meaningful voice to people online. That’s important. It’ll be something to brag about later. (“I was there back in ’15… We started this…”)

And your money gets you something of immediate, real value. The small Founder premium will fuel the organization until it runs on its own.

Here’s what you get as a Founder.

We need lots of people to be a force. Bring your skills to the team.

And, SPREAD THE WORD. Our goal is to reach 100-million people with this message.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Forward our links to your contacts and friends.
  • Tweet and retweet @DigLiberty and #DigitalLiberty
  • Favorite our campaign in Facebook.
  • If you’re in the media, show us a little love with some coverage.


    • We love the web, but we’re concerned…

    When a business that's supposed to be all about privacy (Ashley Madison) charges money to delete personal information and then doesn't, how can you ever NOT be SCARED of what's going on behind the computer screen?

    With hacks and invasions by government, it’s no wonder 7 in 10 people are troubled about corporations violating their privacy and 50% are concerned about governments.

    When businesses gather our data to use apps with unreadable usage and protection terms, then use the data in ways we never knew about or expected (or got paid for!), how can you not be ANGRY?

    Still, there is no unified voice for all of us  people overwhelmingly concerned about the state of the web—which we all love and need.

    Why?

    … because it’s not for people; it’s for business.

    Maybe because while the web seems like it’s for people, it’s really a platform for business. It has evolved to satisfy business’s not people’s needs.

    Maybe because nobody’s asks people about the web and digital life that’s changing us—and whether we’re good with that. Nobody’s asked whether you want to have, or offered you the chance to voice concern about your long-term digital future.

    Maybe nobody thinks your data is your property and you’re owed something for it.

    Maybe because businesses like Avid Life (Ashley Madison) think you'll never find out they're not doing what they say.

    Maybe because we’re not people any more; we’re just “users” and “consumers.”

    There's nobody to watch that everyone's digitally doing what they say they’ll do and paying for what they use. So who’s protecting and advancing the interests of digital individuals?


    Make the web work for all…

    …especially People.

    That’s what this campaign is about. About individuals. About the power of a large group. About making the web a respectful and fair place for everyone. It’s about having a meaningful, global standing with the businesses and governments redefining the web.

    To do that, I created Digital Liberty. It’s all of us, representing all of us: the people that use the web, who know it's a basic right. Digital Liberty will be your eyes, your ears, and your voice.

    The web is for everybody, so Digital Liberty will get us to the table to tell and keep telling businesses and governments what people want and need from a digital life.

    Together, we're a force

    A force needs money and people. Size matters. In the future we'll be funded through member subscriptions, sponsorships, and sales of approved privacy and security tools (discounted for members).

    Right now, today, it needs a little money to get going.


    The Digital Liberty Association is ESSENTIAL…

    The world needs Digital Liberty. Especially now. Large organizations do things that others without their access to skills and resource can’t do. They tilt the field to their advantage. And right now, we people on this field are stuck.

    That’s capitalism. That’s good. Creating advantages with special knowledge or resources is business bedrock. Businesses aren’t malicious. They’re doing what they do. AND they are giving you things you say you want.

    …so everyone gets a fair deal.

    Notice how fast the reaction to corporate and government information breaches have been compared to when it’s just people’s information records?

    When businesses profit by exploiting our data, why aren’t we at least asked and compensated?

    Why hasn’t more been done to prevent your new car from being hacked through the web and taken over while you’re driving?


    Consumer commerce needs a counterbalance.

    Capitalism and what businesses do, innovating to create wealth and progress, is awesome. The Digital Liberty has no intention of preventing that.

    But sometimes, new counterbalances are needed for new times. Like when Ralph Nader revealed in his 1965 book, Unsafe at Any Speed, that the automobile industry was not making cars safe for the consumers ("people") who “wanted” them. Sound familiar? The car companies before the late 1960s and digital businesses today don’t have incentive to change. They need a nudge. That’s what Nader did. That’s what the Digital Liberty will do.

    Remember, without consumer push-back in the 1960s, tooling around in your car would be even more dangerous than it is today.

    In 50 years, we need to be able to look back and say we’re safe and fairly treated in our digital lives because in 2015 we pushed back.


    Be a Founder: Subscribe!

    We need you to take a Founder’s subscription during this campaign.

    It’s not a lot: about $20 for a one-year subscription and the perks of being a Founder. With that money, we’ll move ahead.

    “Get Started” Level

    With about 10,000 Founders, providing money and skilled help, we’ll make the website and information aggregator rock; we’ll develop communications, outreach, and development programs for members, Founders, and sympathetic organizations; we’ll kick off a social media program.

    “Let’s Go” threshold

    At about 20,000 Founders, we’ll add staff to start the advocacy programs; push farther with communications/outreach; create a research program; develop educational videos, events, and resources; and implement self-sustaining revenue to be fully operational by year-end.

    “Giddy-up, We’re Serious!” Level

    If lots of people believe this campaign is as important as we do, so there are 50,000 Founders or more, everything will be faster and more effective. We'll put specialists in place and build stronger credibility and standing in newsrooms and boardrooms around the world. We’ll source new tools and processes to take control of our digital lives.

    We need you.

    Join and be a Founder today. A Founder’s subscription is less than cappuccino at Starbucks, but gives you and every other web user so much more.


    Timothy Grayson

    I’ve been involved in information and web technology, digital identity, privacy and cyber-security for a long time. The situation is out of balance. I tilted my small parts of the table.Now I want to correct that imbalance.

    I’m tired of having to second-guess what’s going to happen when I do something online. I can’t understand why I get no choice but to give up all my information blindly for now and forever. And I really don’t like that my property—my data—gets used to make money and I get nothing for it.

    I’ve written and spoken about this in every form imaginable. Blog, Twitter, non-fiction and a novel, essays, podcasts, conferences… We all know fundamentally, you have to trust the environment and those in it. Right now, digitally, we do (sort of) but probably shouldn’t. Together we can change that.

    There are processes that will make it fair. There are tools that will put control back into the hands of the data’s owners. There are changes that could be made that would make the web work for all of us. We need to make them part of the system.


    Challenges to come

    I’m not naïve. There will be resistance from the organizations whose style might be cramped. This could include the companies and brands at the center of the web and mobile world: device makers, app makers, security companies, internet service providers, governments and businesses offering online services, and so on.

    Balance and fairness have a cost.

    They’ll try to ignore and dismiss us. They’ll try to misdirect by refocusing these concerns as something else; by sidestepping these real issues with talk of user experience and convenience; by trying to discredit us. They will try to be louder. (It’s happened before.)

    What will overcome that? Three things.

    1. We all stand together and stand firm for what we believe, need, and want.
    2. We keep our eyes on the real prize.
    3. We don’t stop.


    Founders make the difference

    All that takes people and money. To stand together and firm, you need to join. To keep our eye on the prize, we all need to be represented and know what's really important. To not stop, we need money and help.

    We need lots of subscribers
    We'd love you to bring your skills to the team.

    And, SPREAD THE WORD. Our goal is to reach 100-million people with this message.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Forward our links to your contacts and friends.
  • Tweet and retweet @DigLiberty and #DigitalLiberty
  • Favorite our campaign in Facebook.
  • If you’re in the media, show us a little love with some coverage.

    • You’re part of the future; make it today.

    Subscribe to Digital Liberty.

That’s what this campaign is about. About individuals. About the power of a large group. About making the web a respectful and fair place for everyone. It’s about having a meaningful, global standing with the businesses and governments redefining the web.
To do that, I created Digital Liberty. It’s all of us, representing all of us: the people that use the web, who know it's a basic right. Digital Liberty will be your eyes, your ears, and your voice.
The web is for everybody, so Digital Liberty will get us to the table to tell and keep telling businesses and governments what people want and need from a digital life.
Together, we're a force
A force needs money and people. Size matters. In the future we'll be funded through member subscriptions, sponsorships, and sales of approved privacy and security tools (discounted for members).
Right now, today, it needs a little money to get going.
The Digital Liberty Association is ESSENTIAL…
The world needs Digital Liberty. Especially now. Large organizations do things that others without their access to skills and resource can’t do. They tilt the field to their advantage. And right now, we people on this field are stuck.
That’s capitalism. That’s good. Creating advantages with special knowledge or resources is business bedrock. Businesses aren’t malicious. They’re doing what they do. AND they are giving you things you say you want.
…so everyone gets a fair deal.
Notice how fast the reaction to corporate and government information breaches have been compared to when it’s just people’s information records?
When businesses profit by exploiting our data, why aren’t we at least
asked and compensated?
Why hasn’t more been done to prevent your new car from being hacked through the web and taken over while you’re driving?
Consumer commerce needs a counterbalance.
Capitalism and what businesses do, innovating to create wealth and progress, is awesome. The Digital Liberty has no intention of preventing that.
But sometimes, new counterbalances are needed for new times. Like when Ralph Nader revealed in his 1965 book, Unsafe at Any Speed, that the automobile industry was not making cars safe for the consumers ("people") who “wanted” them. Sound familiar? The car companies before the late 1960s and digital businesses today don’t have incentive to change. They need a nudge. That’s what Nader did. That’s what the Digital Liberty will do.
Remember, without consumer push-back in the 1960s, tooling around in your car would be even more dangerous than it is today.

In 50 years, we need to be able to look back and say we’re safe and fairly treated in our digital lives because in 2015 we pushed back.
Be a Founder: Subscribe!
We need you to take a Founder’s subscription during this campaign.
It’s not a lot: about $20 for a one-year subscription and the perks of being a Founder. With that money, we’ll move ahead.
“Get Started” Level
With about 10,000 Founders, providing money and skilled help, we’ll make the website and information aggregator rock; we’ll develop communications, outreach, and development programs for members, Founders, and sympathetic organizations; we’ll kick off a social media program.
“Let’s Go” threshold
At about 20,000 Founders, we’ll add staff to start the advocacy programs; push farther with communications/outreach; create a research program; develop educational videos, events, and resources; and implement self-sustaining revenue to be fully operational by year-end.
“Giddy-up, We’re Serious!” Level
If lots of people believe this campaign is as important as we do, so there are 50,000 Founders or more, everything will be faster and more effective. We'll put
specialists in place and build stronger credibility and standing in newsrooms and boardrooms around the world. We’ll source new tools and processes to take control of our digital lives.
We need you.
Join and be a Founder today. A Founder’s subscription is less than cappuccino at Starbucks, but gives you and every other web user so much more.
Timothy Grayson
I’ve been involved in information and web technology, digital identity, privacy and cyber-security for a long time. The situation is out of balance. I tilted my small parts of the table.Now I want to correct that imbalance.
I’m tired of having to second-guess what’s going to happen when I do something online. I can’t understand why I get no choice but to give up all my information blindly for now and forever. And I really don’t like that my property—my data—gets used to make money and I get nothing for it.
I’ve written and spoken about this in every form imaginable. Blog, Twitter, non-fiction and a novel, essays, podcasts, conferences… We all know fundamentally, you have to trust the environment and those in it. Right now, digitally, we do (sort of) but probably shouldn’t. Together we can change that.
There are processes that will make it fair. There are tools that will put control back into the hands of the data’s owners. There are changes that could be made that would make the web work for all of us. We need to make them part of the system.
Challenges to come
I’m not naïve. There will be resistance from the organizations whose style might be cramped. This could include the companies and brands at the center of the web and mobile world: device makers, app makers, security companies, internet service providers, governments and businesses offering online services, and so on.
Balance and fairness have a cost.
They’ll try to ignore and dismiss us. They’ll try to misdirect by refocusing these concerns as something else; by sidestepping these real issues with talk of user experience and convenience; by trying to discredit us. They will try to be louder. (It’s happened before.)
What will overcome that? Three things.

We all stand together and stand firm for what we believe, need, and want.
We keep our eyes on the real prize.

We don’t stop.


Founders make the difference
All that takes people and money. To stand together and firm, you need to join. To keep our eye on the prize, we all need to be represented and know what's really important. To not stop, we need money and help.
We need lots of subscribers
We'd love you to bring your skills to the team.
And, SPREAD THE WORD. Our goal is to reach 100-million people with this message.


Use the Indiegogo share tools.
Forward our links to your contacts and friends.
Tweet and retweet @DigLiberty and #DigitalLiberty
Favorite our campaign in Facebook.
If you’re in the media, show us a little love with some coverage.

You’re part of the future; make it today.
Subscribe to Digital Liberty.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

My name is Mosline Farawu, I am a mentor and life coach. I live in Zimbabwe, Africa. All my life I have dreamt of assisting women of all walks of life but especially the marginalized women to free themselves from poverty, abuse and pain.

Together with a few like-minded women, we have formed a women's group and started a community project to teach women life skills and self- help projects. Our mission is to build Centres for women’s healing and empowerment with a vision to see women from all walks of life transformed through finding their true purpose in life; finding healing from pains and burdens inflicted over a lifetime of existence and by being empowered to tap into their full potential.

What We Need & What You Get:

  • A local church has agreed to house us temporarily, however;

    Going forward we need to:

    1. Buy a piece of land

    2. Build a shed where women can meet and carry out their activities

    3. Install fencing/security wall and other facilities

    Later we can raise funds to erect a functional building with all facilities and amenities required.

    The Impact

 Women have traditionally been regarded as second class citizens in most African countries, although there has been some progress made in some countries including Zimbabwe to uplift their status. Culture also plays a major role in the discrimination against women and girls. Your contribution will go a long way in helping uplift the lives of women

We have successfully since the beginning of 2015 brought women together to create bonding and friendship, to build a culture of trust and promote collaboration. We seek to build upon that foundation to introduce healing and empowerment programs.


You will be recognised among the visionaries who have realised that empowering women positively impacts the world and brings harmony to our earth.

   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel called to assist but cannot financially contribute, then we will still appreciate your help in getting the word out and linking us with the right people. Any technical assistance would also be useful. We still honour the visionary in you.

story:
Update: We are looking into a steel building from Gensteel, they have a whole design services where, they deal with zoning and floorplan, and all the ends and out, we have several potential places for land.  To get started with the Design Process we need 6900, and a down for land at the very least.  Please if every one was able to only give 100, we could be very close to what we need to just start the process.  

Hey everyone, my name is Ray Parga and I own del Valle Gunsmithing, I’ve owned the business since 2004 when I bought it from Jaime del Valle, whom I apprenticed under. Originally based in Carmel Valley CA and there for 22 years, I realized that I was going to have to change location to be more centralized on the Monterey Peninsula. Moving into Marina in 2009 I quickly saw the potential for expansion and did so again in 2014. Since then, more and more customers ask if I have a range and if I did, how great it would be. Well now, it is time for the next evolution of del Valle Gunsmithing. As much as I’d prefer to make this happen on my own, logistically and fiscally it’s just not possible so I turn to donors to help make it happen. Our goal in this drive is to raise the funds to cover the price for a parcel of property that we can build on, permits and the like. From there we will get a construction loan and start the building process. If we do not reach our goal in the allotted time then all funds will be returned in full to each donor. This is an important aspect to this drive that I specifically was looking for.

We established some great perks for anyone who is kind enough to help us accomplish this dream, and help us establish a great range in the heart of the Monterey Peninsula. There is a chance to shoot at the range for 24 hours, or 2 hours time with the gunsmith.  You can get a hat or a polo shirt. We are giving you all the opportunity to get memberships to the range from Lifetime to 1 year.   

We plan to make the range available to local police departments for qualifications during hours that most ranges are closed to accommodate police officers who work swings or midnights by appointment. This in turn, results in less overtime costs by making a range available at times when ranges are usually closed. It also helps in officer safety since those officers who work midnights would otherwise loose sleep by having to be at the range during range qualification days. Another aspect we want to bring to the table quality firearms training, CCW training and qualifications. Often times it is difficult finding quality instructors. Our training would teach students familiarity, maintenance, marksmanship, manipulative skills, accuracy, and in the case of CCW training, surviving.  I am an FBI certified instructor and have been shooting since I was a kid.  I have had the opportunitnity as a reserve for a local police department to be a part of many training situations from some highly respected people in the business such as Gunsite, ITTS, Larry Vickers, and Operational Skills Group just to name a few. 

We are a family run business, that has gone from a one man operation to having two full time employees, and one occasional employee, we are hoping to add three full time employee and one part time employee once we open the range.  

The risks we take are not getting suitable land, or permits or being blocked in building a range, we are particularly looking at Marina because we have a good rapport with the Marina police department and surrounding police departments, we already are located in Marina and believe the hurdles will be less in a town that is already accepting of our business.  Marina is also centrally located and an easy drive from Santa Cruz, Salinas, and Monterey.  This will benefit the Monterey Peninsula in having a local gun range, with good hours, available lanes, and training opportunities. 

If you are unable to support us finacially, we encourage you to share our efforts with anyone you know.  You can also contact us with any help you can offer as far as construction, permits, architecture, plan designs, etc.  If you just share and wish us luck getting the word out, is also helpful in achieving our dream.

story:
What is Technology Refurbishment?

It is a service that recycles old pieces of Tech and recreates it into something that can be used today. Growing up I always used to pull apart computers and amps and rebuild them, all the old parts lying around the house used to drive my mum nuts when she was trying to clean up the house. The idea is to stop old circuit boards from being chemically dismantled which is not that great on the environment and since they get shipped to other countries for very little cost its not that great on our economy either. By keeping the recycling local it strengthens our economy, lowers the need for manufacturing and hopefully builds an industry where we can handle this type of recycling ourselves.

How it works.

We will offer a service where we drive to businesses or houses and recover peoples old technology for free. Technology which otherwise would have ended up being broken down chemically or in the worst case, ended up in the council tip.

After recovering the parts we will then disassemble them by hand and sort them, after sorting we will check the parts to see what is in working condition and try to re-purpose those parts by installing them in other computers, monitors. Trying to make custom items for people at a lower cost then they would normally be able to buy them.

What the service needs.

So this is where you come in, the startup costs are very low but what needs to be covered is advertising, a way to reach people to let them know of our service and be the first option for people trying to dispose of electronic waste.

Any funding above advertising costs will then go towards a new vehicle to pick up the waste, a storage location for excess and eventually being able to pay additional employees who would have more specialties then myself.

At the moment I have expertise enough to refurbish computers, phones, audio equipment and monitors, I would however like to get people on board who can handle printers, networking and CRT, Plasma TVs.

How can I help?

You can help by donating but in the case where you like the idea but don't feel like or can't afford to send a contribution then I would appreciate you sharing my page on social media. Contacting me if you have any old technology you would like removed or even any ideas you might have about this project.

This service is only possible with your help which is why I am trying out a crowdfunding platform. Test the waters to see if there is space for this service, if people want it, will use it, or even if they are just excited to be able to buy cheaper refurbished goods. If I don't make my target goal then I will still be doing this as a hobby but it will only be to the immediate suburbs around me. It won't really impact much without some help.

story:
Are you tired of wasting time and money looking for a place to park? We sure are! We want to help as many people as possible with one of their everyday problems. So we came up with a plan to solve the parking problems, many of us face every day. 

It quickly became apparent that the challenge is this: We need to know with certainty if a spot is empty or not. This can only be achieved with sensors and only if they are installed both in paid and free parking spots. For that to happen, at a quick pace, we will offer the sensors installed to the cities for free.

Drivers will pay a small fee in the order of 50 cents to one dollar, every time they use the sensor information to locate a parking spot. The entire system will be funded by the users. Just imagine how much time and money you spend driving around, looking for a spot. Compare this to a fee of 50 cents to a dollar and you get the idea.

Our goal is to make the system self-sufficient in power by utilising battery power for the sensors and a mix of battery and solar power to drive the network itself. The system will be a stand alone system, so the cities won't have to do anything to integrate it. They can manage everything from an iPad.

To pull this off, we are contracting with the team at Chaotic Moon Studios of Austin Texas (check them out at www.chaoticmoon.com). These guys are experts, not only in app development, but also in the art of software-hardware integration. They have numerous acclaimed apps under their belt, but first and foremost, they excel in approaching problems with out of the box solutions.



To manage the project will be me, Morten Zillmer. Officer and aircraft Commander in the Royal Danish Airforce. With several years of education and training from the worlds leading airforces, in everything from management to communication, and practical application experience in let's just say, lesser developed, and less friendly regions, all over the world, I would say, I am not totally estranged to managing challeging projects . 


Funding

Why the 2 million as target? That amount is the bare minimum, we need to produce the software and two batches of sensors which we will install in the EU and the US at the same time. Besides Indiegogo fee, travel expenses and general lunch money, that is the only thing the funding will be spent on. No crazy salaries or things of that nature. Extra funding will go directly into extra sensors.

In case we don't reach our goal, the funding will be returned to you guys.


Perks

Sorry guys.....no cups or t-shirts. What you do get though is your money back in form of free use of our parking system, in the same amount that you pledged. So, if you pledged 10$, you will gain free use of the system 10-20 times depending of the initial fee. But lets be realistic, if you don't live in one of the two launch cities, this may take a while. But please continue reading.


The Impact

The target of this campaign is to determine if our approach will be accepted by you, the drivers. Establish procedures for installation and deployment, but those are targets..... If this works, the impact will be huge. We will have a parking business model ready to be rolled out to any city, anywhere. After all, this is no fun if the campaign only pays for two smaller cities being equipped with sensors. We need the sensors deployed everywhere in a rapid self fuelled expansion.


Risks and challenges

We foresee five different axes of challenges in this particular project.

1.  Hardware challenges. The sensors we plan to install will have to contain electronics capable of operating under extreme conditions like temperatures and pressure. On top of that it must be able to sense and communicate using an absolute minimum amount of power in order to conserve the on board battery power. These factors are in themselves obstacles. But we are pretty certain, we can overcome them. Why?...because it has been done before by a number of companies. If they can do it, so can we. 

2.  The cities. Our customers are, of course, you guys parking your cars. But the streets, you park in are mostly owned by the city, and we need their permission to install our hardware. We need to convince the cities of the fact that our solution is the future. Two things working for us here. First, there are thousands of cities, so if one doesn't like the idea, or is hesitant, it is on to the next one. Second. We will install everything at no cost to the city. It will be installed for free. We are pretty sure this will be a big motivator.

3.  Software. If you ever operated an app on a smart phone, you know that a flawlessly working app is a bliss. Bliss however is hard. We need to make the interface as simple as humanly possible. To achieve this, we are contracting with the techies at Chaotic Moon. Judging from their previous work, we are certain they are the best to get the job done.

4.  Finance. What we are pledging for will cover software and hardware for a limited batch of sensors. This batch will serve as seed for a hopefully successful business model. However, if the public adaptation of the system does not accelerate at the same pace as production of new batches of sensors, we may have to seek capital from seed investors. Of course, all this is dependent of exactly how much is pledged in the initial Indiegogo campaign.

5.  You guys are our last challenge. As of writing, we really have no idea if you, the customer, will like the project. We are talking about changing peoples habits in how they park their cars. And that is a very tough challenge. But let's put it this way. If you will fund it, this means we at the very least have your attention, and by that a good indication of whether or not you are willing to change your parking habits.


The stuff in fine print

Look, we are not going to blow sunshine up your most elevated body part when you are picking strawberries. This project, like any other, will face headwinds. Over the years various, startups have tried and failed on a number of crowdfunding sites. This campaign, like all the others, have a high risk of failing. It's just the nature of startups. I would hate for anyone contributing to this campaign, not to understand this fact. 

And on that little happy note, that's really all there is to it. Any support will be hugely appreciated. If you are not ready to support financially, please help us create a buzz around this campaign and share using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for your time.

This can only be achieved with sensors and only if they are installed both in paid and free parking spots. For that to happen, at a quick pace, we will offer the sensors installed to the cities for free.
Drivers will pay a small fee in the order of 50 cents to one dollar, every time they use the sensor information to locate a parking spot. The entire system will be funded by the users. Just imagine how much time and money you spend driving around, looking for a spot. Compare this to a fee of 50 cents to a dollar and you get the idea.
Our goal is to make the system self-sufficient in power by utilising battery power for the sensors and a mix of battery and solar power to drive the network itself. The system will be a stand alone system, so the cities won't have to do anything to integrate it. They can manage everything from an iPad.
To pull this off, we are contracting with the team at Chaotic Moon Studios of Austin Texas (check them out at www.chaoticmoon.com). These guys are experts, not only in app development, but also in the art of software-hardware integration. They have numerous acclaimed apps under their belt, but first and foremost, they excel in approaching problems with out of the box solutions.




To manage the project will be me, Morten Zillmer. Officer and aircraft Commander in the Royal Danish Airforce. With several years of education and training from the worlds leading airforces, in everything from management to communication, and practical application experience in let's just say, lesser developed, and less friendly regions, all over the world, I would say, I am not totally estranged to managing challeging projects . 



Funding
Why the 2 million as target? That amount is the bare minimum, we need to produce the software and two batches of sensors which we will install in the EU and the US at the same time. Besides Indiegogo fee, travel expenses and general lunch money, that is the only thing the funding will be spent on. No crazy salaries or things of that nature. Extra funding will go directly into extra sensors.
In case we don't reach our goal, the funding will be returned to you guys.

Perks
Sorry guys.....no cups or t-shirts. What you do get though is your money back in form of free use of our parking system, in the same amount that you pledged. So, if you pledged 10$, you will gain free use of the system 10-20 times depending of the initial fee. But lets be realistic, if you don't live in one of the two launch cities, this may take a while. But please continue reading.

The Impact
The target of this campaign is to determine if our approach will be accepted by you, the drivers. Establish procedures for installation and deployment, but those are targets..... If this works, the impact will be huge. We will have a parking business model ready to be rolled out to any city, anywhere. After all, this is no fun if the campaign only pays for two smaller cities being equipped with sensors. We need the sensors deployed everywhere in a rapid self fuelled expansion.

Risks and challenges

We foresee five different axes of challenges in this particular project.
1.  Hardware challenges. The sensors we plan to install will have to contain electronics capable of operating under extreme conditions like temperatures and pressure. On top of that it must be able to sense and communicate using an absolute minimum amount of power in order to conserve the on board battery power. These factors are in themselves obstacles. But we are pretty certain, we can overcome them. Why?...because it has been done before by a number of companies. If they can do it, so can we. 
2.  The cities. Our customers are, of course, you guys parking your cars. But the streets, you park in are mostly owned by the city, and we need their permission to install our hardware. We need to convince the cities of the fact that our solution is the future. Two things working for us here. First, there are thousands of cities, so if one doesn't like the idea, or is hesitant, it is on to the next one. Second. We will install everything at no cost to the city. It will be installed for free. We are pretty sure this will be a big motivator.
3.  Software. If you ever operated an app on a smart phone, you know that a flawlessly working app is a bliss. Bliss however is hard. We need to make the interface as simple as humanly possible. To achieve this, we are contracting with the techies at Chaotic Moon. Judging from their previous work, we are certain they are the best to get the job done.
4.  Finance. What we are pledging for will cover software and hardware for a limited batch of sensors. This batch will serve as seed for a hopefully successful business model. However, if the public adaptation of the system does not accelerate at the same pace as production of new batches of sensors, we may have to seek capital from seed investors. Of course, all this is dependent of exactly how much is pledged in the initial Indiegogo campaign.
5.  You guys are our last challenge. As of writing, we really have no idea if you, the customer, will like the project. We are talking about changing peoples habits in how they park their cars. And that is a very tough challenge. But let's put it this way. If you will fund it, this means we at the very least have your attention, and by that a good indication of whether or not you are willing to change your parking habits.

The stuff in fine print
Look, we are not going to blow sunshine up your most elevated body part when you are picking strawberries. This project, like any other, will face headwinds. Over the years various, startups have tried and failed on a number of crowdfunding sites. This campaign, like all the others, have a high risk of failing. It's just the nature of startups. I would hate for anyone contributing to this campaign, not to understand this fact. 
And on that little happy note, that's really all there is to it. Any support will be hugely appreciated. If you are not ready to support financially, please help us create a buzz around this campaign and share using the Indiegogo share tools.
Thank you for your time.

story:
Who am I?

My name is Heather, I am 33 years old and I am the owner of The Little Cheesecake Company in the town of Simcoe, Ontario.

With the help of my super generous and flexible fiance, Myles, I operate a food truck every weekend year round- yes, even in the snow!

We currently offer over 70 flavours of individually sized cheesecakes both sweet and savoury. From Coconut Cream to Chipotle & Blue Cheese. You can check out photos of some of our flavours on our website www.littlecheesecakecompany.com

(Hors D'oeuvres size Chocolate Explosion Cheesecakes)

The Little Cheesecake Company began in 2010 with lots of passion, excitement, and very little budget. This meant lots of firsts and adventures. From buying a 20 year old former military vehicle on e-bay in California and spending the next week on the road trip of our lives - squealing through each curve of the Rocky Mountains, a detour to the Grand Canyon of course, and missing the 4 corners monument operating hours by a matter of minutes, to having the truck exported, then imported all in the same night, one that ended with a border agent, who was, hand-to-God, named "Reamer" helping us finally accomplish our goal.

I'm here today with another goal. One that I need your help with. If a sufficiently scary man named Reamer, in Detroit, can help me, I'm hopeful that you can too.

People tell me nearly every day that I "have to  go on The Dragon's Den", or try crowdfunding to get new locations open.... since I cannot stomach the idea of Kevin O'Leary owning a 51% share of my company, I come to you...

If everyone who shares our link, or clicks through contributed just $1, we would be more than halfway to our goal after only 3 days!

I Need a Kitchen. 

Since the creation of The Little Cheesecake Company, I have been renting a kitchen on a day to day basis from a local charitable group. This creates an incredible lack of efficiency due to the need to haul all bake ware, ingredients, completed product, etc... in and out of the location with each visit, and limiting my hours to match those of the organization. Having a dedicated kitchen space to work in, at any hour, would provide me with extra time to focus on product development and expanding our market.

The impact a dedicated kitchen would have is huge. Imagine that every day when you got up to go to work, you  had to empty out your entire closet and refrigerator, bring it all with you, decide what to wear, prepare your meals for the day, then haul it all back at the end of the day, without a wrinkle or speck on it all while observing health and safety standards, not spoiling any food or spilling a drop.

Not fun or practical.

With your help, I can achieve the goal of moving into a permanent location. Because of our connections in the industry, we have been able to acquire a lot of the commercial equipment that we will need to outfit our own kitchen space. Our long term goal is to build a kitchen space complete with a cafe in our present truck location, and free up the truck to be on-the-road more frequently.

If our campaign allows it, we will do it now. If not, we will happily install a shipping container kitchen on the property and grind it out until we can achieve our goal.

(On location for the annual Taste of Glenhyrst event in Brantford, ON. watch out for sun glare!)

Visibility. 

As I mentioned above, we had an unpleasant experience with our "paint guy" - of one month overdue and double the estimate sort. This left us with neither time, nor budget to complete the vehicle wrap before our grand opening. To this day, our dark blue former military vehicle lacks all promotional material or branding other than a simple VistaPrint banner that reads "The Little Cheesecake Co." affixed with heavy duty magnets. During the winter of 2013 this banner blew away for a couple of months and mysteriously found it's way home in the spring (we bought better magnets). It became a subject of local pride if you knew what that "big blue wagon by the funeral home" was for. Location, location, location!

So, yes, signage that can't blow away would be incredibly helpful.

A debit/credit machine, and Bitcoin reception would also be a nice addition.

"What's in it for me?"

What we would like to offer you in exchange for your support - cheesecakes of course! It's what we do best. Our Cheesecakes have won every dessert and food competition we've ever entered. We've even picked up a couple of awards for our overall format and look. From single cakes, to full wedding dessert service, to the Platinum Ticket for Cheesecake for Life, cheesecake Thank-You's will abound!

For our out of area contributors, or non-cheesecake lovers (gasp!) we will offer a range of Little Cheesecake Company inspired merchandise, including custom sized, hand made satin bow ties, made by yours truly, to match the ones we wear on the truck . Don't worry, instructions for proper tying will be included!

So, if we are a thriving, award winning company, why do we need your help? Debt load. We spent 2 years developing, planning, outfitting, obtaining permits and inspections, with plenty of obstacles and mistakes along the way. We opened 6 months later than our target date and time is money. We have at this point extended ourselves as far as we are willing to go, and without expanding we risk the inability to remain operational.

During recent years our town has been hit hard. From the fall of the tobacco farming industry, the closure of an Ontario Power Generation plant, Stelco/US Steel issues, to the seemingly complete clear out of our downtown flagship stores. We refuse to give up, we fight on and adapt. In the place of our now absent power plant, solar and wind farms have popped up. Where tobacco once grew, we now see wineries and lavender farms, and small business owners, like me, who have dug in their heels for the long haul. We have an amazing local community that knows the value of a homegrown mom and pop shop. We strive to continue to be one of the many success stories, and aim to pump jobs back into our local community.

(Myles and Heather (shown with crooked bow tie) receiving first prize "Best Overall Booth" from Chantal Z. following local annual food & wine show)

What happens if we don't make our goal? We trudge on, we compromise our integrity, put our baby at risk, call on Mr. O'Leary and sell out. Not really, we take what we are able to raise with your help, do what we can, and if we must, present it to the bank with the hope that they are willing to help us get the rest of the way to where we need to be.

If we exceed our goal? Big party at our place. Free cheesecakes for everyone who contributed even a dollar, or couldn't contribute but shared our link so that others could. Every bit helps, and we appreciate anything you do to help further our cause.

So please, give if you can, and if you can't- make some noise! Share a link, tell a friend, 6 degrees of separation go a long way!

Find us on Facebook

Follow us on Twitter

story:
Как вы наверное знаете, помимо Ума Палат я регулярно организую большие интеллектуальные фестивали (Vilnius Open, Хорошо Отдохнём, Memel Cup, Кубок Шобли и.т.д). К большому сожалению найти спонсоров для подобных мероприятий практически невозможно, как и вытащить в одиночку бюджет или одними взносами.

Поэтому я начинаю эту компанию, а взамен предлагаю множество плюшек и удобных бонусов для тех кто любит играть в мои игры. Так что поучавствовав в этой компании вы сможете не только помочь мне и дальше делать крутые ивенты, но и сэкономите на участии в любимых играх ;)

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
